“Gotta… huff… C-Continue…” Fontina wheezed as she used her hand to prop herself on the nearby wall in order to make sure that she would fall over. “Gotta… Lose… *wheeze*… Weight…”

Hunger and fatigue weren’t her only opponents in this race against weight though, there was a dry feeling in Fontina’s throat that was binding her down slightly as well.

Oh, if only she had a glass of water to quench that dreadful thirst of hers… Or any clean liquid would do at this point.

Luck seemed to smile down on Fontina, for as she continued her slow work out, the young Moemon neared a familiar door that had a simple plaque on it that read ‘Break Room’. Just seeing that sign on the door made Fontina’s eyes brighten up behind her glasses and empower her slightly to increase her slow pace towards it. “M-Maybe I can… G-Get something to d-d-drink there…”

A few more moments later (although to Fontina, it seemed to be hours), Fontina had her hands wrapped around the door’s knob and began to turn, not noticing the sweet, warm smell that was lofting from the door. Her thirst was dulling the young moemon’s senses.

And even when she opened the door, Fontina’s vision only focused on what she was looking for originally – A large water cooler that sat deep into the room. “WATER!”

Running straight into the room, Fontina made a mad dash for the water cooler and immediately poured herself a small cup of water and downed it.

And then downed another cup of water.

And another…

And another…

And another…

This continued until…

“AH!” Fontina sighed with a large smile on her face as she tossed the paper cup into a nearby trashcan. “I really, really needed that. Next time I go for a jog I should… Really remember… to… bring a water… Bottle…”

With her dehydration finally cured, Fontina finally realized something about the room she was standing in. Although it was an average break room with a table, counter, water cooler, couch, a fridge and a television, there was something else in the room. Stacked on the table, counter, couch and even on the floor were several boxes of donuts – Swinub Sweets’ doughnuts to be exact.

The warm smell of the donuts alerted Fontina’s nose that the sugary treats were definitely fresh, for a moment, Fontina’s mouth watered…

“No!” Fontina scolded herself as she gulped. “If I eat any of those then…”

Unfortunately for Fontina, her softer stomach was arguing with her, having been denied breakfast and forced to deal with a torturous jog around the mansion was more than enough!

Fontina sighed loudly, “Well… Only one. One can’t hurt.”
111132112112221211122122.title: Sweet Temptation

choices: Ali takes her back to the room for recouperation (and gloats about Walker>:D)
She takes her by the infermary, deeming it more serious and in need of antacids
1111321121122212111221221.content:
One hour or needlessly excessive gluttony later, Fontina was certainly feeling the effects that eating too much can have on one's body. Laying on the provided couch in an uncharacteristically sprawled out fashion, one leg fell off to the side while one laid on top of the arm; her own arm flopping uselessly in the same fasion of her suspended leg while the other one lay atop her stomach, letting her hand fall down to touch the side of her sweaty side and brush against the fabric of her top.

Somehow, Fontina managed to work up much more of a sweat stuffing herself than she did in her exercise regimend. On top of already being out of breath, Fontina's second wind had apparantly come and gone during the feast, leaving her truly exhausted as she lay there (for the first time) mindlessly. She had actually broken the smarts out of her brain with the contradicting compound of stuffing herself silly and working out. In her fear of getting fat, she had in fact set herself up for quite the horrendous fall from her dietary perch.

Fontina looked down to see her swollen paunch, quite full and raised to a very high altitude; almost as if dinner from the night before had repeated itself. Her hand raised and rested atop her belly, making sure to touch it tenderly so as to not upset its delicate equalibrium. Despite her best efforts, the young moemon still winced at the sharp pain that sparked underneath her skin, her wheezing getting sharper out of fear. If she ever ate again, Fontina was very certain she might explode...

Suddenly her ears caught the sound of the doorknob, breaking the silence that she had created in the staff's rec room. The old tumbler activated and the springs whined to reveal none other than her best friend Ali, who had a bag at her side, guided by the large Dewgong Moemon Claire. "Oh my..." the white haired maid covered her mouth in shock as she observed the warzone that Fontina had left the Staff's Break Room. She wasn't mad, not at all (in fact, it seemed like this bubbly behemoth never got mad at anything!) but merely concerned for her guest's wellbeing. "Ms. Fanta, are you alright?" she waddled over to the couch and rustled the misaddressed moemon's shoulder.

"Ohhh!!" Fontina roared in pain, like the persian with a thorn in its paw Claire had done the smallest thing to upset her wellbeing- despite her better intentions. Ali snorted, "Jeez Fontina, you really packed it away!" the Quilava moemon giggled as she too came to her friend's side, "I guess you won't be needing this breakfast that I painstakingly ceran-wrapped for you then, huh?" she teased. The mere mention of food (not sight, Fontina didn't quite have the energy to look down just yet) made the young vaporeon girl want to weep. Or vomit. She wasn't quite sure, maybe a little bit of both?

"Alright, come on." Ali offered a helping hand, literally and figuratively as her outstretched arm held out an open palm for Fontina to grab. Which she couldn't, she tried, but Fontina's taut tummy took too much energy away from her to coordinate any sort of strenuous movement. "Oh come on, you could at least grab!" Ali whined, upset at having to grab the sweaty girl's lax appendage when she could very well do it herself. "Ew. You're all sticky." Ali teased, hoisting her up. "Ohhh!!" Fontina let out her signature cry, Ali's sudden jerking had sent many waves of pain through her aquatic being, and she definately let everyone know it.

"Oh stop being a big baby or no breakfast for you!" Ali patronized her dazed friend, "Hey, and when we get you laying down boy have I got a story to tell you!" she giggled ecstatically.

Fontina, though almost completely out of it, was concious enough to understand what was going on... for the most part. She knew that Ali wasn't ignoring her plight. Ali was simply doing her job, helping her friend out without any serious complaining, since Fontina would certainly do the same for her. And what's better, with a smile on her face and ready to make Fontina laugh (even if it would probably kill her right now to have her belly surge up and down like that) that's one of the things she really liked about Ali, she was a good friend. Not just to her, but even to Midnight... when the situation called for it. And as her fiery friend hoisted up her no doubt heavier frame, she caught her smiling and laughing even as she struggled.

"Man you're heavy." Ali quipped, "Maybe you shouldn't eat that breakfast I saved for you..."

"Ohh!!" Fontina wailed

"I'll just begin cleaning up in here then?" Claire, though ditzy, caught it too. She knew how wonderful the friendship that Ali and Fontina shared was, and it made the moemon smile. Because she could see it, clear as day, those two were the best of friends. And her sympathy would have been plainly obvious... had it not been for the chocolate frosting around her plump full lips as she "cleaned" the rec room; sitting her plump posterior down on one of the (squished, now) boxes and quietly munched on a couple of donuts.

"THAT'S NOT CLEANING!!"
1111321121122212111221221.title: Discovered Dietary Destruction

choices: Ali and Midnight fight! Breaking a certain vase in the process...
As the fight goes on, Fontina realizes that she's growing slightly puffier...
11113211211222121112212212.content:
The painful groans of Fontina echoed through the mansion as she leaned on her shorter friend for support. Managing to find some information from the gorging Claire, the duo were on their way towards the second floor infirmary. Ali was a little in the middle of this situation, on one hand, she was more than willing to help her good friend in her dire need of painful gluttony, but the other part of her was wanting to tell her glasses wearing friend about the secret she learned only an hour ago.

Although, thinking about it some more, Ali figured that if Fontina knew of Walker’s true gender, there was a good chance that Fontina would tell the egotistical Midnight (Especially since Midnight was so gung-ho about flirting with the dark Moemon).

“A-Ali…”

Then again, if she kept this to herself, then Ali would be able to have the joke all to herself and watch the dark Moemon make a complete fool of herself!

“Ali, I think we’re…”

But on the flipside of that, if it was revealed that Walker was a girl and that Ali knew that fact, it would probably end badly for.

“ALI!”

The slightly puffy Quilava Moemon blinked a few times as her digesting friend’s loud moan, “Uh, yeah?”

“We’re here,” Fontina pointed out to her friend as she pointed towards a nearby door that had a Chansey sticker on it that held a sign that read ‘Infirmary’.

“Oh!” Ali muttered out loud with her red cheeks turning red slightly. “S-Sorry about that.”

“Don’t worry about it, just thanks for helping me get here,” Fontina grunted, still wincing from the tightness in her belly. “I’ll… I’ll only be a minute, I’m just going to get an antacid or two… Or six…”

Ali nodded as she watched her friend inch into the room, “You might want to get some more for later though!”

The door closed behind Fontina, making Ali sigh loudly as she leaned up against the nearby wall. That’s when the young Quilava Moemon realized that she still held onto the bag filled with cold, one hour leftovers from breakfast. “Ugh, I doubt that Fontina would want to eat this stuff now.”

Just as Ali was about to open the bag to check on the food, a small gleam of light moved into her eyes, making her squint slightly as she lifted her hand up. “What the?”

Stepping out of the light, Ali spotted the cause of the light – A beautiful emerald green vase that had several carvings that depicted several dragons on it. It seemed to have some jewels embedded into it as well, and for some reason, Ali was drawn to the weird vase to look at it.

Keeping some distance from it, Ali admired the vase – Noticing that it was well crafted. “Wow, this place must be full of rare stuff like this…”

“Wow, I knew that you admired curves,” a familiar snarky voice cooed behind Ali, making the small girl jump slightly. “But now you’re admiring a vase? That’s just sad you little mouse.”

Ali spun around, seeing Midnight standing behind Ali, her hands placed on her trimmed hips (which seemed to be a bit curvier and sunk a little bit into the Mightyena’s skin a bit more than usual). There was also a small stain of chocolate around Midnight’s mouth, but Ali didn’t really notice that. “So, I take it you haven’t found Fontina yet? Or were you planning on stealing her breakfast as well?”

“Not now, you dog,” Ali huffed as she crossed her arms. “I don’t want to deal with your attitude.”

“Oh cry me a river, you water-phobic wimp,” Midnight barked back. “You’re not the only one who has to deal with crap! I keep trying my best material with that sweet piece Walker, but it’s not having any effect on him!”

“Heh, maybe he doesn’t swing that way?” Ali snickered with a devious grin on her face.

“And what would you know about picking up guys?” Midnight snarled leaning forward (much to the distaste of her slightly puffy tummy) to leer at Ali in the eyes. “You’re so flat that people either mistake you for a guy or as a little kid! Guys love a real woman with curves in the right place!”

“You wanna say that again?” Ali growled, seriously not liking Midnight’s attitude right now.

“Oh, what’s wrong?” Midnight cooed mockingly as she stood up straight. “Is the little girl going to cry?”

“THAT’S IT!”
11113211211222121112212212.title: A Friend in Need

choices: But of course, Shera is willing to let them stay... if they work off their debt.
111132112112221211122122121.content:
Ali blindly attacked the older moemon, much like she did said older moemon's crush only an hour or so ago. However things would turn out differently this time, because despite being strong and old enough to become a Mightyena moemon, Midnight was still pretty wimpy. Ali took pride in the fact that, without any of her underhanded tricks anyway, she could hand Midnight's ass to her any day of the week!

She lunged at her soft middle head first, hands bared in a startling fashion as Ali headbutt Midnight right in the stomach. Midnight wheezed, letting out a long gasp of air as the dark hair around her face was lifted by the breeze. She went stumbling backwards from Ali's punch, understandably panting after getting the wind knocked out of her. "Ha... little body... little- little punches!" Midnight teased, trying to hold back any hurt feelings (or stomachs for that matter) and appear superior. "WHY YOU!!" Ali grunted, charging at her again.

This time, Midnight just moved out of the way of the teeny-weeny locomotive speeding her way; even going so far as to laugh haughtilly as she sped off in the wrong direction. "Come on Pipsqueak, I'm right here!" she growled, smacking her ass tauntingly. Ali fumed, "Y-You bitch!!" she cried, feeling the blood vessels in the back of her eyes strain. She stomped forward once again, only for Midnight to move right out of the way without any difficulty; also coming close to knocking-

"I got the antacids..." Fontina said warilly as she stepped out of the infermary, only to be greeted with a very familiar sight- Ali and Fontina scrapping yet again. "Oh... come on guys... I'm not in the mood right now." Fontina pleaded. But it was no use, the two were too far gone. "I'm not fighting." Midnight yawned innocently, "Cheese-for-Brains is the one who wanted to fight." The vein in Ali's head nearly exploded, "WHO DO YOU THINK YOU'RE FOOLING YOU DOG-BREATHED SKANK?!"

Again, she charged futiley at Midnight who again just meandered right out of the way. "I." she shouted, finally grabbing her by the lusciously tan arm, "AM." she screamed, twisting it, "TIRED." Ali barked as Midnight rose to her feet, "OF." she hissed as the Mighteyena moemon got a good punch in, "YOU!!" she cried, getting in a good punch herself... just on a silver-white podium holding a certain vase.

All three of them watched, save for Fontina who was far too under the weather to really care right now, as the no doubt priceless vase teetered like a Spinda moemon on the flat pedestal. It wobbled in a circular fashion, already moved slightly with all the vibrations Ali and Midnight had caused, and threatened to tip over and shatter into countless little pieces all over the floor. Thankfully, Ali was able to catch it before her own knock-out punch sent it tumbling to the floor.

"Whew..." she sighed, placing it precariously back onto its rightful spot. Time seemed to have stopped, even their fight (whos predecessors were uncaring and violent to everything) had ceased in order to ensure the sanctity of that vase. "That was close." Midnight shared the same consent, having to double-check the vase to make sure it was okay. "I'll say it was... hey, great catch shortstuff." she pat Ali on the back, causing the smaller girl to blush.

"O-oh, hey, it was nothing I mean-"

"...What're you guys doing?" Walker's voice echoed throughout the stilled hallway, causing Midnight to jump up eagerly. "Why hello there!" she cooed a little to loudly, standing to her feet and knocking Ali back into the podium face first, "What brings you to this neck of the woods, hmm?" she said sensually. The dreary butler was far from pleased. "Uh... yeah, I work here." Walker said dully, shrugging off the fellow dark-type moemon in a hastilly planned escape route, "Oh jeez, Shrimp, grab that-"

Ali read his mind, not even shocked that he had raised his voice. The little moemon held out her hands awaitingly in an attempt to save said priceless vase, only for it to end up as a million green little decorations on the floor. "O-Oops." Ali squeaked....

For a while, that's all that was said. "Oops." That's all that could have been said; Ali and Midnight's conjoined reckless attitude had broken the most beautiful thing the former had ever seen in her entire life. "Oops?" Walker parroted fiercely, "Oops? That's all you have to say?" Ali trembled as Walker got closer and closer to her- she was already in hot water with the Disaster Moemon for ramming him in the broken ribs, now it looked like he was going to... Ali gulped at the thought.

Walker's piercing red eyes met Ali's quivering ones, her thin white brow furrowed in anger. "That was the Master's favorite vase, an antique from the Rayquazan Era!" she shouted at Ali, already pale knuckles turning snow white as she gripped his fingers tighter and tighter, "It. was. PRICELESS." she concluded, whipping around to face Midnight and the other half of Fontina, "You three... you're all putrid, and you're GONNA get out of here!" she closed her eyelids, resisting the urge to deliver comuppons to each and every one of them

"U-Uh..." Midnight and Ali stammered in unison, Fontina was speechless. Here she was, minding her own business (minus that little stuffing incident) and her friends had gotten her into trouble! AGAIN! "B-B-But-" she stuttered too, only for Walker to turn around and get into her face, "Your friends are fools. Fools." he reitterated himself angrilly, storming off down the hall. No doubt in search of Shera to let her know about their newest "guest's" mysterious dissappearances.

"Wow..." Midnight gawked, "He's pretty mad." Ali rolled her eyes, "Yeah, thanks to you Mutt-Mouth!" Fontina felt her eyes water, having felt so sorry for even being a part of this little fiasco, but if it was fair, Fontina was perfectly fine with-

"I better go work on him." Midnight stood up, only for Ali to grab her heel and pull her back down to the ground. "YOU'LL JUST MAKE IT WORSE!!!"
111132112112221211122122121.title: We just can't take you two Anywhere!

choices: After lunch, its time for the fitting of uniforms... Measurement time!
Later that night...
1111321121122212111221221211.content:
The cold air in the mansion seemed to turn into a violent fiery aura, sending steam rising up from the rooftops of the building. It had only been a good fifteen minutes after the vase was broken before Midnight, Ali and Fontina had been pulled into the main dining hall, staring at the broken remains of the vase that were placed on the large table.

All the while, the three Moemon could feel themselves getting smaller due to the combined leers of most of the staff (Wester was surprised to hear about what had happened, but he still had to prepare lunch for the group). Well, only two of the four staff were leering at them, Walker being one of them and the normally kind Shera wasn’t in her usual good mood either. Claire was munching on a donut that she snuck out from the break room and Ember… Well, the round ball of lard was actually asleep in the corner of the room.

“Girls,” Shera sighed loudly, making all three of the traveling Moemon jump slightly. “I can understand that you’re young and full of energy, and accidents do happen… But this is a grave mistake that cannot disappear just by saying sorry.”

“They’re ungrateful morons,” Walker added, not bothering to remove her sight from the three.

That just made Midnight and Ali lower their heads a little closer to the ground.

“Walker, I can handle this,” Shera scolded by sending a cold leer towards Walker before she turned back to the girls. “Now look, I realize that things can get out of hand, but there has to be something done about this…”

“I say we toss them out,” Walker suggested.

“What did I just say, Walker?” Shera growled, now getting slightly annoyed.

“I know what you said,” Walker hissed back, her glare now focused on Shera. “But you know as well as I do that the master’s going to flip out when he gets back and finds his precious vase in a million pieces! And we’re all going to take the heat for it! I say we kick these three out before they bring the entire mansion down!”

“Walker, that’s enough!” Shera roared, actually making Walker’s deadly gaze soften slightly, as well as make Ember wake up and cause almost everyone else in the room to jump in surprise. “I invited these three in from the cold, they’re my responsibility. So, unless you want to be stuck on latrine duty for the next year, I suggest you keep your mouth shut!”

Even that seemed to make Walker shiver slightly.

Taking a deep breath, Shera turned back to the three heroines. “Now girls, I want to let you know that I have no intention of kicking you out. I know that you’re all good girls deep down. You probably didn’t mean to let his happen, but…”

‘I wasn’t the one who dropped the stupid relic,’ Midnight thought.

‘That damned, stupid mutt started it!’ Ali thought.

‘I didn’t even have anything to do with it,’ Fontina thought to herself as she crossed her arms on her slightly softer stomach.

“… I am going to have to request that you three are going to stay here,” Shera said bluntly. “Even after the storm clears up I’m afraid. Walker is right, that vase was the master’s favorite, and no doubt it probably was worth a lot of money to him. So, the only way you three can fix this is by working off the amount that the vase was worth.”

“Wait… What?” All three of the girls questioned at the same time.

“I said, you three are going to have to work here at the mansion,” Shera answered. “The more you work, the more money will be used to pay off what the vase was worth.”

“H-How much was that worth then?” Fontina questioned, a little worried about what the answer would be.

“Hmm, Walker, you usually talked with the master about the vase, right?” Shera asked. “How much did he say it was worth?”

“Oh, so now I can talk?” Walker growled before turning her head to the side. “Whatever. He never gave me an exact number, but he told me that a vase like that could go for somewhere in the tens of millions.”

And just like that, Midnight, Ali and Fontina’s jaws dropped at the same time, with Ember snickering in the background at the sight of the three’s faces.

“Well, I’ll try to get into contact with the master to get an exact number,” Shera sighed before she walked to the three. “But, regardless, you three will still work off the debt you’ve accumulated. This afternoon I’ll train you three on how to clean and…”

“Hell no!” Midnight snapped standing up. “I’m not going to take the blame for what the pipsqueak did!”

“HEY!” Ali barked back as she puffed up her little chest slightly. “It was your fault in the first place!”

“Guys! Please!” Fontina pleaded.

The three Moemon continued to argue for a few seconds in front of Shera, until finally…

“ENOUGH!” Shera roared, forcing all three of the bickering Moemon to the ground. Clearing her throat, Shera’s traditional smile appeared on her face. “That’s better, now, if any of you have a complaint about this deal, we can simply call the local authorities and have them sort out the matter…”

Almost in an instant, all three of the heroines shook their heads.

“Ah, I see,” Shera chuckled. “Very well then…”

“Lunch is ready!” Wester announced from the side.

“Excellent,” Shera stated as she turned towards the kitchen. “After lunch, I’ll show you girls the ropes and get you fitted in some maid outfits.”

Tears could be seen falling from the three girls’ eyes as the staff aimed towards the kitchen…
1111321121122212111221221211.title: One Mad, Mad Moemon

choices: "Wait here so I may measure you, in case I have to adjust you selections?"
"Erm... please, take them somewhere else... lest they break anything again?"
11113211211222121112212212111.content:
"Ohh..." Midnight whimpered, sniffling very much like a small child awaiting punishment. Ali was silent, for she had begrudgingly accepted the fact that once again Midnight had gotten her into trouble. Fontina looked like she swallowed a lemon, having lacked the self control required to refrain from topping herself off at lunchtime. Shera, on the other hand, looked like her usual cheery self despite her earlier unpleasantries with her three newest maids.

"Now now girls, no need to look so glum!" the Kangashkan moemon chirped, "I'm sure you'll have that debt paid off in no time, so long as you work really really hard; and in the meantime you'll all have a wonderful time working here!" Her words, while in all the best intentions, fell on deaf ears. They weren't looking forward to this, and how could they? Not only had they shattered a one of a kind antique, but they were expected to work as maids until their REAL punishment could be decided! And what could they do other than lay back and accept their fates; nothing.

Shera's wobbling mass came to a stop right; from the meager attention Fontina managed to hold together, she detected that they were somewhere on the second floor. "A-A linen closet?" Ali stuttered, fearful of ever having to hear that strong scary tone in Shera's voice ever again. "Yeah, ritzy..." Midnight spat sarcastically, earning a swift jab to the side from her Quilava counterpart.

Much to Ali's relief, Shera didn't turn around and deliver a swift backhand to the pompous moemon, but instead let out that sugar-laden chuckle that they had all come to recognize her by, "Well originally maybe, but I've made this my special little project around this house." she said, a twinkle of pride glistening in her brown eyes, "With some help expanding the room, I've turned this into somewhat of my own little escape where I can preform my hobby in peace..."

Her chubby hands grabbed the doorhandle, twisted it, and yanked; revealing a suprisingly brightly lit room filled with uniforms of varying shapes, styles, and sizes! In the corner, there sat a wide stool next to a small table that contained little more than a sewing machine, a few threads in varying shades of black and white, a Wailmer-themed pin cushion, and what looked to be an unfinished blanket.

"Sewing!" she concluded, beaming proudly at the small knook she had created for herself. "Its true, the master realized just how expensive it was to keep ordering new uniforms after the general wear-and-tear, so he asked me to take up knitting and, well, I guess I got a little carried away..." she blushed, turning sideways (though not allowing much more room) for the three to squeeze into her humble corner, "Pick out something you like, dears, I've got plenty."

Immediately, all of the day's hardships melted away for a certain canine moemon. Getting turned down by sexy hunk Walker (yet again), breaking that vase, her fight with Ali, even turning down lunch! Everything was a-ok when she saw those beautiful, sexy maid uniforms hanging so neatly on coat hangers! "Oooh!!" she squealed, the first of her group to jump at the opportunity of free clothes, "These are so cute; Shera, you made these?!" she grabbed at something very victorian, something pretty stereotypical that a maid would wear in a cheap porno flick. She imagined it, the low-cut top half allowing her chocolate breasts to spill out ever so slightly, the short bottom frilling out from her thighs, giving her a youthful- yet sexy approach to her appearance. Midnight sprouted a scheming grin, no doubt coming up with plenty of ways to make Walker bend over and-

"Well yes, I-I never really thought anyone else would be so enthusiastic about them though..." Shera's expression grew even redder, raising a plump hand to cover the visible side of her face in an embarrassing fashion. "And I can hem too, Dear, that uniform seems just a little too-"

"Oh wow!" Fontina's enthusiasm matched Midnights as she caught sight of a particular selection, one almost exactly like the featured dress in her favorite mystery novel, "Th-This is just like-" Shera smiled knowingly and took the liberty to finish her sentence for the excited moemon, "The dress worn by Cassandra in 'Mansion'?" she chuckled again, "Well I'm somewhat of a fan myself, so I decided on making some cosplay that afternoon, if you want I could let it out for-"

But again, Shera's gentle nudges at the girls' puffier waistlines were interrupted yet again by Midnight, who had picked the most absolutely adorable dress for her washboard friend, Ali. "Oh Ali, you'd look so cute in this one!" much to the Quilava's dismay (and fiery fury), Midnight held up a frilly dress that was much more suited for a child... and a flat child at that! "WHAT MAKES YOU THINK I'D WANT TO WEAR THAT?!" Ali shouted, snatching it from Midnight's hands furiously. "Oh but, you seem a little too... erm, "grown up" for that dress, Dear." Shera struggled to find a suitable diagnosis for Ali's problem. She wasn't too grown up, after all...

"SEE, SHE THINKS I'M TOO GROWN UP FOR THAT DRESS!!" Ali stamped her foot at Midnight, who only laughed, "I'm just trying to help you, Shorty, everyone knows you have a babyface anyway, at least you'll attract somebody in that cutesy-frilly thing!" Fontina blushed, taking it upon herself to thank Shera for both of her less-than-refined friends. "Really, we'll work really hard for our debt and-"

"THAT'S IT!!" Ali shouted, balling up her fist in anger and lunging at Midnight yet again, "I'LL KICK YOU RIGHT BACK TO THE KENNEL POOCHY!!" But, despite the proven path that these fights seemed to follow, Shera merely ignored the two feuding females in leiu of their respectable companion. "I'm sure you will, Ms. Fontina- oops, Fontina- but if you'll please...
11113211211222121112212212111.title: Pretty, Pretty Dresses...

choices: The next morning - Its a Maid's duty!
111132112112221211122122121111.content:
“… Wait here so I can measure you all,” Shera continued as she spun around heading towards the table that had the sewing machine on it “I do need to adjust the dresses you all picked out.”

“Measure?!” Fontina gasped slightly, almost dropping the outfit that she had chosen in the process. Looking down at her proportionally gifted body, Fontina placed her hands on her softer stomach, which somehow seemed to be a bit softer than how she really remembered it being before she entered the mansion.

There was something weird going on in this mansion, and it looked like Fontina would have more than enough ample time to find out what it was. After all, she and her friends would be stuck here even if the storm cleared up.

“Girls!” Shera announced, actually pulling Midnight and Ali apart from each other, and ending their fight in an instant. “That’s better, now, could you three please get undressed?”

“What?” Midnight asked with a large bead of sweat rolling down the side of her head.

Ali was just as stunned as Fontina was a moment ago.

“I need to adjust the clothes to fit your figures,” Shera explained with the warm smile on her face. “The faster you three do this, the faster I can adjust your uniforms and the faster we can get that debt paid off in no time!”

A few minutes later…

“Alright,” Midnight sighed as she tossed her clothes on the ground, now only dressed in her silky black bra and panties (that clung to her figure, making a few impressions in her chocolate colored skin). “I’ve been meaning to measure myself for a while now anyways!”

“You think your bust grew along with your ego?” Ali muttered under her breath as she crossed her arms under her now-existent chest (which was clad in a more modest red bra with matching panties).

“At least I have a bust, short-stack,” Midnight chuckled placing a hand on her hip.

Before Ali could actually get a remark in, Fontina slowly stepped from behind the rack of maid uniforms, instantly catching the attention of her two companions. “C-C-Could you not stare?”

Although, that task at the moment was impossible – Both Midnight and Ali knew that their quiet, bookworm of a friend had a better figure than both of them, but they had only seen her dressed in her normally baggy clothes so they couldn’t get a good read on Fontina’s figure. But there it was, clad in some frilly light blue undergarments, her impressive bust almost looking like it was about to spill out from the bra and her shapely hips gave her an almost perfect hourglass figure (with the slight beginnings of a pudgy belly appearing in the middle). The more her two friends stared, the redder Fontina’s face turned.

“Alright!” Shera interrupted, feeling the tension that building in Fontina’s head. “Midnight, dear, could you com here first?”

“Fine by me,” Midnight replied as she shook herself free from her trance at looking at Fontina’s body. “Might as well set the bar for everyone.”

Standing in front of the larger Kangaskhan Moemon, Midnight lifted her arms up in the air as Shera lifted up the measuring strip up to the right places and began to tighten the strip. A minute later, Shera stood up straight and smiled, “Eighty-three, sixty-one, and eighty-one.”

“Not bad! Not bad at all!” Midnight laughed as she turned away from Shera and sauntered over to her clothes. Along the way, she purposely bumped her hip into Ali’s back, forcing the smaller Moemon stumbling over towards Shera. “Try to top that, shrimp.”

Ali huffed loudly before Shera began her task of measuring the Quilava Moemon’s tiny body. A few moments later, Shera made her declaration, “Sixty-seven, fifty-nine, and seventy-one.”

“Oh, my,” Midnight chuckled, pulling her daisy dukes back on her shapely legs. “Looks like I’ve got you beat in all three categories, half-pint!”

“Shut up!” Ali growled as she made a dash for her clothes.

“Alright, Fontina-dear,” Shera calmly announced, making the red faced Fontina blush slightly more. “The faster you get over here, the faster we can get this over with.”

Without a word, Fontina scuttled over to Shera, and lifted her arms up. As Shera ran the measuring strip over her body, Fontina could almost feel the measuring tape sink into her soft skin a few times. Time seemed to slow down for this measurement, with Fontina’s face burning a deep red.

“Done!” Shera announced as she stood up straight. “Ninety-three, sixty-six, ninety.”

“What?!” Midnight and Ali gasped, both of them almost dropping their clothes in the process.

“… P-Please,” Fontina yelped as she dashed for her currently borrowed work-out clothes. “It’s n-not a big deal!”

“Big is exactly what it is!” Midnight growled, her eyes now green with envy.

Ali sighed loudly as she placed her hands on her chest, her own measurements had improved slightly (she’s wasn’t a fan of her waist measurement though) but the same was for her two companions…

“Now then,” Shera announced, gathering all three of the girls’ attentions. “You three return to your room and relax until dinner. By then I should have the uniforms fixed, but we’ll get you three working tomorrow morning. But don’t worry, I’ll start you all off with a partner to help your work and show you the ropes.”

"Oh man, this is so embarrassing..." Ali's demure was as red as her type's namesake as she stepped out in front of her friends as they all had before her. Shera's poofy childish dress was actually the only one that was small enough to fit her, as even the lardball Ember's choice of clothing was too vertically advanced to fit Ali's petite stature. "Oh come on Ali, it looks fine!" Midnight urged her from her seated position on the bed, rudely pulling up her stockings instead of giving her full attention to the modeling Quilava moemon (as her friends had so graciously given their full attention to Midnight during her glorified catwalk) "Sh-Shut up!" Ali froze like a Stantler in headlights: W-Was she really cute?

In all actuality, yes she was. Even going so far as to say 'adorable' wouldn't be construed as over the top. Ali's new dress was black at the base with a white apron wrapped around her waist, of course, but there were a few custom items noticable about the spread that seemed custom, like they were put there just for Ali! And indeed there were, Shera had done a magnificent job of customizing each girl's selection to better suit their personalities while she was tailoring their uniforms. For instance, before, Ali's uniform was a simple fabric with nothing special about it with a very generic shape, almost like a halloween costume for a small child. But after Shera was done with it, the dress looked basically the same, and to the untrained eye it would appear almost just as it did when Midnight yanked it off the hanger. But actually Shera had ever so slightly tightened the ruffles in the uniform's shoulders, making it seem a little more grown up than before. The Kangaskahn seamstress seemed to loosen the skirt's hem and add a few more frills at the bottom to accentuate Ali's small, childish stature though. Shera had even gone so far as to replace the clad-white fabric of the uniform's undercoating with a pattern which resembled very pale white fire burning against a slightly darker white background.

"I-I-I-I AM NOT!!" Ali barked back at Midnight, who had finally gotten one of her leggings rolled up somewhere during that paragraph. Midnight dismissed her friend with the wave of a hand, "I didn't say you were smokin' hot, Ali, just cute." she grabbed another legging and started to roll it up her tanned calve, "Like one of those cheap dolls you get at the mall, that's it."

But in all fairness, Midnight was calling the kettle black when it came to looking 'cheap'. While Ali's dress looked like it was made for her, Midnight's looked much more suited to a woman of much older, much more desperate status when it came to men. Not that she didn't have the figure for it, which she certainly did, it was just how the dress seemed to present itself. But again, it wasn't the dress' fault that Shera had taken Midnight's loose, haughty personality into play when making adjustments. Take for instance how tight and thin the fabric was, now stuff Midnight's (growing) light milk chocolate body into the dress and cut off some circulation. She looked wonderful with her low-cut top, which put her cleavage on a proverbial pedestal as it literally spilled out of it, and her low-cut bottom, allowing her thick whipped-chocolate thighs to strut their stuff, but the middle was the problem. Shera had all the intention of making Midnight look good (just as the notes and quick doodle the Mighteyena girl had dropped by her quarters some time last night depicted) but knowing how vain the dark-type moemon was, Shera had taken the liberty to tighten the waist just a bit to accentuate her "sexy" persona. And, since silver was 'slimming' in Midnight's book, she had the seamstress line her cuffs with a silver fabric; inadvertantly turning her normal belly shirt into a boobie shirt, due to lack of suitable fabric on Shera's part.

Midnight hummed slightly as she finished rolling up yet another stocking during yet another long-winded paragraph, wincing slightly as she leaned over her pinched belly. "Geez, you'd think she would have done a better job with these." Midnight, as always, had to complain, "I mean, seriously I can hardly breath in this thing!" Ali was the first to quip, "Maybe it's not the dress' fault, sixty-one waist, maybe you're just wearing something more suited to my slender, fifty-nine waist." she teased, now more than eager to rub Midnight's own measurements in her face.

"Yeah, but I still have bigger boobs."

"WHY YOU-"

During Midnight and Ali's little scrap, their volumptuous friend cowered behind the doorway; absolutely set on just letting the cops come and take her away. Anything was better than going out with her new uniform on! Her normally pale, seafoam skin was almost as red as Ali's after having difficulties squeezing her... 'assets' into the dress...

Which was quite beautiful actually, not suprising since 'beautiful' was exactly what Shera strived for in Fontina's dress. Rather than the generic black fabric used for everyone else's uniforms, herself included, Shera had found a bounty of a lovely navy fabric so dark that it almost seemed to be black. From far away, the blue was unnoticable unless compared to another one of her uniforms, this was done purposely; something just to say that its creator appreciated how kindly Fontina treated the house and how she refrained from being as rowdy as her friends. Aside from the blue fabric, Fontina's dress had many more special qualities unique to only her dress; such as the extra pocket sewn across her right busom, the light perrywinkle option instead of the white for her hems, or just how "smart" her outfit made her seem. Shera was even going so far as offering to find a particularly old and feminine pair of glasses lying somewhere around the house that would go great with her new outfit! And despite Fontina's protests, Shera still managed to get ahold of her lens thickness and curve.

For now, however, Fontina's eyes almost watered from behind her big round glasses as she hid behind the doorframe. Not because she was embarrassed, or because she didn't want to be a maid. Or even because her uniform was already tight on her plumping body (she would cry about that later) It was that Shera had taken the time to make her something that was unique to her; and only her. And the fact that something so beautiful was going to get dirty as she cleaned the house...

"Enough guys, come on!" Fontina piped, batting away the slowly accumulating tears from her eyes with the back of her knuckle, "We've got lots of work to do around here..."

A week had passed by, and just as the storm continued (which only Fontina seemed to notice) so had the chores that our three heroines had to deal with (as well as their secret binges). It was an early morning when Ali realized something about her maid uniform when she was finally finished putting on her outfit…

… To be honest, though, she wasn’t the one who realized it first…

“I see London, I see France,” Midnight snickered as she walked up behind her shorter companion, making Ali jump. “I see a certain Quilava’s unattractive…”

“Hey!” Ali snarled as she spun around to leer at her taller traveling companion (if you could still call them traveling).

Midnight only snickered at the look at Ali’s face, “Seriously squirt, you might wanna think about asking Shera to get you a bigger uniform. All that ‘cleaning’ you’ve been doing with that oversized butterball must’ve made your uniform shrink, heh!”

Ali blushed when she pulled down the skirt of her maid uniform, she was feeling more of a breeze with this outfit than she usually did. However, it wasn’t because her bottom half had grown (although that did contribute), it was actually due to the fact that her normally flat body seemed to develop more in a week than four years of puberty – actually giving her a slightly larger bust (as well as the beginnings of a pot belly).

However, when the young Quilava Moemon got a better look at Midnight, that blush disappeared and a large smirk appeared on her face as she crossed her arms, “Speaking of uniforms, yours looks like its seen better days, mutt.”

Midnight barred her teeth at the smaller Moemon, but she couldn’t argue with facts. The uniform was tight and form cutting when Midnight had it mad for her, showing off a decent amount of light milk chocolate skin from the low-cut top and skirt – But after one week of giving into the temptation of her vice, chocolate, the damage had been done. Some of the seams were starting to pop around her waist while her impressive bust was threatening to escape from her top’s confines, trying to follow the example that her improved buns had begun to peek out from under the skirt whenever she sauntered around. “Please, I’m just getting sexier. I’m a growing girl.”

“Yeah, growing taller… Or wider?” Ali quipped back with a large smirk.

“I can easily kick you out into the rain, ya know,” Midnight growled. “So, what’d you say?”

Ali chuckled nervously, certainly not looking forward to dealing with rain water (she was still recovering after Ember’s second ‘group bathing’ intrusion, which added to her water phobia). “Uh, n-nothing! We should probably report to the dinning hall.”

“Yeah, yeah,” Midnight sighed, adjusting the uniform to put it on the edge of decency in hopes that she could get Walker’s attention. “I’m all ready!”

“By the way, have you seen Fontina?” Ali asked as the two began to head towards the door.

“Dunno,” Midnight sighed with a shake of her head. “My guess is that she’s still in the bathroom.”

Hearing that, Ali stopped and turned towards the bathroom’s door, rapping on the door a few times, “Fontina? Are you in there?”

A few moments later…

“Y-Yeah…”

“Are you alright?” Ali asked through the door while Midnight already left the trio’s bedroom.

“Yes!” Fontina grunted from the bathroom. “J-Just putting on my uniform!”

“Well, alright,” Ali replied. “We’re going to the dining hall so, we’ll see you there!”

As soon as Fontina heard the bedroom door close, she exited the bathroom door – sighing loudly as she looked over her uniform which at this point seemed to be almost painted on her body! Unlike her two friends, Fontina’s body seemed to be like dough rising in an oven over the week. Her impressive curves only improved over the week, popping several other seams in her attempts to clean. Although her bust and hips had improved, Fontina grimaced at her pillow like stomach and the fact that if she looked down at her body, the beginnings of a double chin were threatening to make themselves known.

And it boggled the Vaporeon Moemon’s mind, there was no way someone could gain this much weight in a week – Sure, she expected to gain some weight thanks to the monstrous meals and snacking that Claire had suggested during their ‘chores’, but she would’ve burned it off during her work…

… Perhaps it was this mansion itself and the fact that she wasn’t traveling – After all, traveling with Midnight and Ali managed to help her burn whatever calories she gained during the travels.

But it looked like it wasn’t going to be possible to lose weight while she was here… Unless… “Walker! He’s basically remained the same weight! I should ask him!”

'H-How dare she!!' Midnight gasped, eye actually twitching out of what felt like a minor brain hemmorage, 'Th-That aquatic hussy- a-after all I've done for...' she growled, furious, and put her ear to the door...

The "Mmphmmh, mmppmh." 's sounded like Walker, but the "Mememe, me me, mme" 's had to be Fontina's. Oh she could just imagine all the dirty talk that bispeckled skank was talking her hunk of man-meat into doing!
