She picks Fontina, leaving Midnight to do "work" in the breakroom (WAY upset)
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
"Urp."

Ali let out a small belch as she eyed her precariously distended stomach. For some reason, her outfit was much looser on her than it had been these past few days, but that still didn't settle her growing concerns about her growing waistline. For some reason, while many other dreams had passed her by, the rapid expansion of Dream Ali seemed to shake the young echidna moemon to her very core. She was trying to eat less (trying, mind you) and was very upset with how much her paunch seemed to poke out these days. Her womanly curves were finally coming in, but as she had reminded a certain Mightyena moemon dozens of times, "boobs are just strategically placed fat", meaning that there was at least some weight gain going on. Regardless, all she could do now was lay back in her chair and suffer the consequences of overeating rich food.

"Urp, excuse me."

Fontina too, was having trouble controlling herself. It seemed like all the walking she did, instead of burning unwanted calories, only seemed to make her hungrier than she was when she woke up! Her plump tummy bulged out further, still retaining it's softness and plush consistancy despite its stuffed status. As she looked down to inconspicuously massage her tummy, a more definate double chin made itself known as the neckfat creased in her curiousity. Her fingers kneeded the soft expanse in front of her solemnly, because in a perfect worl all this blubber wouldn't have laid itself on her belly... or anywhere for that matter. Still, the gnawing feeling in the back of her head to finish off what was left of Walker's first and only omlette was very much present.

"Belch... sorry."

Midnight had lost inhibition control yet again during this meal, as if she had any before. Instead of modestly stuffing herself like her two companions had, Midnight insisted upon eating as much as she could in a relatively quick fashion. Not out of gluttony no, but mostly just because that was how she had eaten her entire life. To go along with her "rough chick" attitude, she also had a very rough way of eating her food. And it definately showed in her paunch, slowly expanding behind the let-out corset that she still hadn't realized had been altered. Even now, as gurgle incoherently about how full she was or how good the food is, she reached over to the disdain of both Walker and Fontina and took it upon herself to finish off the Absol moemon's omlette.

"...perp..."

Even Kyrie, who as Ali already had seen, had quite the appetite and clearly exhibited it to the entire spectation of the household. She wasn't loud like Midnight, nor overly mannered like Fontina, or even as much of a moaner as Ali. Somehow through her tiny, ladylike bites she had managed to keep up just enough only to fall short under the least amount eaten between the four. Her dress was modest, and didn't very much show her swollen belly, but it was definately present on the shrimpy girl's body. But it must have been too much for her, as Kyrie's beautiful golden eyes were left half-open in her daze.

"So." Walker finally said after a long session of silence between the table, "Can we fight now?"

Horus chuckled. He too had eaten the absolute bare minimum of what would be considered a healthy breakfast. But unlike his Absol sparring partner, he had consumed his entire omlette, mushrooms and all (something that really irked her, he knew that she hated mushrooms) his spinach and greens as well as the side of dipping sauce Wester had so lovingly made himself. Oh, and seven consecutive cups of coffee. "I don't see why not." he addressed the stable of sleepy fatties before him, "Ladies...and Wester... I'll be spending the rest of the day with Walker, so I'll have to excuse myself." somehow, he seemed somewhat irritated at having to fight Walker... or at least that's what the barely coherent Ali could concieve.

"I can only imagine the hawt things those two could be doing...." Midnight grunted as she grabbed bits and pieces off Walker's plate, "Getting all sweaty and stuff like guys do when they fight..." Ali threw her napkin at her, "Midnight, you're such a perv."

Shera was the first to actually put her "game" face back on, wiping off the mask of the slightly sleepy woman she was just moments ago to get right back to work. "Alrighty then, I guess we should divide up the chores evenly then?" she said merrilly, "Claire, you and I will tackle the first floor." Kyrie awoke slightly to address the plump maid, "Wh-What do I do Ms. Shera?" she asked in a sleepy tone, "That's just what I was about to ask you dear!" Shera cooed to the Ali-sized girl in front of her, "You get to clean the kitchen today since Ember will be taking care of Ali-

"Wait, what?!" Ali jumped, now fully awake as Ember started to giggle. The massive Vulpix girl pat her belly and licked her lips, "Oh yum yum yum, that means you can eat until you feel all better today, you're so lucky Ali!!" she cried. Ali's thing black eyebrow twitched, "TH-THAT'S NOW HOW NORMAL PEOPLE GET BETTER!!!" she wailed

"-Anywho, it's just for today and it'll help you get started." Shera continued on despite Ali's obvious and clearly stated protests, "I want you to pick between two of our newer maids here- Midnight or Fontina!" both addressed moemon perked up slightly at their names (not at Ali's screams, though) "But whoever she doesn't pick gets the hard job... taking care of the second and third floors today, I'm sorry we're so understaffed..."

Kyrie ducked down... she didn't like this kind of scathing attention...
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.title: A Tough Decision

choices: Working with Midnight and Wester...
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
The pressure that was being placed on Kyrie’s shoulders was enough to make the petite moemon’s head spin and her face completely red. The option of choosing who she would work with was growing heavier with each second as the mysterious Moemon looked over her two choices of who to work with as they both digested their breakfast.

At first, Kyrie wanted to work with Ali, in hopes of getting closer to the very person who had helped her in the first place and had become her first friend in the mansion. But, Ali was probably still a little weak from yesterday, and thus was already walking around the table with Ember to take care of some of the uneaten food (most of the food was around Walker’s barely cleared plate).

So that left Fontina, the Moemon that Kyrie had bonded with the night before, and was actually quite interested in spending more time with the beautiful Fontina. After all, it would’ve been great to continue their conversation last night before the two perverted night staff members.

But then, there was the third one – Midnight was her name if Kyrie remembered correctly. Even though Kyrie was a bit afraid of the milk chocolate skinned Moemon, Kyrie did have to admit that she was afraid of both Ali and Fontina before she talked to them. Maybe Midnight was nicer than her cold demeanor suggested… Kyrie hoped.

Well, that and the glare that Midnight was conveying a very strong message…

“I… Well… M-M-Midnight?” Kyrie answered Shera’s question with a small yelp.

“Excellent choice,” Midnight grunted as she stood up from her seat.

Kyrie turned back to Fontina, who only smiled back at the smaller Moemon – Apparently, there weren’t any hard feelings from the water Moemon. If Kyrie was a Psychic Moemon, she would’ve been able to read Fontina’s mind about thinking that this would be an excellent chance to get some exercise (so long as she didn’t get near the break room of course).

“Well, then,” Shera announced as she pushed herself from the table, watching as Claire was waddling towards the door. “Let’s work hard today people!”

Kyrie staggered back slightly.

Maybe she should’ve chosen Fontina after all…

Kitchen duty wasn’t a glorious duty at all, heck, the most one had to do was wash the dishes. After all, since Wester almost practically lived in the kitchen, he kept it rather clean most of the time. Heck, the floors were so clean that if someone looked at the right angle, then they could easily see up the skits of Midnight and Kyrie…

… Not that they knew that or had to know that…

Wester himself was actually tidying up the counters in the kitchen, and despite his rather big size, it was a wonder to see him glide across the floor and work quickly. “How you girls doing over there?”

“Fine!” Midnight grumbled as she held a wet dish over to Kyrie. “Man, these gloves are really annoying. But I guess their better than prune-like fingers…”

“Um… M-M-Midnight?” Kyrie mumbled as she held up the dish, revealing a deep stain on the plate. “T-T-There’s a bit of f-f-food on…”

“Like I really care,” Midnight scoffed as she picked up another dish (that was delivered by Ali and Ember earlier). “The dishwasher will take care of it when we toss these in them anyway. Sides, the faster we get done with these, the faster I can skip out and watch that hawt Walker train with that Horus guy. He’s got a good bod too… I can just imagine the fight between the two…”

Kyrie took a step to the side when she noticed that Midnight had a slight blush on her face and her mouth curled into a suspicious looking smile. Perhaps she should’ve gone with Fontina after all…

“Walker’s fighting against Horus?” Wester questioned as he walked up behind the two, a broom now in his hands. “Oh my, seems like that’d be a good match again.”

“Again?” Midnight questioned, snapping out of her stupor to turn around to face the pudgy Wigglytuff Moemon. “Are you saying that the two have fought before?”

At this point, Kyrie had gotten the basic idea on how to clean dishes, so while Midnight questioned Wester, the petite Moemon began to work on the dishes by herself.

“Oh yes,” Wester answered with a large smile on his face. “In fact, the two usually train together when the whole staff is here. It’s because of our current understaffed situation that the two haven’t been able to train together. I’d offer to train with Walker, but I have too much work in preparing meals.

“You see, while the Master is here, he has most of the staff train with each other. But only if they want to or if they’re able to, sometimes though, the matches get rather heated. So, I’d guess that a match between the two of them would be good, after all, both of them used to be on the Master’s main team.”

“Used to be?” Midnight questioned, unaware the Kyrie was halfway done with the dishes by now. “What happened?”

“Well, its nothing really major,” Wester replied with a shrug. “Horus had to train the two new members of the night guard. And Walker, well, Walker had some issues personality wise and got injured a while back…”

Midnight stopped listening to Wester as she crossed her arms over her healthy chest, ‘Walker’s injured? I can use this to my advantage!’

Instantly, Midnight’s head began to fill with several different scenarios – One with her dressed in a tight nurse’s outfit that had the top few buttons unbuttoned to show her healthy milky chocolate colored cleavage as she nursed a wounded Walker in his bed. Once again, we’d go further, but that’d change the rating on this story due to the content…

“Um, h-how do I use this thing?” Kyrie asked, snapping Midnight out of her delusion, making the Mightyena Moemon blink a few times…

… Kyrie was pointing towards the dishwasher.

A few minutes later…

“So, where do they usually train?” Midnight asked leaning up against the now activated dishwasher, a cookie in her hands before she munched on it.

“Oh, there’s a gym on the first floor,” Wester explained as he handed Kyrie a huge chocolate ship cookie as well. “With the exception of Walker and the night staff, it usually gets underused while the master and his team are out. It’s also got a portioned off area that’s used as a dojo there too, so it makes the ideal place to have a match.”

“Sho, how wuff one giff fere?” Midnight questioned through a mouthful of chocolate chip cookie while she lifted another from the paper plate that Wester had brought over.

Kyrie had finished her cookie rather easily and was on her second, for some reason she could get enough of the sugary treats (even though she was still quite full from the large breakfast).

“… If you’re asking how to get there,” Wester muttered brushing some crumbs off of his uniform. “Then all you need to do is head out of the main dinning hall and head north. Shouldn’t be too hard to find if you follow the maps.”

“Thanks Wester,” Midnight chuckled as she picked up another cookie. “I’ll put that information to good use…”

“Um… D-Don’t we have w-w-work?” Kyrie muttered before Midnight wrapped her arm around the shy moemon’s shoulders.

“Don’t get your pigtails in a twist, squirt!” Midnight snickered before she placed the cookie she took and fitted it in Kyrie’s mouth. “Thanks to that walking butterball and that puny spitfire, most of the dishes were cleaned off, and we’ve rinsed them all as well, so, unless you’ve got any other jobs for us to do Wester…”

“Well, I’m used to cooking lunch by myself by now,” Wester pointed out as he rubbed his chin. “I suppose I could handle this by myself for now. So, if you two wanna take a break to watch Horus and Walker duke it out, I suppose that if you two are back in an hour I might just be…”

“Kay! Thanks!” Midnight announced as she pulled on Kyrie’s wrist and grabbed the large paper plate of cookies at the same time. “Later Wester!”

Before the Wigglytuff Moemon could get another word in, Midnight had already dragged Kyrie out of the kitchen and disappeared. For a second, Wester just stood there before he smiled greatly. “… Ah, to be young. Maybe I should pay some visits to the gym too. After all, I don’t want to be cooped up in my quaint little kitchen for the rest of my days.”

“Um, M-M-Midnight,” Kyrie muttered as she followed the taller Moemon through the hallway towards the gym. “A-Are you sure that w-w-we should have left Mr. W-W-Wester…”

“Liff ah baid,” Midnight retorted with chocolate crumbs spilling from her cookie filled mouth. With a deep gulp, Midnight swallowed the chewed up cookie in her mouth. “You shouldn’t worry, kiddo. Wester’s a hard worker and he’s done this without anyone’s help before. Besides, we’ll be back to help him later.”

“W-Well, if y-you’re sure,” Kyrie replied before she nibbled on one of the cookies that Midnight had given her.

“That a girl!” Midnight chuckled as she placed a hand on Kyrie’s shoulder, making the smaller Moemon jump slightly. “Now don’t worry! You’re going to thank me later! It’s not everyday you get to watch a fight between two hot studs!”

“S-Studs?” Kyrie questioned with her face turning redder.

A few minutes later, the two finally came across the large double doors to the gym (it was actually thanks to a nearby map that helped guide the two). And the moment that the doors were opened, both Midnight and Kyrie were surprised and amazed at the sheer size of the gym – Which could be on par with the size of an official city gym! The equipment was some of the latest and most expensive on the current market, and there plenty of good classics, like four weight benches, three treadmills, there were even a couple of Bowflexes in the gym as well.

“Yeesh, with equipment like this, it’s a wonder why this mansion’s filled with fatties,” Midnight mused, unaware of her own lack of proper exercise and poor dietary choices… As well as the layer of chub that was growing on her body.

Kyrie was rather curious with the equipment, walking to one of the exercise bikes and observed it, “Um, w-what in the w-w-world do these… These… These… ACHOOOOO!”

A large cloud of dust erupted from the work out bicycle, making the doll like Moemon erupt into a fit of sneezing. And with a larger sneeze, Kyrie fell backwards and landed on her small butt, “Oof!”

Midnight couldn’t help but snicker loudly at the cute sneezing fit by the runt that the original runt had picked up. Although, Midnight had to admit that the doll-faced Moemon was pretty cool for helping to pay off the debt that Ali had gotten them into…

… Well, either that or a complete sucker. Midnight was still thinking how to classify the smaller Moemon.

WHAP!

That’s sound caught Midnight’s attention, showing another set of opened doors in the gym. Silently stepping towards the doors, Midnight peered inside the room to see a large red mat on the ground that had two people on top of it, one of them was standing and the other had their back on the ground.

The one on the ground was none other than Walker himself (or to the rest of us: herself) growling loudly as he (she) pushed off of the ground, having exchanged his (her) usual butler’s outfit for a baggy white gi with a black belt tied around his (her) waist.

The other person on the mat was of course – Horus, still dressed in his security officer’s outfit, save for the fact that his hat was no where to be seen and to make things more confusing was that he seemed to have a mug of coffee that he sipped on casually. Midnight could feel a large bead of sweat rolling down the side of her head, ‘… Is he actually drinking coffee while they fight?’

“One more time!” Walker growled, immediately getting into a ferocious fighting stance.

“Walker, I keep telling you that you shouldn’t be so hasty,” Horus sighed, taking another sip from his coffee. “And you need to learn how to control your anger, otherwise…”

Walker charged forward and jumped into the air, snapping his (her) leg up to deliver a powerful kick towards the Noctowl Moemon’s head. Only to miss as Horus merely leaned backwards. The moment that Walker landed on the mat, he (she) quickly threw a punch towards Horus’ stomach, but once again, the Noctowl Moemon stepped to the left, dodging the fury that was sent his way. “… Your opponent…”

Using the momentum, Walker spun around to unleash a swift high kick, this time however, instead of dodging, Horus lifted his right arm up and stopped the attack with a loud slamming sound. “Can easily read your moves!”

Tossing his cup of coffee into the air, Horus immediately wrapped both of his hands around Walker’s ankle and immediately spun around to throw the Absol Moemon through the air and land on the mat with a loud slamming sound.

After the throw, Horus lifted his left hand up and caught the falling cup of coffee, and immediately, he too a quick sip from the mug. “I shouldn’t also have to point this out, but you’re still recovering too. I prefer not to fight people in that condition, so, you can see…”

“S-Shut up!” Walker snarled as he narrowed his (her) red eyes down on the Noctowl. “I… I won’t lose to you… Or to anyone else!”

Midnight stood there at her hiding space, her mind racing with several thoughts…

‘Holy hell! That birdbrain can fight!!’

‘Walker’s butt looks so cute in that outfit!’

‘Hmm… I bet I could take that feather head down in a second…’

‘Should I cheer for Walker?’

‘Maybe if I step in, I can score some hawtie points!’

Kyrie watched the odd display with growing feelings of abandon. For as long as she could remember, not long granted, the odd little moemon hadn't been one for fighting. Especially not when she was being forced to watch. While Midnight soaked up the violence like some sort of sick display, giggling and blushing as she oggled the hotties on the floor pound eachother's faces in (well, not exactly eachother's, Horus was pretty much dominating the whole competition), Kyrie could only feel empathy for the young butler.

The way he winced every time Horus delivered one of his sharp punches, his eyebrows dancing with rage as they twitched, his violent battlecries and his refusal to just lay down and be done for the day. Somehow, from somewhere deep inside of her, Kyrie felt like she had been there. Just from somewhere, some time... she had felt like that. The image of a strong, burly man came to mind; sillouhetted by the harsh sunlight... it almost made her want to cry. But Walker's pain was real, not some fabricated mental picture that was surely just fabricated and nothing else. Horus was really getting to the Absol moemon... and for Midnight to do nothing but just stand there getting horny was very much a turnoff for Kyrie.

Speaking of Midnight... where was she? Kyrie looked around with nervous little squeaks emenating from her mouth as she searched, but the Mightyena moemon was no where to be found!

"Hey, think you can read this featherhead?!" Midnight suddenly made her appearance known with her familiar taunts, lunging into the battlefield without hesitation. She smiled widely, her sharp teeth pearly white and grinning with anticipation as she charged. Horus stared blankly at the war-ready woman making her way towards him, averting his gaze from her chest as she took her steps in a mighty fashion. She reached him, finally, and delivered a quick side kick that would be effortlessly dodged on Horus' part.

"What the Hell?!" Walker shouted, painstakingly lifting "him"self up from his crouched position, "You, Loudmouth, what do you think you're doing?!" he attempted to reason with Midnight bluntly by telling her off, only to no avail. "I'm standing up for you, sugarcheeks!" she said with a proud twinkle in her eye, "Pellet-for-Brains here thinks he can pick on you like that, well I'm about to prove that I'm not just all bark!" Walker's eye twitched and a red tint of embarrassment crawled its way into the butler's already quite flustered face, "HE'S NOT PICKING ON ME, WE'RE FIGHTING!!" Horus chuckled, "Actually, we really are in the middle of something here, so if you wouldn't mind..."

"Oh no way, don't even try to get me with that "Mr.NiceGuy" act!" Midnight leaned forward slightly and put a hand on her hip, "You're a jerk, you know that; and I'm gonna beat some respect for Walker into you!" she picked up the longest segment of her uniform and charged once again, her (once) stong calf muscles pushing her forward at top speed (possible). The dark moemon readied herself, bending her knees a bit to get leverage as she jumped... straight into a wall.

Horus effortlessly dodged yet again, Walker on the sidelines with her head resting in her bruised palm, "You're just making a fool of yourself, you should really just cut it out and get back to the kitchen." Walker grumbled. "Now now Walker, if the young lady wants to play, let her play." Horus chuckled slightly, readying his battle stance (Actually just him standing. He's always ready for battle >:D) and took a sip from his still unspilled coffee.

"I think it's adorable how she wants to fight for you Walker." Horus teased his young protegee, "It's probably best that cute little girl, Kyrie, isn't here to see this..."

"I think it's adorable how she wants to fight for you Walker." Horus teased his young protegee, "It's probably best that cute little girl, Kyrie, isn't here to see this..."

That’s when the coffee cup flew from Horus’s hands, instantly making the Noctowl Moemon’s eyes widen as the beverage slammed into the wall, shattering the mug into pieces and making the prized coffee splash all over said wall.

“You shouldn’t take me lightly,” Midnight advised with her leg up from her swift kick (which was actually another attempt at seducing Walker, since with the skirt, Midnight was showing off her dark panties that clung to her meatier legs). “I’ve been traveling and fighting all over the region!”

Walker blinked a few times as the rude Mightyena Moemon spun around and began to charge at Horus, sending several quick punches and kicks towards the older Moemon, who was doing his best to barely dodge (while at the same time not look when Midnight launched a kick towards him).

Throughout the fighting however, Kyrie had snuck off, she couldn’t stand the thought of violence (even if it was for defending someone), for some reason it seemed to scare the small, petite Moemon. So, while the others were busy with Midnight’s surprising combat abilities, the petite Maid scurried out of the gym and into the halls…

Meanwhile back at the fight…

‘Hmm…’ Horus thought as he spun to the right, just barely able to dodge a good left hook. ‘I can just barely dodge her attacks, I have to say, this one does know her stuff.’

While on that train of thought, Horus quickly ducked to dodge Midnight’s powerful kick, and not wanting to be called a pervert, Horus leapt to the side. ‘If I wasn’t tired from Walker’s fight and my own lack of sleep, I’d be able to defend myself properly.’

Turning around Horus quickly leapt back as Midnight threw another punch his way, ‘Still though, she does have experience and does know what she’s doing so…’

That’s when Midnight crouched down slightly and leapt upwards, delivering a harsh uppercut towards Horus. Luckily, Horus managed to pull back just barely in time to dodge the attack, but the punch caught the visor of his hat, sending it flying off into the air.

“Ha! How do ya like me now?!” Midnight laughed as she threw her other fist forward…

… Only for it to be caught by Horus’s opened hand, “Huh?”

“You’ll have to forgive me, Miss Midnight,” Horus stated as he wrapped his other hand around Midnight’s wrist. “But, I have other matters to tend to!”

Midnight’s eyes widened when she realized that her feet had left the ground and her back had just slammed into the ground, her eyes widened as the pain rang through her body. “Whew… You’re quite the little spitfire…”

“Alright,” Walker growled as ‘he’ stood up from ‘his’ seated position. “Now that we’ve gotten that out of the way, can we get back to our own fight?”

Horus merely picked up his hat and began to dust it off when he turned towards Walker, “Sorry Walker, but I really need to my paperwork done. Maybe on my day off I’ll spend the entire day sparing with you, but in the meantime, maybe you should spar against Midnight here…

“Uh, as long as she dresses properly for it… From what I’ve seen, she might be a balanced sparing partner.”

Walker’s eyes narrowed down at Midnight (who was at the moment sitting on the mat with a daydreamed look in her eyes with a small drop of drool forming in the corner of her mouth – Walker could only imagine what the perverted Mightyena Moemon was thinking of).

“Also,” Horus sighed as he looked at the stained wall. “… Be sure to inform Shera about this little mess here. It was my fault for bringing coffee in here so, yeah, I’ll take the blame for this one.”

And like that, the feather-headed security guard walked out the doors, leaving Walker to grit ‘his’ teeth…

“So, sweet-thang,” Midnight cooed as she walked up behind Walker, leaning forward in order to show off some of her (enhanced) cleavage. “How about we have a little… Workout of our own?”

“…” There was just so much that Walker could take. And when all three of the unwanted guests showed up, that fine line had shortened, and to learn that the one person that Walker wanted to beat considered the mutt of the group to be on par with ‘him’…

… That just broke the line. “… Leave me alone…”

“Huh?” Midnight questioned.

“LEAVE ME ALONE, YOU DUMB B*TCH!” Walker barked, surprising the Mightyena Moemon. “THE MOMENT I MET YOU, THIS MANSION’S GONE TO HELL! YOUR POOR ATTEMPTS AT PICK UP LINES AT LIKE A KNIFE JABBING ME IN THE BACK! KEEP THE HELL AWAY FROM ME!

“AND IF YOU TRY TO PULL SOME MORE CR@P LIKE THAT, I’LL MAKE YOUR LIFE HERE A LIVING HELL!!!”

And with that, Walker stomped out of the room, leaving a shocked and distraught Midnight standing in the padded room. It was just like that coffee mug, something shattered inside of her…

… And to rub salt in the wound, Midnight’s stomach was growling loudly, “… I… I wonder if W-Wester has more c-c-cookies…”

Midnight ran out of the gym, heading straight towards the kitchen for some comfort eating…

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
Gentle sobs filled the hallway, the work of Kyrie's hysteria being the small droplets of tears that dripped from her golden eyes. Her nose was runny, though no snot flooded from her nose to make those tricky clots on the carpet. The tiny moemon whimpered, shoulders quivering as she quietly cried to herself wishing that someone was there to comfort her and tell her that things would be alright. That no one else would get hurt in this mansion. The poor girl hadn't felt that in a long time; the gentle touch of a fellow pacifist to soothe her...

Kyrie sniffled as she continued to play the recently portrayed scenes of violence over and over again in her head, unable to stop her mental rewind button and forget that any of that had ever happened. As she hobbled around, Kyrie's face grew flushed and her eyes hazy. Slowly, she covered corner and started clutching at the aching heart beneath her tiny breast. She hated fighting, so why couldn't she get the image of Horus kicking Walker around like a hackey sack out of her mind?! Quietly, Kyrie's knees slowly slid apart and she fell to the ground, landing on her posterior as she clutched her head in agony.

But then she remembered that Ali didn't have to work today, but... No, she couldn't do that. Ali didn't want to have to comfort some crybaby about fighting and more importantly, Kyrie didn't want for Ali to have to comfort her. The Quilava moemon had already done quite enough for her, and she really didn't want to abuse the privilege of having friends. Friends... had she just used that word? Did she... did she really have friends here?

The thought was powerful; powerful enough to get the young mystery-type up off her bum into a wobbly standing position. "A-Ali..." she whispered, a small blush added to the effect of her crying eyes... Her pace evolved from a slow, steady treading to an almost frantic dash. "A-Ali!" she said quietly, her brow creasing somewhat in her determination to find one of her two closest friends. She had memorized where Ali's room was, a skill that could no doubt prove very helpful, and started in the direction of the nearest staircase; her destination was the second floor, the hallway on the left after taking three rights and the fourth door down. She started up a staircase with great anticipation, the thought of finally having friends to comfort her when she cried driving her to seek out these friends. For the first time, someone would console her and tell her that it was okay for her to cry!

Kyrie's increased pace put her at Ali's doorstep in a matter of minutes, a task that still took the room's occupants a good half an hour or so. The confidence that had guided her to this room had simply shattered, even the door seemed to overpower the young moemon as she cowered beneath its impressive glory. Kyrie meekly shrunk into herself, barely able to lift a hand to let out a gentle "rat-tat" on the door. She squinched her eyes shut, no doubt Ali would be angry at her for disturbing her day off... especially when she was so sick! She would probably yell at her and never want to be friends with her again!!

...But then Kyrie stopped, Ali wasn't like that. She had saved her life out there in the rain just a few days ago, so why would the young Quilava moemon yell and scream at her friend? That word again... 'friend'... it drove Kylie into making another, much more confident knock at the not-so-impressive door! She stood there, eyes almost totally dry now, and expected an answer...

Only for one to never come.

Somewhat confused (this was Ali's day off, where else would she be but her room?!) Kyrie checked the doorknob: unlocked. Feeling a little ashamed at herself for breaking her friends' privacy like this, Kyrie slowly turned the crystal knob and entered the room. Dark. Her tiny hands fumbled around for the lightswitch; it was evident that she had the right room! One side of the bed was messed up, a cheap music player on the corresponding nightstand, and the other side was neat with books on the side! Didn't Ali and Fontina share a bed together? This had to be the right room! Disheartened somewhat, Kyrie resigned to go back and find Midnight so she could get back to work...

But there, crudely written in black marker and tossed carelessly on the dresser, was a note specifically addressed to Kyrie! A light blush filled her cheeks as the diminiative moemon unfolded the paper...

'Kyrie-

Figured you might come by here to see how I was doing. In break room on the third floor, stop by if you want!

-Ali'
***
"Oooh..." Ali moaned, never in her entire life had she experienced this much pain. Well, this kind of pain. It was unbearable, stomachaches were terrible! Granted, she had always had a large appetite, but she had always managed to keep herself in check from eating far too much. Like today. At this rate, Ali felt like she was going to explode into a million little fire-typed pieces! She attempted to kick her legs, only for a large brown weight of flab to keep them pinned down, "So... much... hurt..." she groaned, wincing as another pain shot through her body. To think, she wasn't even sick! Or at least she wasn't when this whole thing started. The enormous body pillow filled with jello resting on her gullet proved to sicken her plenty. Suddenly she knew how toothpaste felt!

Ember giggled, "Oh come on Ali, pleeeeeaaase??!"

Inadvertently, the Vulpix moemon lowered her bulk onto Ali's body even further, her caramel colored middle engulfing the smaller girl and pinning her down completely. In one sausage-y hand she held another treat from the Swinub Sweets box, what used to be Ali's favorite food was slowly becoming her worst nightmare. The wrapper crinkled as Ember's expertise though somewhat slow fingers unwrapped the plastic, "You'll never get better if you don't eaaaat~!!" she whined, kicking her flabby legs in mild amusement. Ali wretched as Ember's body quivered and jiggled all around her, "ALRIGHT, ALRIGHT!!" she gave in yet again to Ember's demands, unable to take this sort of torture for much longer, "J-Just give it to me!!"

Ember squeaked excitedly as she lowered the honey bun into Ali's mouth, unable to feed herself as the Quilava's arms were being held hostage by the Vulpix moemon's suffocating middle. Ali took a pained bite, retching as the sweet dough traveled down her throat and piled itself onto the impressive amounts of food Ember had already shoved down there. "Goodie!!" Ember squealed, reaching into the box for another dose of medicine for her patient, "Keep eating like that and you'll be all better in no time!!"

Unfortunately, Ali could not keep eating like this. And even if she could, there was little to no chance of it making her feel any better. By herself, with Ember laying on top of her no less, Ali had consumed three whole boxes of Swinub Sweets. Mostly it was either donuts or muffins, but apparently Ember had broken into a box of buns, sweet rolls and dumplings this time. Great. Truth be told, Ali's main concern wasn't getting Ember off of her stomach as it should have been. It was how much she had eaten today! She could deal with Ember's suffocating embrace all day if she had to (well, maybe not all day) but it was all this food that was making Ali sick! It was all the food that was making her wince in pain! And it was all this food that was going to make her FAT!!

She pictured herself at Ember's enormous size, no doubt that was how this little butterball had gotten so huge in the first place. Having a huge wobbling belly like Ember's, gigantic fat arms, heaving breasts, a huge rear end, and an encroaching third chin. It made her sick just thinking about it. But then again, that could have just been the food since she was already sick. At any rate, Ali was both sick and sick and tired of having Ember on top of her, squishing all this food into her face!

At once, Ember's heavy form rolled off the couch with a heavy thud. She had stood up! Ali couldn't believe it! She- She was free!

"Alright, now for the belly rub!" Ember giggled, "Nothing makes a sick person feel better than a belly rub after a nice big breakfast!!" Ali was visibly not amused, but she was too stuffed stupid to respond coherently! All she could muster was a pathetic "C-c-c-cc-cah-

"Cupcake?" Ember jumped the gun on that one, digging around somewhat for the 'desired' pastry, "I'll get it!!"

Ali grimaced, she actually meant to say "Call Shera."

Ember bent over, causing a loud ripping sound to fill the break room as her dress had gave way to the vast expanse of blubber Ember held so dear, but it seemed to fall on deaf ears. "Cupcake!" she said triumphantly, slamming the prepackaged frosted treat on the end table next to Ali. "Now for the belly rub!" Ember said excitedly as Ali shut her eyes...

Try as she might, Fontina couldn’t completely concentrate on her sweeping, thinking about the china had brought up the subject about her family. Her two brothers and four sisters, she may not have been the youngest of the group (that title belonged to her younger brother), and she wasn’t the slimmest of her siblings (that fact was set in stone long before she gained this weight in the mansion). ‘I wonder… What would they say if they saw me today?’

As Fontina swept absentmindedly, her thoughts trailed back to a memory of her siblings, and her days before she became a Vaporeon Moemon…

---- Three Years Ago at Celadon City -----


It was an oddly quiet morning in the small apartment building, which allowed a small, teenaged Eevee Moemon to sit in one of the roughed up chairs with a book in her hands. Her short brown hair brushed up against her slightly puffy cheeks and the simple blue dress hugged her slightly chubby frame, and snuggled in between her blossoming chest was a blue stone that had several bubble like emblems etched into it. ‘Finally, a chance to just relax and read…’

Just as she was about to open the book, a black gloved hand snatched up the book she was opening up, making her large eyes blink a few times behind her glasses, “Huh?!”

“Let’s see, the Red Volcano Badge of Courage,” A suave voice chuckled making the young Moemon girl look up to see its owner leafing through the pages on the book. “I swear Fontina, you always have a nose for classic books.”

“NOIR! GIVE IT BACK!” The young Fontina complained as she jumped from the chair.

Leaning up against the chair with the book in his hands was none other than the eldest brother of Fontina’s family – Noir, the Umbreon Moemon, dressed in a black vest with a white short sleeved shirt and black jeans that showed off his slim physique. Topping his handsome face was finely combed back black hair that was pulled back into two small tails that were held back with a pair of golden rings. Noir chuckled as he reached down and roughed up his younger sister’s hair, “Aw, don’t be like that, squirt. I know you love your books.”

Noir handed the book back to Fontina who immediately clutched the book close to her developing chest and small tummy, making her older brother stand up straight a smile on his face. “Now then, are you nervous about your birthday?”

“Y-Yeah…” Fontina admitted, not looking at her brother.

“You have nothing to worry about, squirt,” Noir replied as he held his hand forward. “I went through the same thing, Blaire went through it, so did Kay, Miyu and Pamela. And eventually, Jin will go through it as well.”

“B-But, what if I chose wrong?” Fontina asked, referring to the Water Stone that was hanging around her neck.

“Squirt,” the Umbreon brother sighed as grabbed Fontina’s hand. “How about you follow me?”

“H-Huh?” Fontina questioned as Noir began to lead her younger brother through the apartment, they didn’t have to go too far, just to one of the rooms.

It was one of the bedrooms in the apartment, and inside it was another member of Fontina’s family, Miyu, who was simply laying on the carpet watching TV with a large bag of chips near her that she kept reaching into every few seconds. Being one of the middle children, Miyu wasn’t too much taller from Fontina, but she was bigger, no doubt about that. With her leafy green hair pulled out of her pretty face with a leaf-embroidered hair band. She was dressed in a lime green tank top and camouflaged shorts that strained themselves around her chunky rear and waist that was pointed directly towards her younger sister and older brother. “Miyu here had troubles deciding what way she wanted to grow up as, but she found her way. And as a Leafeon Moemon, she certain enjoys it as well, although, I think that sunbathing of hers has made her a bit too lazy…”

“My ears work at a hundred percent though,” Miyu yawned loudly before she stuffed more chips in her mouth.

Noir laughed a little bit before he led Fontina away, just in time to dodge some potato chips that their sibling had thrown at her.

“Still not convinced?” Noir asked as he walked over towards one of the windows and opened it up. “Look out there, there’s Pamela and Kay.”

Fontina looked out the window and saw her older sisters (it wasn’t that hard, they were only on the second floor of the apartment building) jogging around the building… Well, one of them was, the other was waddling behind the one in the lead…

Which was no surprise for Fontina, after all, Kay was the Jolteon of the family and was a natural born athlete as illustrated by her slim, bright colored body that had a blue sports bra covering her miniscule chest and shapely buns, mostly made to show off her six pack abs and long legs. Her face, while pretty was sharp and her spiked back blond hair made it look even sharper, “Come on Pamela! You wanted me to help you melt those college pounds away, so get your rear in gear!”

Pamela was almost the complete opposite of the younger sibling, where Kay excelled in sports, Pamela was a natural born genius with education and had spent many nights tutoring Fontina and giving her the love for literature. She was also the lucky member of the family who was able to get several scholarships for a college…

Which was good and bad, good since she was a great student there, it was bad for her however since the freshman fifteen had actually multiplied for the young Espeon Moemon. Her round face was flushed and her normally trimmed violet hair was a mess and stick with sweat. The gray sweatshirt and sweatpants had clung to her enhanced curves, which made her the second fattest of the family, with her body more in an apple shape with a large belly and a developing behind and thunder thighs, with a small, but ample bust that bounced in her sweatshirt with each step she took. “I… Can’t… BREATHE!”

“That’s the spirit!” Kay laughed as she jogged in place before she ran circles around her enlarged sibling, poking the fluffy Espeon Moemon in her most troubling spots (the spare tire that was her belly and the large buns that she called her ass). “No pain, no gain! We’ll melt those pounds away!”

“SOMEONE… HELP!” Pamela wheezed loudly before Kay began to push Pamela back into her waddling jog.

“Kay always had that energy to her, so it was natural she chose to become a Jolteon,” Noir explained as he turned his back to the scene with his sisters. “And Pamela was always a bright girl, so she naturally chose the form that would allow her to continue to expand her mind.

“And that leaves Blaire…”

“OH! Noir! Fontina!” Blaire squealed as she waddled up to the counter that the two were standing behind, a large tray of steamy, butter rolls in her hands. “Glad you two are here! Would you mind doing me a favor and taste test these rolls?”

Before Noir and Fontina could get a word in, Blaire set the rolls on the counter and spun around, making the medicine balls that were her butt bouncing against each other in the tight black shorts she had squeezed into (making them seem like they were struggling against each other to take up more room inside the fabric) and showed off the underwear that was stretched of the hams she called her legs and butt. “M-Maybe she took it to a level too far?” Fontina asked as she and Noir snatched a roll each.

Noir only shrugged as he popped the roll in his mouth, as soon as he gulped, the Umbreon Moemon knelt down slightly, “She’s just doing what she loves and loves what she’s become. And trust me Fontina, you’ll love what you’ll become, trust me.”

“B-But what about you?” Fontina asked through a mouthful of roll.

“Me?” Noir questioned as he stood up straight and rubbed his chin. “Why did I become an Umbreon?”

“I’m actually rather curious about that myself,” Blaire stated as she munched on a few of the rolls as well. “You never did tell anyone why you chose to become an Umbreon.”

“Tell us!” Fontina asked as she pulled another roll from the plate.

“… Well, alright, since both of you got me on the spot,” Noir chuckled nervously as he ran a hand through his head of hair. “Fine, I choose to become an Umbreon Moemon because…”

Blaire leaned on the counter, her large breasts starting to smoosh into her plate of rolls and up into her chubby face while Fontina leaned closer to the older brother.

“… Its just cool to be dark,” Noir answered with a loud laugh.

Both Fontina and Blaire looked at their older brother laughing loudly at his own answer, both of them knowing that he was just pulling their legs. Blaire sighed as she stood up straight (using the counter to help her balance her weight), “Anyway, dinner will be ready soon, so get ready you two…”

----- Back to the Present -----


Fontina smiled to herself, remembering the good days was always a fun time… But remembering Blaire, Pamela and Miyu dealing with their weights (well, Miyu didn’t seem to care about her weight), Fontina looked down at her own pudgy body. She was roughly nearing Pamela’s size during that time frame, but her sisters had gotten bigger the last time she saw them (even Kay seemed to put on a few pounds after she went on her own journey).

Was it destiny that Fontina would get big? Get as big as Blaire herself?!

“Fontina dear, are you alright?”

Fontina dropped the broom she had in her hands, realizing that Shera was standing next to her now with a concerned look on her face. “Oh S-Shera, y-yeah, I was just thinking about my brothers and sisters…”

“You have siblings?” Shera asked, blinking a few times.

“Six of them actually,” Fontina chuckled… Only to have her good memories get drowned out by her growling stomach, making her face turn bright red. “Uh…”

“No worries, child,” Shera giggled to the side. “I came to get you, its time for dinner.”

“Dinner?!” Fontina gasped, more concerned how much time she had spent going through her memories rather than the event itself.

“Yes, so come now, everyone’s waiting,” Shera requested as she grabbed Fontina’s plump arm.

It looked like Fontina wasn’t going to be able to sneak away from dinner like she thought she would.

The blue haired girl grunted as she wriggled her way to the edge of the bed, belly covering her crotch as she heaved her mighty bulk from the plush comforter. Standing up, her torso formed three distinct sections; Her breasts, which were largely in charge of her figure, her belly, second in command, and the slowly growing spare tire that rested itself above her pale muffin top. She tugged down on her top in an embarrassed fashion, only for it to pop right back up over her belly.

"NO TIME!!" Ali shouted, "THERE'S NO WAY I'M GOING OUT LIKE THIS!!" she gesticulated to her zipper with pointed thumbs, nearly out of breath and ready to pass out any second. Fontina felt similar distress about two days ago when she outgrew her uniform. So that's probably why Ali had come to her. Because she was fat. Yay. "Okay now hold on Ali." Fontina said, reaching out to her friend with a soft comforting hand, "You can wear one of my old ones, it's no problem." she smiled, prompting Ali's tiny frame to jump up and hug her older friend. "Thanks Fontina... you're awesome." she said gratefully, "Where do you keep 'em?"

"Top drawer on the right."

To Fontina's surprise and Ali's remorse... they almost fit (save for the legs of course :P)

choices: Ali heads to the dining room with Kyrie in tow, someone's gotta be there...
Let's follow Fontina and Midnight, shall we?
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
Ali sighed loudly as lifted up the blue maid uniform that Fontina had provided, not only was it tight in a few places (mostly in the waist section and a was a baggy in the chest area (but that was a given)) but it didn’t really suit her tastes. Not that she had much of a choice in the matter. Until Shera had finished with the extra large uniforms, she’d have to work with it.

“… A thought just occurred to me,” Ali thought out loud as she pulled up the long skirt of the uniform, preparing to take some safety pins she had to make sure she wouldn’t trip over the fabric as she worked. “Why do we have to wear the uniforms? I mean, it’s not like this ‘master’ is even here.”

“I think its just to make sure that we’re professional,” Fontina answered as she walked back (trying to block out the fact that she was actually waddling) to the bed to grab her book. “I mean, the way we’re dressed now, if someone came to the door and we answered it we would…”

That’s when it happened.

It started slowly, with only small vibrations that only began to shake some of the lightest pieces of furniture. But then the shaking began to grow stronger, and stronger, sending both Ali and Fontina fell to the floor, both of them yelling and screaming as the shaking got stronger and stronger!

“ALI! GET UNDER THE TABLE!” Fontina shouted before both chubby girls quickly crawled under the nearby wooden table in an attempt to protect themselves (although, Fontina’s heavy frame took up most of the room underneath it).

However, as quick as the earthquake came, it ended just as quickly.

“Well… That was weird,” Ali admitted crawling out from under the bulk that was her friend Fontina’s blobby body.

“Still, are you alright?” Fontina asked, as she slid from the table, pushing the fact that her thunderous thighs brushed against both legs of the table at the same time.

“Yeah, and I could make a few bad jokes to it,” Ali sighed as she dusted off the borrowed maid uniform she had on. “But I’ll refrain from that. Anyway, what was that about?”

“Just seemed like a regular earthquake,” Fontina huffed as she pushed herself from the ground, her face slightly flushed from the action. “B-But, we’re far from the plates… So an earthquake shouldn’t have been that strong…”

“Maybe Ember jumped a few feet in the air and crashed?” Ali chuckled with a large smirk on her face. “Looks like she’d serve as a wrecking ball or something to that effect…”

“I doubt that,” Fontina answered as she walked towards the door that conjoined the rooms. “Ali, I’m going to check if Midnight’s alright, could you see if everyone else is alright?”

“Sure, no prob,” Ali replied as she ran towards the door.

------------------

A few minutes later Ali walked through the hallways, stepping over some of the broken dishes and ornaments that now riddled the hallways. “The earthquake must’ve been a lot stronger than I thought… That or maybe Ember just crashed right through here.”

Ali chuckled to herself as she turned the corner, however she stopped when she noticed that someone was on the floor, quivering as she held her legs close to her slightly chubby frame. Her sea-blue hair tails were laying on the floor and her slightly chubby face was skewed with a look of confusion and fear. Ali immediately knelt down to Kyrie’s side, “Kyrie?! Are you alright?”

It was almost as if the doll like girl didn’t even register Ali’s presence near her, she just kept on the floor shaking… “… He… He…

“He’s c-c-coming…”

“What?” Ali questioned as she shook Kyrie slightly, in hopes of snapping Kyrie out of this trance…

choices: wheen.... KABLAAAM!! Somebody busts RIGHT through the wall! On the second story?
Meanwhile, Walker's not the only casualty...
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
"Oh man, are you getting heavy..." Ali grunted as she hoed Kyrie down the hallway, the once waif-like girl now straining against Ali's largely unused forearms, "Of course, I guess I'm not one to talk, am I Kyrie?". Not even a twitch, no movement of any kind that would register that Kyrie had any comprehension of her surroundings. Which was strange considering just how well the young moemon had been doing socially this past week. She had learned to come out of her shell so much in these past seven days, in no small part thanks to Ali and Fontina looking out for her. Much like two older sisters would look out for the younger, more sensitive sibling. Looking down on her rounded, doll like face in such distress, the young Quilava moemon could only reflect on the fact that just yesterday Kyrie had experienced her first 'laugh out loud' moment when Ember laughed so hard she shot soda out her nose. Ali had never seen the young moemon laugh so hard in her entire life... but now she was reduced to this:

"H-He's coming... h-he's really coming..."

It scared her. The young fire-type was scared for her new friend. Admittedly she knew little to nothing about Kyrie's past, thus giving her little insight on her mental or physical health, but the signs that this little mystery moemon wasn't well might as well have been neon and flashing. "Hey come on Kyrie!" Ali stopped and repositioned the diminutive moemon in her arms, "Say something like-" here she did her very best to imitate Kyrie's meek voice "-'P-Put m-m-me d-d-down, y-you'll get h-h-hurt!', or, I dunno something!" she let out a low growl as Kyrie continued to babble on and on in her arms like a useless sack of potatoes. "HEY KYRIE!!" she hollered, "Wake up in there, you're starting to scare me!"

But, as predicted, no response.

She couldn't just leave her there, out alone without a friend in the world like she had been found. No, Ali had to carry Kyrie through with this one. Maybe Shera could help her, or at the very least she could go wake up that Horus guy. He seemed pretty knowledgeable with things like this. But for now, Ali could only shrug and heft around the chubby girl bearing the obligations of friendship. However, something in the back of her mind told Ali that lugging Kyrie around may have been easier a week ago. Before she gained her share of the mysterious pudge that seemed to follow Ali and her companions around like a bad smell. Her sleek, angular chin was coated in a layer of facial fat; giving it the appearance of a rounded triangle with too much junk in it's angle. Her cheeks were rosy and flushed, maybe the signs of a fever (Ali wasn't a doctor!) but they always seemed to get like that nowadays. As she sat in Ali's arms, Kyrie's middle folded up in a cute little valley- her non-existant breasts getting just plump enough to resemble little hilltops for her chubby terrain. Even her arms and legs had grown a little thicker, evidenced by the soft layer of flab that engulfed them and made them swing more slowly as her body bounced with every one of Ali's steps.

"Maaaaan." Ali groaned, huffing and puffing from the foreign activity of exercise, "So not cool, I knew I was getting kinda chubby but... huff... this is practically suicide!" From behind her, in a small pile of dishes and nick-knacks tossed carelessly by the tremors, a disgruntled voice rose to make a snarky comment as usual. "Of course you are, I've seen how you and your friends eat." it coughed, "I'm surprised you're all still mobile at this point... oh..."

It was Walker; the cross-dressing butler s/he! Ali wasted no time, "Oh crap, Walker are you alright?" the smaller moemon requimed, only for Walker to spit back at her, "What, don't you like my china cabinet blanket with broken porcelain accessories?" she snapped, "NO I'M NOT ALRIGHT!!" Ali jumped slightly as she sat the still vegetative Kyrie down beside the buried butler. "What happened?" the Quilava moemon asked, knowing full well to expect some sort of sharp response, "I mean, why're you buried under all this stuff?" the Absol moemon growled, her eyes wincing slightly at the intense pain she was experiencing, "I was just walking down the hallway when this stupid piece of junk fell on me!" in her fury, Walker let slip a heavy handed slap against the heavy cabinet, causing something to rattle inside and break, therefore causing the cabinet to rest even heavier on Walker's legs and thereby getting it's revenge. She in turn, as it was so very lady like, let out a long, loud, and exotic string of cuss words.

"Walker!" Ali shushed her, "Screaming isn't going to help!" Walker stared at Ali, hoping to channel her intense hatred into one glass melting stare directed at Ali's pupils. However, that strange light inside of the young moemon flared up again and rendered all of Walker's arbitration useless. All the Absol moemon could muster was, "...Fine... what's with tiny over there?" she pointed the the rocking Kyrie, only for Ali to shush her again. "Nevermind, can you walk?" she asked, helping Walker stand from the pile of rubble.

"Sh'yeah, I think I can-" and for the first time since Ali's "employment", Walker let out a yelp. Of pain. A human (well, moemon) emotion. "N-No..." Ali grabbed Walker's waist, still bandaged up from that age-old injury during training. "Alright, um... okay, I-I can do this..."

choices: At the Dining hall - Damage report (and breakfast of course)
Let's see what Midnight and Fontina are up to, shall we?
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
Ali didn’t even take two steps with Walker using her as a crutch when the whole mansion seemed to shake violently for a second time. Ali nearly stumbled herself and almost sent Walker to the ground again, but managed to stabilize herself at the last second. “A-Another one?!”

Ali turned towards Kyrie, who was now actually reacting in a different manner than she was earlier, her eyes were closed and her hands were gripping her puffier arms and through the large scaled shaking, Ali could see that the doll like Moemon was shaking herself.

However, just like the last one quake, this one didn’t last long. “Man, what is with these earthquakes?”

“That last one wasn’t an earthquake,” Walker growled through her gritted teeth. “It was more like something broke through a wall or something.”

“Wouldn’t it be safer to assume that a wall fell?” Ali questioned as she slowly walked towards the shivering Kyrie.

-----


However, Walker was right.

On the second floor someone had busted through a wall, with bricks, wood and various broken dÃ©cor riddling the floor as the bright sunlight from outside poured into the dust filled hallway. Slowly, the culprit who broke the wall slowly stood up from the floor, his tall muscular frame easily the same height of the hole behind him. Dressed in a long red vest and black pants, the man stretched his muscular arms, allowing the light inside of the building to reveal the black circular and line tattoos that riddled his dark tanned skin. His long red hair fell past his broad shoulders.

The large man looked to his left and then to his right. Then, a large smirk appeared on his rugged face before he cracked his neck loudly. “You’re here… I know you’re here my eternal foe.”

As he took a step forward, the entire mansion shook once more, sending some dust falling from the ceiling above, “You may have escaped your fate once, but I the great Atlus will not allow you to escape from me a second time!”

Taking another chance to look left and right, the mountain of a man named Atlus blinked a few times at his surroundings, “… Uh… Now, which way do I go to fight my eternal rival? Damn new age buildings!”

The large Atlus growled loudly before he charged down the right, disappearing a few seconds later. And just as he disappeared into the halls, one of the nearby doors opened up to reveal Claire stepping out into the hallways with a donut in her mouth. She munched on the sweet for a few seconds as she looked at the large gaping hole in the wall before she swallowed the sweet completely. “… Oh my, I didn’t know we were adding to the mansion, is this supposed to be where a new patio’s going?”

The large maid merely shrugged her shoulders as a second growl echoed through the hallways, making the large Dewgong Moemon place her hands on her pillowly stomach, “Oh yeah, its breakfast time too. I should hurry before everyone eats everything.”

choices: Status Report: Everyone congregates in the Dining Hall to see what's up!
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
“I doubt that,” Fontina answered Ali's sarcasm as she waddled towards the door that conjoined the rooms. “Ali, I’m going to check if Midnight’s alright, could you see if everyone else is alright?” The Quilava moemon nodded diligently, "Sure, no prob." she said, heading towards the door, leaving Fontina to tend to anything damaged or broken on this floor. Namely the possibility of a broken and/or damaged Midnight. If something had happened to her, the team would be without a leader. Though, it really didn't matter much if they had a leader or not right now, so it seemed to just boil down to that deep rooted friendship the three shared.

Fontina poked her head into Midnight's personal room. Before the quake, it was very much like the room that she and Ali shared, save for an actual bed in lieu of a pull-out sofa. But after the cataclysm, it seemed that Midnight's room suffered far more damage than the room she so haughtilly discarded. Ironic. But that wasn't the point, there was broken porcelain from nick-knacks pre-arranged on the shelves everywhere in both little pieces and big chunks of white material. The bed was wrecked, but that was probably just Midnight's morning slothliness at work. The armoir had tipped, along with everything inside of it, and the door had busted into three fractions as well as millions of splinters. The dresser had miraculously remained on all fours, only to be scooted all the way across the room and get caught on the doorknob, which broke, again causing lots and lots of sharp pointy spears of wood to litter Midnight's abode. And there, on her back, was Midnight herself moaning in pain.

"Ooohh..." she whimpered, eyes narrowed to block out the light from the ceiling lamp. Fontina noticed a little blood on the carpet, and a gash running down her arm. "M-Midnight!" the Vaporeon moemon stammered as she made her way through the wreckage to meet her friend, "Wh-What happened?!" the dark type moemon whined a little bit more before sniffling, "I-I don't know, I was just doing my toenails and... I just tipped over and fell off of the bed..." her head lulled over to the side, "Face first." Fontina gasped, ducking down with a heavy grunt to check Midnight's pupils for any signs of dilation. She was fine, but it was a little hard to tell with her dark brown eyes. "Are you okay?" Fontina asked, putting a chubby hand on her friend's forehead. "I-Is Walker here?" Midnight asked, still squinting. Fontina narrowed her eyebrows, "No, why would he be, are you okay?!"

Midnight groaned a little before responding with, "Good- I don't wanna have to act tough in front of that jerk anyway- no I'm in so much pain, Fontina!" the addressed moemon laughed a little and rolled her eyes, somehow she got the impression that Midnight would be okay. The Mightyena moemon shuddered and grabbed her flabby upper arm, wincing at the sting of her own touch. "Ow!" she hissed. "Don't touch it, you'll get it infected!" Fontina chided her friend, looking around for something to bandage her up with. "Wh-What, you calling me dirty?" Midnight chuckled weakly, one eye closing somewhat while keeping the other one on Fontina's chubby face. She could only laugh in response, "Come on, we can joke after we get you all fixed up."

Midnight let slip a small toothy grin, "Thanks Fontina.... you're great."

When suddenly, a second earthquake echoed through the entire house again! What was left standing in Midnight's room began to rattle once more, the stationary becoming mobile and the broken porcelain starting to bounce up and down. The precariously perched Fontina lost her balance and was sent tumbling forwards, letting out a loud "Oof!" when she probably should have been shouting safety instructions. Strangely enough, the quake didn't seem to last long. And while the first one was brief at best, this one seemed more like a dangerous tease for things to come! When all things were still again, Fontina decided to warilly open her mouth, "Phew, that was close." she sighed, "Are you okay Midnight, I- OH MY!!"

She had been sent tumbling forward during the earthquake, remember that dear readers? Meaning that she had landed on top of Midnight, the poor dear. Her soft, creamy expanse rested heavilly on top of Midnight's whipped chocolate body, their soft stomachs pressing together behind loungeabout clothes as the heavier of the two slowly tried to engulf the smaller. But that wasn't what had startled her. Fontina had lunged forward, and since they weren't exactly toe to toe, instead of Fontina ending up in Midnight's breasts (as she is the taller one) things ended up on the reverse...

Midnight, the quick tempered Mightyena moemon, had inadvertantly began to motorboat one of her longest and most trustworthy friends with muffled pleas for oxygen. "Mmmphphmm!!" she hollered with newfound vigor, wriggled about between the overfed moemon's fat breasts, "I-I'm sorry!" the blue-haired girl shouted before popping Midnight's head out, "A-Are you okay?!"

"YES, I'M FINE!!" she shouted, blushing ferociously, "J-JUST GET ME IN THE BED SO I CAN LAY DOWN FOR A SEC AND GET MY BEARINGS!!"
***
"Y-You're sure you're okay?" Fontina asked meekly, as she set Midnight's aching body on the plush confines of her bed. Midnight pat the patch on her arm, made from a ripped curtain in her room, weakly and let out a small, "Yeah, I'm cool." Fontina smiled and sat down next to her, causing the bed to creak noticably and Fontina to burn the bright red of embarassment. "S-So how about these quakes, huh?" she asked, mostly just trying to change the subject, "I mean, they're crazy right?"

Midnight nodded, "Yeah, whoever heard of a three second quake powerful enough to wreck a small city?" she huffed, struggling to sit up a bit, "Hey Fontina, would you mind drawing the curtains a little, the sun is really bright today." the water type nodded with fervor (especially after the embarassing incident of paragraphs 6-7) and released the mattress from the burden of her weight. "Oh wait, that's right, didn't we use your curtain?" she asked, turning back to the damaged dark-type, "For what?" she asked dimwittedly, "You know, your cut, we used it to bandage it up." Midnight rolled her eyes, "Well, I guess I can deal with a sunny day over a gash in my arm." she said begrudgingly.

"W-Wait a second, Midnight." Fontina said, holding up a finger, "Why's the sun out?"

"I'unno, maybe because it's daytime. Duh." she said sarcastically

Fontina shook her head, causing those round cheeks of her's to wobble around somewhat, "Nonono, I mean, it's rained every day since we got here, and it rained just last night!" she peeked her head out the window slightly, "But if you'll look outside, you'll see that everything is completely and totally dry!" Midnight pursed her lips, sitting up completely now, "Well yeah, that is kinda wierd I guess, but isn't everything usually dry after it stops raining?"

"It stopped raining, but whatever got rained on for that long is still going to be a little wet- but outside looks like a normal summer day!"

Both were quiet- things were getting strange around this mansion. Fontina rest a fist in her outstretched hand dutifully, "We'd better get to the dining room, everyone'll go there first to see what's up."
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.title: Oh it's a Quakey and Sunny Day...

choices: Atlus ripped out some of the plumbing! Now he's breaking through the ceiling!
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
“Where are you…? I can sense you here…”

Atlus stomped through the halls, almost shaking the entire house each time he took a step searching for someone and he could not be stopped…

… But he could be delayed…

“What in the ancient world is this place?” Atlus growled to himself as he looked at some of the paintings on the walls. “This looks like the temples I was forced into, only this seems to be a lot bigger and confusing, so many doors and so many weird murals on the wall. And the floor, what is this soft substance on the bottom of my feet?”

Taking a moment to look around, the massive Moemon bent over and ran his tattooed hand on the carpeting, “It feels like grass, but it’s softer and it’s blue. No doubt my arch-nemesis is the one behind this! She always did like blue… Atlus will find and destroy you!”

That’s when Atlus’s yellow eyes narrowed down on the nearest door, and he immediately slammed his foot into it, sending the door flying into the room, “Heeeeere’s ATLUS!”

The moment that Atlus crouched down and walked into the room, he was almost blinded by the gleaming light from the room, “URK! It’s a trap! I’m being blinded!”

Although, eventually, Atlus’s eyes began to adjust to the light and he observed the large room – Taking note that the room was made up of a fine, white and gleaming porcelain, bright lights reflecting from the ground and all around the walls were several paintings that depicted the ocean with several Magikarp and Remoraid leaping from the waves. Atlus was almost in aw as he slowly walked deeper into the room, “Perhaps this building is a castle, this does resemble that of a grand hall or…”

WHAM!

“URK!” Atlus grumbled out as he stumbled backwards, grabbing his now bruised shin. “Sonva… What the hell?!”

Atlus narrowed his eyes down on what he had just rammed into, but then tilted his head slightly at the sight before him, “… Oh, this is a throne room. There’s a throne right in front of me… But it’s not a throne I’ve ever seen before.”

Looking over the weird ‘throne’, Atlus peered into the seat, realizing that he was looking what appeared to be a small bowl with water in it. “Hmm, perhaps my arch nemesis has gotten stronger since our last fight. It’s obvious that she’s taken over this castle, and made this room her throne room… It’s a weird throne still, and what’s this lever here?”

Atlus pushed the lever on the side of the ‘throne’ slightly, allowing a loud unfamiliar sound to him to echo through the room and make the large Moemon jump slightly as he watched the water disappear into the throne and then reappear a few seconds later. “WHAT SORCERY IS THIS?!?”

… It’s called indoor plumbing…

--------


Meanwhile, in the Dining Hall, everyone was stationed in several different parts of the distorted room, apparently the large table had taken a powerful hit from the two quakes, with its legs now scattered on the ground with it flat on the carpeting. Standing in the corner of the room was Ali and Fontina looking over the still shivering Kyrie who kept muttering under her breath. When Fontina and Midnight arrived at the dinning hall, Wester had asked for one of the two girls’ help in sweeping up broken dishes in the room, and unfortunately, Midnight had saw this as a chance to get some more comfort food in the process.

In the middle of the room, next to the fallen table was Shera, carefully bandaging up Walker’s busted leg with Claire sitting on the ground next to them holding up the first aid kit. Ember wasn’t too far off, but she was curled up in the large ball that she was, still sleeping.

Speaking those who should be asleep, a familiar trio was in the room as well…

“Zis is so vrong and cruel!” Ivan groaned loudly as he tried to fix his mess of cropped hair. “I know zat ze earz can move wiz romance, but zis is so vrong!”

“Aw shut your fanged trap, Dracule,” Ethel growled as he pulled his skull like hood over his head. “I don’t like being awoken during the day either, but two earthquakes are kinda something to take notice of!”

Ethel then turned his head towards Ali, Fontina and Kyrie in the corner and smirked devilishly and muttered under his breath, “… besides, I heard that women get turned on during natural disasters. We play are cards right and…”

“And what?” Horus questioned as he walked up behind his two subordinates, a tray filled with several coffee cups held in his hands. Ivan was too preoccupied with his hair to really notice the Noctowl Moemon’s presence, but Ethel nearly jumped out of his uniform when he heard that raspy voice. “I don’t want to remind you two that we’re not doing overtime, so I suggest you two get some coffee while we discuss this.”

Ethel sighed loudly as he took two mugs, knowing full well that Ivan wasn’t going to grab a cup for himself.

“So, Shera, where do we stand with injuries?” Horus asked as he walked up the Kangaskhan Moemon, who was just finishing up with Walker’s injury.

“Well, aside from Walker’s broken leg,” Shera sighed with a sad smile on her face. “Ember’s got a few bruises, and Kyrie’s freaking out a little.”

Horus shook his head when he saw Kyrie being comforted, “Poor thing looks like she was held at knife point.”

“… What kind of saying is that?” Walker pointed out, taking one of the mugs of coffee.

“Now for damages,” Horus continued, either not hearing Walker’s complaint or just ignoring it. “I sent Ethel and Ivan around the third floor, some of the paintings fell from the walls and there are a few broken antiques, the floor doesn’t look like it took too much damage there, but what about the other floors?”

“First floor’s the same I’m afraid,” Shera sighed loudly. “The master’s not going to be happy about this, especially since his collection of rare golden plated limited edition statues got busted in the process.”

“He’s got them insured,” Horus replied with a sip. “Heck, he’s got everything insured here, I doubt he’ll have to worry too much about it. As long as the building itself is in tack, we should be good.”

“Yeah,” Claire sighed with a carefree smile on her face. “And I bet he’ll be really glad that the new patio is coming along great.”

Both Shera and Horus’s eyes widened when they heard that, making them both turn towards Claire and ask at the same time, “What are you talking about?”

“The hole on the second floor wall,” Claire replied with a bright smile on her chubby face. “Its coming along greatly, and that worker you had come is really fast and efficient.”

Horus sighed loudly with a slap to his forehead, “Great, there’s a hole in the house and we’ve got a trespasser… This is why I think we should get Houndoom Security guards in here! Shera, if the house doesn’t explode in the next five minutes, I’ll be amazed!”

The moment that Horus finished his sentence, a loud explosion rocked the entire mansion, almost shaking its entire foundations. Horus lowered his head grounded his teeth, “I could almost feel that coming, just as I finished that sentence!”
