choices: Kyrie. Some explaining is probably in order here.
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
C-CRACK

After the explosion settled, only one sound pierced the wary silence. C-CRAAACK! It was getting louder, it sounded like wood splitting somewhere in the mansion! "Wh-What was that?" Ali managed to squeak as Fontina held both her and Kyrie close to her large expanse. "I-I don't know..." Horus said quietly, seeming less and less in control by the second. "Everyone please be quiet, and no sudden movements." Shera said in a hushed though commanding tone, "Don't do or say anything unless it's absolutely necessary until these quakes are over."

Well that was about the worst thing Shera ever could have said. The feeling one gets when they're told not to do something is doing exactly what one was told not to do. Just not on a conscious level. How else could one explain that Ali's nose was starting to itch really bad, and her breathing was becoming somewhat labored. Or the fact that Fontina, who hadn't had any breakfast at all, still felt the pressure in her belly that threatened to waltz right up her esophagus and become a loud burp? Both women felt these urges, but as another large 'CRRAAAAACK' filled the bottom floor, they become much less urgent in lieu of their safety. Still, some things cannot be helped.

"Hey guys!" Midnight's voice clamored for an audience, "Did'ja feel that last one? Made the whole kitchen shake something fierce!" she practically shouted as she debuted into the kitchen in all of her boisterous glory, "I mean seriously, that one felt like it was coming from right under ground!" she was met with all kinds of sharp gazes and piercing glances, none so powerful as the severely peeved Ali and Fontina... except the unforgiving death glare that belonged to Walker. "Shut. Up." she said quietly from her propped position on Shera's lap, "Sit. Down." the Absol moemon continued advising the Mightyena moemon and gestured over to her friends. It took a second for any sort of response, but the one that followed was hardly worth the wait:

"You don't tell me what to do, you jerk!" the lupine moemon growled as she started for the wounded disaster-type, "Seriously, what gives you the right to order me around and treat me like some dumb bimbo?!"

"Because you are one!" Walker gave a horrible example of being quiet to the rest of the household, raising her voice in anger and even trying to lift her damaged body up from Shera's lap, "Now sit down and shut up or we could all be crushed by this whole damnable mansion!!" the butler's low tone of voice reverberated throughout the creepy silence that filled the mansion. Midnight, putting her safety ahead of her pride (for once, since this time she would die in sweats; atrocious) slowly backed away from the wounded moemon, backing towards her friends who had huddled in a corner. "Okay, okay..." she whispered very quietly...

"ACHOOO!!" Ali's nose had itched for far too long, and she let out one giant earth shattering sneeze, "e-excuse me..." she stammered, avoiding all the wide-eyed glares that surrounded her. She too became wide-eyed as the creaking and cracking of wood immediately picked up at a much faster rate. The sound waves from Ali's sneeze picked up, bouncing like pinballs off of the dining room walls and carried against all manner of broken decorum. Grunting became obvious from upstairs as it grew louder and louder, some mysterious groaning coming from the ceiling above. That one sneeze may very well have caused a chunk of the second story to collapse into the first!

And that theory proved pretty popular with the rest of the help as a large lump of wrecked brick stone and wood started forming on the already trashed ceiling. "Oh nice job, Ali!" Midnight chided, forgetting that she too was supposed to hush, "O-Oh Ali..." Fontina said in a disappointed tone, "Keep that damn mouth shut!" Walker howled. But amidst the vocal displays of anger, a new voice arose as the ceiling continued to sink further and further down. One that was gruff, commanding, and a little over stimulated. And it was clearly heard amongst the groaning of pipes and cracking of foundations as the overhead level finally gave way, one large hole appearing before the rest collapsed.

"DAMN THIS INFERNAL THRONE!!" Atlus would shout before he collapsed along with the ceiling. Just a few seconds earlier, the large redheaded man had gotten splashed with water from the back of the toilet- hoping maybe there was some way he could convert his enemy's throne into one he could call his own. He came crashing down, and while nobody was hurt, the entire foundation of the house shook and vibrated with Atlus. Exactly, it shook with Atlus. The caved-in second story of the house was much larger and heavier than the weight of the statuesque moemon, but for some reason unbeknown to the rest of the astonished moemon, Atlus's impact onto the solid ground seemed to shake it in a new way that caused more and more things to fall from their shelves!

Everyone waited for the dust cloud to settle, light coughing filled the room as the dust dissipated; only to reveal Atlus playing with pipes.

"Never in my long life have I seen such wizardry!" he said, furrowing his brow as he scrutinized your basic everyday L-pipe, "Holes... that are removable!!" he stared to the ceiling, and back again at the pipe, then back to the ceiling... and then back to the pipe once more. "These holes... these things... they must be the work of my immortal nemesis!" he shouted, crushing the angle of the pipe with one mighty grasping motion, "I must find a way to convert these holes... not this one though, I think it's broken."

"OH WILL YOU SHUT UP!!" Ali shouted to the large man, that indignant inside of her flaring up again, "YOU JUST WRECKED OUR ENTIRE HOUSE TO PLAY WITH PIPES?!?! WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU?! GET OUT!! GET OUT!! GET OUUUUUT!!!" she screamed, panting with everybody in the room staring (save Ember, cuz she's still sleepin') The wave of courage remained strong, even as Atlus started lumbering towards her, dwarfing the Quilava moemon with his massive build.

"You..." he said in a much more serious tone, looking down in Ali's direction.

"Yeah, what of it?"

"Not you..." he said, the gold in his eyes flaring up violently, "YOU, my eternal rival..." he rasped, pointing downwards at...

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
Kyrie…

“Humph, it’s a sad sight indeed,” Atlus chuckled leaning forward slightly, making Kyrie actually respond for the first time this morning other than muttering to herself…

“N-NOOOOO!” Kyrie screamed as she scurried away from the corner and hid behind Fontina.

Atlus threw his head back and laughed loudly, “My eternal rival has become pathetic! Oh, such sweet, delicious…”

Before Atlus could continue, he felt something banging up against his shin, making him turn down to see Ali kicking his shin, “I thought I was getting tackled by a Caterpie, but it’s only a runt.”

“Just what the heck is your problem?!” Ali snarled at Atlus, keeping her resolve just as strong as the large mysterious Moemon narrowed his sight on her. “And why are you scaring Kyrie?!”

Atlus only chuckled as he lifted his hand up and reached around Ali to reach for the back of her borrowed uniform. Before Ali could react, Atlus was lifting her off the ground with only his pointer finger and thumb clamping on the fabric. The fact that he was able to easily lift her off the ground (especially with her recent weight gain) was able to make Ali flinch and gulp slightly. “A reason? Very well you stuffed runt of a Moemon, you want my reasoning? Very well…

With his face curled up into a wicked smirk, Atlus stood up tall, increasing the distance between Ali and the floor below her. “Apparently my mortal nemesis didn’t tell you anything about her – Do you see these markings on my body? My clothing? Or even my power?”

To prove his point, Atlus lifted his large foot up into the air and slammed it into the floor, sending a powerful shockwave through out the entire mansion. But even more impressive was the fact that he had sent a large amount of the debris from the table flying into the air for a few seconds before they landed on the ground. “Haven’t you wondered what your scared little friend was? What sort of Moemon?

“Perhaps I should introduce myself… I am Atlus – The titan of the earth! The king of earthquakes! The earth god himself – Groudon!”

Everyone’s eyes widened when they heard Atlus’ roar throughout the room – Everyone had heard of the legends of Groudon, the Continent God of this world with the ability to control the land and create a constant bright sunlight and was known as the creator of the lands.

However, that didn’t seem to persuade a certain Quilava Moemon, “So what? You’re a big idiot who thinks he’s Groudon? What does that have to do with anything?!”

“You just don’t get it, do ya, you worthless mortal?” Atlus chuckled turning his wrist to make Ali turn towards Kyrie. “If I’m Groudon, and this girl you know as Kyrie is my eternal rival… Well, perhaps Moemon are stupid now-a-days…

“She is the goddess of water and my timeless foe – Kyogre!”

Kyrie’s eyes closed as tears began to well up in the corner of her eyes, and the smirk on Atlus’ face grew more demonic, “And now… To finish what we started at that city known as Sootopolis! And no one will get in my way this time!”

Then with a simple flick of his wrist, Atlus tossed Ali through the air, “AAAAH!”

Ali closed her eyes, waiting for the moment of impact… However…

“URK! For a dainty little girl, y-you are a little on ze heavy side!” Ivan groaned as he struggled slightly to hold up Ali’s heavier frame.

“My, what a way with words,” Ali muttered.

Meanwhile, while Atlus tossed Ali through the air, Horus took that opportunity to jump on the larger Moemon’s back and grab Atlus’s neck and raised arm, “SHERA! GET EVERYONE OUT OF HERE! NOW!”

“YOU DARE OPPOSE THE GOD OF EARTH!?!?” Atlus roared stumbling about, trying to shake the Noctowl Moemon off of him.

“ETHEL! IVAN! ANYTIME YOU WANNA HELP IS GOOD!” Horus snarled slamming his foot into Atlus’ back a few times.

Shera quickly lifted the injured Walker in her arms while Claire actually rolled the sleeping Ember out of the room. Fontina and Midnight were both helping in trying to carry Kyrie out of the room with Ali leaping from Ivan’s arms and following her team.

“DAMN IT! RELEASE ME!” Atlus snarled as both Ivan and Ethel leapt onto Atlus, following their boss’s orders.

“TELL ME THIS ISN’T THE ONLY PART OF THE PLAN!” Ethel shouted as Atlus stumbled about, carrying all three of the other Moemon about slightly.

“AS SOON AS I COME UP WHAT HAPPENS NEXT, YOU’LL BE THE FIRST TO KNOW!” Horus shouted back tightening his grip around Atlus’ neck, trying to perform a choke hold.

“ZIS IS GOING TO RUIN MOI’S HAIR!” Ivan cried with tears in his eyes.

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
It took three of the most highly trained moemon at disposal to successfully wrap around Atlus' large neck, yet no one could squeeze the air out of this behemoth! His tanned skin was tough and hard as armor, while rough as stone and just as thick as a tree trunk. Their opponent was a monster, nay a God, an yet the persistence between them was just as strong as it would be with any other intruder. "RELEASE ME YOU FOOLISH ->GACK<-" Ethel tightened his grip, the tiny arm of the diminutive boy reaching just around his adam's apple. "Quiet!" he shouted, "This is MY mansion, you'll speak when I say so!"

The ghost type back-flipped off of Atlus' sturdy pecs and got into battle position, "I don't even need you guys to take down some Groudon impersonator!" he shouted cockily, "Even if it was Groudon himself, you guys just might as well sit down and have a cup of coffee!!" He ripped the sleeves from his guard uniform to reveal a small vest and scarf, bringing the thin cloth over his face and narrowing his sights. "As much as I would enjoy that, Ethel," Horus grunted as he picked up the slack of his cocky subordinate, "This is serious, impostor or not!"

"I AM NO IMPOSTOR!!" Atlus roared, bucking and braying like a wild Tauros. The flying pair of guards kept wrapped to the monstrosity's neck, but only long enough to be flicked off like insects. "THE AUDACITY!!" Atlus bellowed again, ramming Ivan into the wall with his mighty shoulder, "HOW DARE YOU SPEAK OF THE GREAT ATLUS LIKE I'M NOT EVEN HERE!!" He grabbed at Horus, who scrambled up the intruding body like a drowning rat in search of higher ground. "Ethel!" Horus commanded, "This isn't a game!"

The ghost type smiled from beneath the black scarf, his gaze half-hidden by the lopsided hood; letting only his left eye show the malice behind it. "Oh yeah it is." he said quietly, smirking to himself, "And I'm the winner."

At once the tiny frame disappeared in mid-taunt without so much as a cool effect. No shadow whisking him away, no puff of smoke. Suddenly he reappeared, along with his foot that was slammed into Atlus' perfectly sculpted jawline. While it didn't hurt, it certainly took the large man by surprise, "Wh-WHAT TRICKERY IS-" yet his outburst was cut short by another sudden slash to hit his chest. Again, little more than a flesh wound if anything, but it scared the pants off of him. "How'dya like my Shadow Sneak?!" Ethel's voice taunted, coming from many many places at once, "Too much for ya, huh Tiny?!"

Another quick burst of speed allowed Ethel to propel himself at Atlus' torso, aiming for the kill as he held his small (usually concealed) dagger above his head. For theatrical effect, imagine that this takes in slow motion: the small adolescent ninja's small yet built body shooting directly at Atlus' Adonis-esque pectorals. His golden eyes slowly face the approaching ninja, only to find that it is too late, there is little he can do to escape this fate...

Except summon up a wall of the previously erected foundation of land beneath the mansion.

Fortunately, Ethel didn't hit the barrier face-first (as predicted) and simply back-flipped from the wall of dirt and landed on a rickety shelf. "Phew, that was close!" he laughed, dropping the serious demeanor for a second to live up to his true comedic character. "Ethel, vat's zat he's doing?" Ivan questioned from the other corner of the room, "It looks like dirt, kinda." the smaller guard mused, wiping some of the substance from his small blade. "Yes, I vigured as such, zis man iz Groudon after all, non?"

"Don't be so sure!" Horus' voice called from the other side of the wall, "This... man could still have some weaknesses, don't give up!"

From the other side, Horus was having his own difficulties with Atlus. The enormous man had seperated him from the rest of his squad, and he knew it! The "God" had lumbered towards him and pushed with all his might, easily enough to outclass Horus' own. The caffeine junkie had been sent flying into the wall, but fortunately, the air played to his strengths. He released his hands and prepared for the impact to come, dropping like a bomb onto Atlus and his sturdy foundation. "TAKE DOWN!!" Horus shouted, hearing some bones pop.

Much to his surprise, they weren't all his.

His elbows, long reinforced by years of hard training with Walker and the others, had become callused and hard enough not to feel the devastating effects of landing like a double-headed hook onto Atlus' shoulder, his knees nowhere near fragile enough to be broken by Atlus' plated spinal cord. Atlus on the other hand, while not devastated by the attack, had certainly felt it's effects.

"Y-You..." he grumbled, reaching behind him to catch the pesky pigeon who had so impudently thought to attack him. When he did, Horus' next resort was a swift kick to the nose. It did nothing. "I have long since honed my body to perfection, impudent one." Atlus' voice rumbled lowly, "You, a mere goose without his flock, cannot hope to penetrate my exterior." Horus backed down, keeping his fists clenched whiteningly tight, "IVAN, NOW!!"

"Just as bossy as alvays, eh Horus?" the thickly accented drawl came from above him.

Using his magnetic shoes for traction, Ivan Dracule had walked over the wall and positioned himself over the current fight. Piecing apart Horus' codewords "Don't give up" meaning, "Come back me up", allowed him a little insight to the current situation. When Horus called for backup, he got what he asked for. "Vine!" Ivan shouted, releasing the magnets on his shoes and falling down- using his cape to fall down in a much more controlled manner- and landing directly on top of Atlus' shoulders, "TOXIC!!"

Even Atlus, while not "human" per say, was taken aback when a mere mortal's teeth punctured his impenetrable skin. His rock hard, sand paper like, tooth chipping skin! Ivan's pronounced canines chomped right into his trap muscles and he felt something warm fill his veins. At once, the vampire jumped from his back and landed on top of the wall once again, spitting out a disposed toxic cartridge like tobacco. "You like eh, Monsieur Groudon?"

Atlus only chuckled, cracking his neck loudly and forcing the purple liquid from his veins with sheer pressure. "FOOLISH NOSFERATU!!" Atlus howled, "I am the God of EARTH, your poison is secreted from the plants that I lay foundation to!" Ivan scratched his noggin, ignoring the cowlick that sprung up in the back, "Vat?"

"He's a ground type, poison doesn't work against him." Horus said in a disappointed fashion

"Oh."

"Yeah."

"I'm still here you know." Atlus said in a menacing tone before using his mighty arms to punch Horus in his middle, sending him flying into Ivan. He chuckled menacingly before again his "impenetrable" wall had been penetrated. This time in a much more practical fashion. "STOP TALKING!!" Ethel shouted, readying some blue capsules in his palms. He had broken a wall created by Atlus' Earth Power!

"SKULL TECHNICAL TECHNIQUE: BLIZZARD!!!"

"Cold" Ethel grabbed a hold of Atlus' head with his freezing hands, making him roar in pain like a lion. He began bucking and braying once more, throwing Ethel all about the room. He crashed through his own wall and forced all three of them outside into the horrid sunlight in hopes of melting away Ethel's frosty touch

"IMPUDENCE!!" he shouted, "NOW THAT WE ARE IN MY ELEMENT, THERE WILL BE NO HOPE FOR YOU!!"

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
“You’re going to pay for your insolence!” Atlus roared as he stomped his foot on the now dry ground, creating a large tremor that rocked the plains that he and the night staff were standing on now. The tremor seemed to grow weaker as a large pillar of earth erupted from the ground in front of the Groudon Moemon. “ROCK TOMB!”

With a powerful punch, Atlus slammed his fist directly into the pillar of rock, shattering it into millions of pieces that flew through the air towards the night staff. However, thanks to the groups obviously superior speed, they managed to dodge the jagged pieces of stone – With Ivan skidding to the side, Ethel disappearing without a trace and Horus leaping from the big pieces to get closer towards the titan of a Moemon…

Then, with the last stone, Horus leapt high into the air, pulling back his right arm and holding it back with the other, almost making his right arm growling a metallic silver, “The only one who’s paying is you! STEEL WING!”

Atlus merely tightened his muscles and pulled back his own fist, basking it in a powerful blue flame, “FOOLS! Your attempts are useless! DRAGON CLAWS!”

The blue flames seemed to sprout out three claws that Atlus threw forward, making it come in contact with Horus’ fist, sending a rush of light and blue flames through the air. For a moment, it looked as though both of them were evenly matched, neither one of them budging with the force that they were creating with their attacks.

However, Atlus took a mighty step forward, and smirked wildly, “Puny mortal! Did you honestly think that you could win with just that amount of force!”

“Actually, no!” Horus growled.

Atlus raised an eyebrow, only to realize that something was standing on his broad shoulders with something exceedingly cold clamped to the sides of his head. “SKULL TECHNICAL TECHNIQUE: BLIZZARD!”

Before Atlus could properly respond, a deep freeze ran through the Groudon’s head, making him lose his concentration and allowed Horus to go over his Dragon Claw attack and slam his glowing arm right into Atlus’ neck, making the larger Moemon gag loudly as the force knocked him to the ground with a loud booming sound that caused a large amount of dirt to fly up from the ground.

Both Horus and Ethel leapt back and landed on the ground, both of them breathing hard. Horus removed his hat and wiped the sweat from his brow, “Damn… He was a tough sonvagun, good job Ethel.”

“Meh, he was all talk,” Ethel chuckled, before he turned towards the mansion to see Ivan step out from the large hole in the wall. “And thanks for the help Ivan!”

“Please,” Ivan sighed as he walked up to the other two security guards. “Moi was dodging flying rocks, FLYING rocks. If moi was struck wiz one, zen zat would’ve been a tragedy for ze entire world!”

“Your ego’s a tragedy,” Horus sighed putting his cap back on. “Now then, we gotta figure out what to do with the big guy here and…”

Before Horus could finish, a powerful wave of heat pushed back all of the dirt and dust, and even made all three of the security team skid backwards. And standing amongst the flying dirt, was Atlus himself, his entire body glowing with a powerful red aura that make his skin turn to a bright red with smoke rising from his body. “DO. YOU. THINK. YOU’VE. WON!?! YOU. HAVEN’T!”

The grass at Atlus’ feet began to catch on fire, growing stronger and stronger as Atlus crossed his arms over his chest, “EVERYTHING! I’LL BURN… EVERYTHING TO THE GROUND! ERUPTION! ERUPTION! ERUPTION! ERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRUPTION!”

“Zis is bad!” Ivan yelped as he turned towards Ethel. “Quick! Use zat technique of yours! Cool his head!”

“Are you nuts?!” Ethel snapped back pointing towards the Groudon Moemon that now had flames dancing around his body. “Even if I did, the guy’s on fire! FIRE! I’d get burned to a crisp in a matter of seconds!”

“Whatever we’re going to do,” Horus growled as he narrowed his eyes at the going-critical Groudon. “We better do it fast! Ivan! You’ve mastered that Air Cutter right?”

“Yes… Wait,” Ivan gasped as he came to realization. “Horus! No! Zat technique is strong, but if we do zat while ze oaf over zere is like zat, zen…”

“Don’t you think I don’t know that?!” Horus growled loudly as he grabbed his right bicep tightly with his left hand, making his right arm glow bright silver once more. “But we don’t have a choice in the matter!”

“Wait, what the hell are… You two… talking…” Ethel began to stammer off as a large smirk appeared on his face, drool starting seep from the corner of his mouth. “Oooh yeah…”

Both Horus and Ivan blinked a few times, realizing that Ethel was staring at the mansion, more specifically the exposed second floor… and even more specifically at the fact that Kyrie was standing at the second floor dressed in the swimsuit, sleeves and head fins she was wearing when she was found – However, it looked like it was a size or two smaller and showed off the blossoming breasts, hips and tummy that were the result of her recent weight gain.

Horus’s eyes widened as he quickly pulled down his hat over his eyes, “W-What in the world is she wearing?!”

“One of the sexiest things I’ve ever seen!” Ethel howled with a large smirk on his face.

“Hmm… Now if only she was a little older,” Ivan pointed out.

“She’s a Kyogre Moemon,” Ethel pointed out. “I don’t think you’d have to… worry… Oh hell yeah!”

“What’s happening now?” Horus asked, not bothering to pull his hat back.

Ethel, Ivan and even Atlus were watching Kyrie as she began to dance about the second floor, swaying her hips in a seductive manner and using the unattached sleeves as if they were fans as she spun around, her long hair waving about her body. There were mixed reactions amongst the fighting four, like how Horus kept his eyes covered by his hat, while Ivan and Ethel couldn’t turn their eyes away. Atlus however, his eyes were widened at the sight of the mesmerizing dance, “NO! STOP! STOP IT NOW!”

A crash of thunder crashed through the air, making Horus look up to the sky to see that where the sunny, clear sky was, there was now a dark clouded sky. A smirk appeared on Horus’s face when he came to realization, “… Rain dance… Ivan!”

Ivan snapped out of his stupor from watching Kyrie, blinking a few times, “O-Oui, sir?!”

“We’re doing the technique now!” Horus announced as he grabbed his right arm again, making it glow bright silver as he ran forward.

“R-Right!” Ivan yelped as he slammed his right leg into the ground, creating a powerful wave of air to surround his leg.

A few moments later, it began to rain, the water falling onto everyone outside – Including Atlus, who’s skin was starting to steam and lose the fiery red aura that was around him, “NO! THIS CAN’T BE…”

“AIR CUTTER!” Ivan shouted, delivering a powerful roundhouse kick that sent the air that was around his leg to fly through the air and fly towards Horus’s back.

However, instead of getting hit by the attack, the Noctowl Moemon leapt on the attack and rode it, propelling him towards the surprised Atlus.

“I… I AM GROUDON! THE STRONGEST IN THE…” Atlus roared…

“STEEL WING!”

… Only to get Horus’s empowered attack directly in his neck sending him spinning up into the air with his eyes blanking out. As Atlus spun through the air, his entire body seemed to pop into a large cloud of red smoke that fell to the ground, sending a large amount of mud to fly through the air.

However, from the amount that was flung, it would appear that something smaller than the giant that was Atlus had fallen in its place.

As the rain continued to fall thanks to Rain Dance, all three of the night staff began to investigate where ‘Atlus’ had fallen…

“I will not be defeated!” Atlus’s voice sounded… Only, it sounded a bit lighter than it did a few minutes ago. “I am a god!”

The figure that stood up from the mud was none other than Atlus, only… It looked to be one third of the God Moemon. Standing in between the three was a small miniature Atlus (almost bordering on the chibi level) with a slim, tan body with his large clothes hanging off his small body and his long red hair matted with mud. The tattoos on his body were gone, and it was as if the three were looking at a teenaged… Or kid version of Atlus who was caught playing in the mud.

“I will destroy each and every one of you!” Chibi Atlus roared, stomping his foot into the mud a few times. “I will not take any of this disrespect from such commoners! I will…”

WHAM!

“AAAAAH!” Atlus screamed loudly as he went flying through the air courtesy of Ivan’s foot.

A loud splash of mud echoed through the air as Ethel laughed, “Ha! That’s what you get for messing up MY mansion!”

“Horus, what happened to him?” Ivan asked shaking some water from his hair.

“Hell if I know,” Horus replied with a smirk. “But, if he goes flying with that attack, I don’t think he’ll be much of a problem. And we owe a lot to that young Kyrie girl…”

Horus and Ivan turned to the second floor, just in time to see Kyrie fall to the floor, exhausted and her face flushed. “Still, there’s a lot of damage… But before that…”

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
"UNHAND ME! I AM A GOD, DO YOU PUNY ONES UNDERSTAND THAT WORD?!" a once proud deity screamed and hollered like the child he so much resembed, "G-O-D; GOD!!" the super-deformed Atlus squirmed about in Claire's soft lap. "Oh!!" Claire squealed, tightening her grasp around the squirming legendary and forcing him into her generous adiposity, "He's just so cute! I can barely stand it!" Atlus' expression only darkened as the back of his head was slowly enveloped by cleavage, one golden eye twitching as his cheeks became a harsh lava red, "U-UNHAND ME MORTAL!!" he shouted, his resolve somewhat questionable, "I-I WILL NOT BE SEDUCED BY THE LIKES OF YOU, ...y-you... BIG BELLIED CODFISH!!"

"AW!!" Claire squealed, her own resolve strengthening as she cuddled him in an even more affectionate manner

"Can we be serious here for a second?" Ali turned to the crowd of onlooking members of the staff, most of them just as exasperated as she was with just sitting around watching Claire snuggle around the tiny lord of the land. "He totalled this house; our house, the place where we all sleep and work and... well you know!" Ali turned back to the shrunken idol and outstretched a pudgy finger in his direction, "Something has got to be done!" Midnight, behind her friend, cracked her knuckles threateningly, "I say we just give him a five-second head start, and do whatever feels right when we catch the shrimp!"

The crowd seemed very pleased with that idea, as a resounding cheer of agreement circled throughout the mob. Fontina, however, tried to play peacemaker as always. "Now hold on a second!" she hollered over the outbursting crowd, "Even if we do beat up Atlus, what will that solve?" She struggled somewhat to lift each of her heavy legs over one another to waddle beside Ali, "The mansion will still be in shambles, and then there will be even less hands to help fix it." Atlus pried himself from Claire's busom to voice his disapproval, "My hands will assist you in NOTHING!" he spat back, his still prominent brow furrowing together, "Even with this large-chested wench holding me back, my feet alone are enough to take down all of you soft squishy mortals!!"

"Enough."

A rather calm voice managed to quell the roars of the crowd, one so unusually calm and put-together that no one was really surprised when it was Shera. The large Kangaskahn moemon waddled in a very elegant fashion towards the crowd, the look in her eyes not one of anger or hatred, it wasn't one of pity or even sadness. It was the most terrifying look Ali, Fontina, or Midnight had ever seen. Ever. A completely and totally unreadable expression: Shera was blank as a slate. From behind her, where her blubbery form once stood in the ruined hallway, Kyrie (now dressed in her regular attire again) peeked her head into view. She was, as usual, quiet. It seemed that whatever effect Atlus had on Kyrie had dissapated for now, rendering her only somewhat of a recluse. But hey, that was normal.

Even Atlus stopped howling and carrying on as his opposing mob parted to make room for the intimidating head maid. But his lapse of ego didn't last very long, returning to him in a swift, though somewhat shaky fashion. "Wh-What, you have something to say Large One?" he popped his mouth with a cocky sneer. Shera didn't flinch. She didn't wince, she didn't draw back, she didn't even get angry. Shera lowered her head and smiled gently in the demi-Groudon's face and smiled a very eerie smile. "How would you like to get cleaned up, you got awfully messy out there in the mud." she said in a stoic manner

Everyone was shocked.

"Well it's about damn time I was offered my Godly treatment!" Atlus said haughtilly, signalling his captor to release him from her suffocatingly flabby embrace, "I was starting to think you people had forgotten that Gods are supposed to be worshiped!" Shera smiled some more, narrowing her eyes at the small boy in an almost cheerful manner. "Ali, would you be a dear and help me keep Kyrie company?" she turned to Claire, who had now fully released the now-mobile diety, "Claire, find Ember and help her draw the bath- the poor dear has gotten so filthy, he may be in there for hours." she stretched the word in a very... chilling manner, extending one chubby hand for Atlus to grab and be escorted by.

"W-Well I don't know about hours, housewench." Atlus said, reaching out to grab Shera's hand, "Maybe the better half of a-

But he stopped midsentence as Shera's hand engulfed his. No one quite understood why, until Ali walked ahead of the two to meet Kyrie in the hallway. The look on Atlus' face was one of pure terror and pain. Judging by the veins popping up from the back of Shera's hand and the whitening of both her knuckles and Atlus' hand; she must have been squeezing pretty hard. "Ah...Ah...." he whimpered, the weighty woman dragging his little body down the hall.

Ali's brow remained furrowed until she met with Kyrie, who stood next to her and seemed to be in much better comfort than earlier. She smiled at her Quilava friend and wrapped her in a tight hug, "Th-Thank you so much... for earlier..." Kyrie said quietly as she let go of Ali's pudgy form. All the hate that Atlus' presence seemed to slink away, as Ali started to smile too. "Hey, no prob." she said in a quiet, though confident tone of voice, "That's what friends are for; come on, you better be here for this too."

Kyrie nodded silently and followed the other three...
***
"Unhand me land whale."

"Aw you were right Claire, Atty's really cute!" Ember said in a cutesy-utesy sort of manner as she dangled the boy off of the ground. She twirled him around as his little legs stayed lifeless, swaying about in the air as he was spun about like some plaything for this immensely tubby moemon. "I said let go of your God, gluttoness!" he growled before Ember enveloped him in a hearty embrace. WHAP!

“GAH! CURSE THIS INFERNAL CONTRAPTION!”

Well, most injuries were recovering. For a certain chibified (I know it’s not a word!) deity, his pain from his humiliating loss was only the beginning of his pain. Not only was he embarrassed from not only the loss, being treated as child and being stripped naked in front of several commoners, but it only went downhill from there. Everyday was another indignity to the God of Earth, starting with his hair – Once he had long, luscious locks of fiery red hair that were as unruly as the rays of the sun on a dessert.

Now, it was cut short (save for the long, thin tail that was tied back with a thin black thread. And he was forced to wear these weird clothes that the ‘Large One’ referred to as ‘denim overalls’, which he was forced to wear along with a smaller version of his red vest. Although they were comfortable, the fact that he had to wear these dreaded things while he was forced by almost everyone in the mansion to re-build the damages that he caused. And while he did get help from different members of the mansion, that didn’t stop Atlus from getting his thumb hit by the contraption called a ‘hammer’.

“There! The wall’s done!” Atlus howled throwing the hammer to the ground with a loud slam.

Surprisingly enough, the interior wall was actually built rather well considering who was building it, the basic framework was completed, but it would take some time to get the proper wiring and insulation (after all, there was an incident in the last month when Atlus was trying to figure out how a ‘lamp’ worked and he got zapped). “And I can’t take this anymore!”

“Yeesh, you certainly act spoiled like a god,” Ali huffed as she waddled towards the fuming Atlus. “You actually did a good job here though…”

“Humph! Of course!” Atlus laughed loudly with his tiny arms crossed over his chest. “Everything that I make is a work of art! And at least I haven’t been lazy like the rest of you bunch!”

“Hey! We’ve been pulling your weight around here, you smart ass!” Ali growled as she slammed a meaty leg into the ground.

“I think it’s your weight that needs to be pulled,” Atlus huffed with a roll of his yellow eyes. “Especially since it looks like you ripped open another hole in those garments of yours!”

Ali gasped as she quickly turned her body around, eliciting a loud ripping sound to echo through the hallway, and her plump face blushing a bright red. Over the last month, this was the third maid uniform that Ali had outgrown/ripped, only this time it ripped in a proper place, namely near the chest area where she actually had developed something that she had been dreaming about for ages – cleavage. And not just simple cleavage, but enough to nearly rival Midnight’s bust size (at least, before the three entered the mansion). Unfortunately for Ali, that wasn’t the only thing that had grown, the rest of her rounding form looked to be on the path to follow a familiar Vulpix Moemon’s figure – a wobbling double chin that peaked out every time Ali spoke, while her stomach and lower half looked like they doubled in size over the last mouth, pushing her maid uniform to the point where it was a second skin on her with frills.

“Ha!” Atlus laughed loudly. “How the not-so-mighty have fallen! It’s pathetic to see that not only my eternal rival has grown soft, so have her companions! But it’s also very comical!”

“This coming from a midget,” Ali countered using her arms to cover up the rip in her uniform, she’d have to talk to Shera about this again.

“Your insults mean nothing to me, fire mouse,” Atlus spat with a sneer on his face. “Tell the Large One that I’m done for the day.”

“You know, it wouldn’t kill you to learn our names,” Ali pointed out as Atlus rolled his eyes, unaware of the third figure that was sneaking up on the two in the shadowy hallway.

“Please, would a noble take the time to learn the names of the serfs that works beneath him?” Atlus retorted, not noticing that a large, bulky shadow was slowly creeping up behind him. “You lousy fools may have me under your control in my moment of weakness, but as soon as I get my power back I’ll…”

“ATTY!”

Atlus’s eyes almost bulged out of his eye sockets when two meaty arms wrapped around his neck and pulled him into a familiar tanned bosom and belly. “URK! T-The Young Kit!”

Ali blinked a few times as Amber’s large frame bounced about the field, wagging Atlus’s smaller body through the air as she continued to dance about the hallway, making a small earthquake of her own. “Atty! I heard in the halls that you’re done! YAY! Now you can play!”

“R-Release me you bulbous b-b-buffoon!” Atlus gagged as his face began to turn slightly blue due to the lack of air that was getting through his lungs. “I… I have n-no time f-f-for you!”

“Aw, Atty, you’re always the kidder!” Ember laughed as she quickly ran down the hall, jiggling all the while with Atlus in her death grip.

Ali could feel a large bead of sweat roll down the side of her chubby head, ‘… I can’t tell if Ember likes Atlus as a love interest, or if she thinks he’s some sort of pet. Still though, I wish I could talk to him one on one, he knows about Kyrie’s past. Sure she’s gotten better, but still, there’s still more that’s holding her down…’

However, Ali still had to deal with some work before she was done for the day, so she slowly began to waddle down the hallway, still having one of her puffier arms covering over the rip over her chest (which she secretly smiled at).

While the rest of the main group was in the hallways, our sights immediately turn towards the familiar kitchen, with various delicious aromas lofting through the air. The smells were coming from the stove, where a familiar Wigglytuff Moemon was at hard at work.

However, something seemed different about Wester, perhaps it was the fact that his hair was combed differently or maybe it was that his uniform was extremely baggy on his thinner frame. “Hmm… Smells good…”

“Yeah! It does!”

Wester smiled when he heard that voice, making his slightly sleeker (yet still chubby) face turn to the side, “Ah, excellent timing Midnight, you get the dishes done from lunch?”

“Like those dishes could really stand a chance,” Midnight replied, her own face curled up into a superior smirk. “So, what you got cooking for dinner tonight?”

“Well, why not take a taste test for youself?” Wester offered as he took a spare spoon and lifted it into one of the pots he had on the stove. One quick scoop, Wester held up the spoon towards Midnight. “I assure you, you won’t be disappointed.”

“Whenever you cook, I rarely am,” Midnight answered, taking the spoon and fitted it into her mouth.

Instantly, a rush of flavors erupted in Midnight’s mouth, making the Mightyena Moemon blush greatly and her cold demeanor instantly melted away as she allowed the tastes to settle in her mouth. “HMMM! Mashed potatoes! And do I sense a touch of garlic and shredded radish skins?”

“Ah, I was hoping I could stump you today,” Wester chuckled as he rubbed the back of his head. “I haven’t been able to make you guess incorrectly for a good two weeks now.”

“What can I say?” Midnight proudly exclaimed as she placed her hand on her large hip, tossing the spoon into the sink a few feet behind her. “My taste buds have evolved, I can guess whatever ingredients you’ve put in the food with a single taste! Haha!”

Wester smiled even brighter, at first when Midnight had signed on for kitchen duty, she wasn’t in the best of moods and seemed to only munch on the sweets that Wester had hidden around the kitchen (heck, it was impressive that she managed to come across his private stash of fudge and Swinub Sweet cream donuts in the first week). Eventually, Wester managed to ease Midnight into the work of the kitchen, by first simply asking her to be a good taste tester for his food.

At first, she was reluctant.

But eventually, the delicious smells had brought Midnight into the position of Taste Tester, and after the first few days, she began to do other work in the kitchen – Such as sweeping and cleaning the dishes, and actually doing a better job of it. There even some times when Wester would have Midnight help him with some basic cooking (mostly desserts though), and even managed to get her interested in the culinary arts slightly.

It was because of the combined efforts of taste testing Wester’s food and the fact that she usually munched on sweet foods during her work, that Midnight’s figure had changed drastically.

Gone were the trim waist, sleek legs, and overall slimness that belonged to the Mightyena Moemon, all of them covered by what could be best described as several layers of fluffy flab. With her uniform resized (and modified to accommodate her size, including the adjustable waist to accommodate the spare tire that was her gut), Midnight had really grown horizontally – almost to the point where she was either rivaling or grown past Fontina’s new size. The maid uniform was still in the same style with the silver lining and the low cut in the front that showed off the endless cleavage that was her chest, both of the milky chocolate mounds struggling with each other to find room over her expansive stomach.

But the most impressive aspect of Midnight, was her backside, and while the skirt was lengthened considerably, her meaty thighs and medicine ball sized rump always made the skirt ride up several times to the point that Midnight unconsciously pulled her skirt down (which in turn made her breasts struggle even more in the confines of the top and often spilled from the gaping hole). Even her darkly beautiful face was rounder, having already sprouted a full grown second chin (and the makings of a third one in the works), but she still kept her beauty, especially now that her black hair seemed to have become even longer and silkier.

“Indeed Midnight,” Wester chuckled as he turned back to his preparations. “Thanks for your help, I can handle the rest of this stuff, so, why don’t you go take a break? I’ll call you when the food needs to be served.”

“Sure,” Midnight yawned as she stretched her meaty arms over her head, making her bust bounce slightly (she had actually out grown her bras about two weeks ago, but its not like anyone would complain about it). “See ya in a while Wester…”

The warm, soothing waters overflowed Midnight’s expansive, milk chocolate colored body, making the blubbery Mightyena Moemon sigh loudly and let her body completely relax. This allowed the tubby girl to float off from her seated position in the bath and just float about the large bath, making a simple dead man’s float.

This was paradise.

Sure, there was the thought of work that loomed in the back of her head, but she didn’t care for it at the moment. All that was on Midnight’s mind was just to soak herself inside this luxurious grotto of sorts. With her back submerged in the water, Midnight could feel that her body was as light as a feather (fat chance, lol), with the slightly cold air washing over her front side.

But she didn’t care.

The cold air complimented the warm, Jacuzzi-like bath, so much so that it was able to make her eyes grow heavy… Slowly lulling her into a deep sleep…

At least until loud, booming music leaked into the room, making Midnight’s eyes shoot wide open and making her stand up in the water. ‘Crap! Someone’s there!’

Through the loud music, Midnight could hear footsteps getting closer and closer. There wasn’t a lot of time, so Midnight quickly waddled through the churning water, trying to get to the edge as soon as possible.

“S’alright!”

That unfamiliar voice only made Midnight run (waddle) faster to the edge of the pool, Midnight may not have the best morals, but she certainly didn’t want to get caught in a place where she wasn’t supposed to be… Not when she found this hidden paradise.

‘Hide! I have to hide!’ Midnight thought to herself as she climbed out of the pool, her meaty legs slapping against one another while she looked frantically for a hiding spot…

‘There!’

Indeed, right in front of Midnight was what appeared to be a large walk in closet that was opened. Perhaps Midnight was too mesmerized with the bath before, but she didn’t notice it until just now… Besides, it was the perfect hiding space for a girl of her girth.

Waddling quickly into closet, Midnight closed it just as another pair of doors were opening. “Ah, good ole grotto, how I’ve missed your luxurious waters.”

From a small crack in between the two doors, Midnight was able to see whoever was entering the bath area. And just like the voice, it was someone that Midnight didn’t recognize. As he walked (although, it looked more like dancing) along the edge of the water, the weird guy’s sleek form loomed over the edge of the water until he pulled back. “Ah, just as s’alright! Everything’s fancy n’ classy!”

The sleek man was dressed in a checkered button up shirt that was encompassing several shades of blue and had a pair of white jeans under it. Atop of his head of messy long locks of white hair was a blue cap that had a pair of wing like symbols on the sides of it with a pointed mark on the front of it. From her hiding space, Midnight couldn’t help but notice how handsome the strange man was, and that he had a pair of smooth blue jewels hanging around his neck… And if she had to guess, they were both probably twenty, no, thirty times more expensive than the rest of his clothing…

That’s when a new thought popped in Midnight’s head, ‘I’ve never seen this joker before… He’s wearing some fancy jewelry in comparison to the rest of his clothing… He must be a thief!

‘… And what the heck is he doing to my clothes?!’

While Midnight was hiding and pondering, the strange intruder had danced across Midnight’s discarded uniform and unmentionables, having crouched down on the well polished floor and looking over the clothing that Midnight had neglected to grab in her attempts to hide. “Hmm, hmm, hmm… Nice classic work! Almost a treasure cove… Or should I say island? Ha!”

Midnight’s face was burning slightly, oh, how she’d love to be able to step on out and smack him upside the head for rummaging through her clothes… But, even if she did, what if he was armed? She was completely nude to boot!

Her current train of thought was interrupted as the supposed thief raised his hands in the air, something hooked in between his two thumbs. And instantly recognizing the item, Midnight’s face lit up brighter than the sun when Atlus was working outside. It didn’t help that the weird man was whistling loudly, “Damn! Imagine the ass these fit on!”

That was the piece of straw that broke the Camerupt’s back!

Midnight pushed open the doors and ran out, all of her glorious body jiggling with each furious step she took towards the weird stranger, her fist pulled back. “BASTARD!”

The man didn’t even move as Midnight closed in, and even when she threw her punch at him…

… However, the only thing that Midnight’s punch hit was air… “What the?! Where’d he go?!”

The Mightyena Moemon’s question was immediately answered when she felt something pinching her butt, making her jump slightly, “Hmm… Dat ass! Dat’s the one with them panties!”

Midnight quickly turned around, not even caring that she was giving the weird guy a show, all she wanted to do was knock his block off! And since he was standing up when she began to turn, she had the perfect shot to get him with her elbow!

But once again, the mysterious Moemon seemed to disappear at the last second, but then reappear in front of Midnight, making the Mightyena Moemon jump slightly when she saw his smirking (if not handsome) face. “Hey! Let’s dance it out!”

Before she could even get a word in, Midnight realized that the weird man had grabbed her other free wrist and began to twist her around, making Midnight’s hefty body spin around quickly. For a few moments, the weird Moemon continued to spin and spin the confused Mightyena until he relinquished his grip and allowed her to spin to a slow stop, her tree trunk legs wavering and her eyes spinning. “Ugh… Y-You b-b-bastard… When I get a h-hold of you I’ll… I’ll…”

Midnight’s threat didn’t finish, since the mysterious man simply raised his pointer finger up and gently pushed Midnight’s stomach, tipping her into the large and deep pool of warm water that was behind her. “TIDAL WAVE!”

As a large splash echoed through the room along with the weird music, the man smirked as he watched Midnight float belly up with a completely dazed look on her face. With a wink, the man spun around on his heel and waved his hand over his shoulder. “Later, baby! Catch ya sometime!”

The man slowly began to walk out of the room, but stopped when he lifted his other hand. A small blush appeared on his face as he looked at his most recent treasure, “Hmm… Black silk, nice!”

And with a quick pocketing of Midnight’s panties, the man and the music that encompassed his being disappeared into the halls – Leaving only a dazed and floating Midnight in the bath behind him. “I… I’m gonna kill that… Perverted bastard…”

“Just as I thought,” Don Tanner snickered to himself as he nodded a few times. “Well, I don’t think you have to worry about that little debt concerning breaking that vase. I’ll just make another one!”

Once again, there was an awkward silence echoing through the room, and even Shera had a surprised look on her face. “Uh… M-Master Tanner… W-What are you saying?”

“What? I’m saying I made the vase,” Don Tanner replied with his hands on his hips. “Remember? You said I had to get out and try some new stuff. A pottery class was all that was available at the local YMCA and I poured my heart and soul into that vase.”

Everyone was dumbstruck at the information that Don Tanner so casually placed on the table, all with a smile on his face. Atlus however, was the first one to speak up… Or laugh it up, “BWAHAHAHAHAHAHA! SO IT WAS ESSENTIALLY WORTHLESS!?! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAH!!!!”

“HEY! It had plenty of worth!” Don Tanner stated with his nose turned upwards. “Like I said, I put my heart and soul into that work, and it actually turned out well! Man, this is going to cost me another trip to the YMCA…”

“Waitwaitwaitwait!” Ali shouted, getting everyone’s attentions. “So… We’ve been working all this time over something that wasn’t worth all the work we’ve done!?!?!”

“… Essentially, yeah,” Don Tanner replied, throwing his arms behind his head. “I mean, I told the staff that the vase was worth a lot, because I put a lot of effort into it so…”

WHAM!

POW!

BIFF!

“URK!” Don Tanner gagged as he fell over, three new bruises covering his face, all courtesy of Ali, Midnight and Fontina at the same time.

Shera just blinked a few times in surprise as the three original heroines, Kyrie and Atlus quickly left the room, leaving the dazed Don Tanner and the head maid in the room alone. For a few moments, Shera just stood there, her face red from her embarrassment on the matter. She made all four of those girls working for something that was broken that had no monetary worth! “… Oh, this is terrible…”

“Ugh, is this my fault?” Don Tanner questioned, keeping his eyes closed (he didn’t want to get smacked upside the head if Shera thought he was peeking up her uniform).

Shera sighed loudly…

choices: Shocking! Ali storms off to think, when a certain someone comes to chat with her
Let's take a break and see how Midnight is handling Walker (and stairs...)
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
Porcelain plates clinked against the fine silverware. Chubby fingers gripped around their forks with the grip reminiscent of an Arbok's Wrap, coming down onto the ornate platters at full force, regardless of their fragility. They emerged with finely cooked morsels dangling from their pikes, thick with flavor and steam, before they were shoved into an awaiting maw who sucked the sustenance of it's metal teat and dove back in for another helping.

There was no conversation in a majority of the room, not for a lack of trying. In celebration of the Master's return to the household, everyone had been allowed to shirk off their individual duties for the night and come have a nice wholesome meal with eachother. This meant the Night Staff; Horus, seated to the left of Don Tanner's head of the table across from Shera, Ivan, sitting across from (and getting a very nice view of) Claire and her ginormous boobies, and Ethel, who had been disdainfully seated at the end of the table (or the "Kid's Table" as it was referred to) along with Ember, Kyrie and Atlus filling in as both roles of "adult" and "child" due to their shrunken appearances; Wester, who had been graciously allowed the privilege of simply placing the food on the table rather than serving everyone individually (at the cost of sitting at the opposite head of the table with the "children"); and even Walker, who despite her injured leg still managed to come down on her own for tonight's proceedings.

As per norm, Ali and Fontina sat beside each other with Midnight directly across from her bulging blue-haired friend in almost the direct center of the table. And as predicted, none of the women exactly felt like talking, so the level of angst and depression emanating from that section of the table was thick enough to slice. Sitting beside Midnight was Claire, who didn't seem to notice the shrinking amount of space between their (mostly Midnight's) tubby shapes nor the lusty glances Ivan kept flashing towards her highbeams. What she, along with Shera, Horus, Ivan, and even Wester all the way down there on the Kid's Table noticed was the sudden revival of dinnertime at the hands of their master.

He was loud, he was boisterous, and he didn't open his mouth if there wasn't something entertaining coming out of it. He told jokes, amusing rantings about his current travels, and even did impersonations (dead on, by the way) of the strange inhabitants of the Sinnoh region he had met along the way in his journey. The whole half of the table, even the seemingly levelheaded Horus, let out howls of laughter.

But where the first half of the table was filled with sunshine and good will, the latter half was, as stated above, filled with a feeling that could only be defined as malice. With Walker giving off her normal amount of angst, plus a broken leg and sitting next to Midnight, and the mutual shame that Ali Fontina and the overstuffed pooch herself hanging over their heads, it was no surprise when Kyrie seemed upset. And when Kyrie was upset, Atlus seemed a little more hardy than usual, which in turn attracted Ember to wrap him into her flabby expanse, thus depressing the little bugger.

"Wahahaha!!" Ivan let out a loud howl, his eyes watering with the tears of his joy, "Oh, Zir, you can really tell ze jokes!!" he wiped his squinted eyeballs with the back of his index finger, "Ah, Walker, could you -eh, pass ze wine down to the 'Adult Section' please?" he chuckled, amused at his own wit, "Aha, you see vat I did zere; I-

Immediately, Walker reached over and palmed the wine bottle; chucking it at Ivan's head. It resounded with a loud 'BONK', falling gracefully into Don Tanner's outstretched hands after rebounding off of the Golbat Moemon's skull. "Ouchie." he whimpered meekly. "Woah Walker, what's up with you?" Don Tanner asked, not exactly convincing in his plea for peace -seeing as how he was balancing a plate on his nose to imitate the Flying Spheal Circus act he and his friends had seen in Hoenn- Walker, ever starved for conflict, struggled to her feet and glared at her master with the utmost disdain. "Nothing." she said indignantly, her nostrils flared and white eyebrows creased, "I'm going back to my room to eat, where I can get some peace and quiet."

The grumpy Absol moemon grunted as she straddled herself to get her crutch, balancing her plate in one hand as she placed the crutch underneath her armpit, and hobbled off out of the kitchen and presumably towards the stairs; leaving Don Tanner just as confused as ever around here. "Shouldn't someone go there?" he asked, sincerely concerned for his genderly ambiguous butler, "I mean, you know, to make Sure Walker gets there safely?" Horus let out a deep sigh, closing his eyes in deep thought as he took another swig of his coffee. "You how Walker is, Sir, always looking for trouble but always willing to back up any talk."

The Dragonair moemon's response was half sigh and half laughter as he placed the platter back onto the table. "Yeah, I remember, Walker may be a taller and meaner, but I'll always remember the skittish little kid who wouldn't say a word unless it was to you~" Horus blushed somewhat before smiling, "Yeah, me too..."

Midnight looked back, struggling past her own girthed neck to watch Walker hobble out of the dining room. Even though he was a jerk, he just looked so sad. Walker had always done everything by himself by his way, in the rough-and-tumble "I-don't-care-who-I-offend" manner he had carried himself with since she had known him. And now that his leg was broken, he couldn't do much of anything...

"I'll, uh, go help him up the stairs..." Midnight said politely, and even a little quietly. No one was shocked in particular, moreso at the connotation of her sentence than what she actually said. Don Tanner shrugged his shoulders slightly before letting out a satisfied, "Sure, go ahead~"

Midnight pushed back her chair, incredible bulk keeping it nearly indented into the floor. She lunged forward like she always does, but to no avail, tonight's dinner must have pushed her over the edge (actually, she was far passed that edge and couldn't see the shoreline, but I digress) Her boobs, sitting atop the great mountainous belly and wedged between two puffy wads of armfat, squished together as she attempted to rise, causing pressure and strain on her windpipe, and thus forcing her to retreat back into her chair. "Ugh... can someone ->huff<- help me up?"

Atlus rolled his eyes, sprung up from his seat and grabbed the Mightyena moemon's chubby, using his still superior strength to nearly toss her out into the hallway. He laughed as he observed Midnight struggle to keep her balance...

"Hey wait a sec, did she just say 'he'?" Don Tanner uttered a mere two minutes after Midnight's ousting, "I'm pretty sure she said 'he'." Horus mulled, "Probably just a slip of the tongue."

"Oh come off it!!" Ali shouted, finally having enough of this ridiculous conversation of circuses, butlers, children, and boobies. She shot from her seat, belly creased by the table as it protruded outwards stuffed by meals present and past. "Are we just gonna ignore what happened just an hour ago?!" she shouted, eyes growing fiery, "About how my friends and I just wasted MONTHS of our lives for no pay at all?!"

Kyrie flinched at the word "wasted", seeing as how her first memorable friendships had been product of their servitude. She shrunk into her seat and snivelled.

"I've had it! Since I don't need to be here anymore, I can safely say two words that I've longed to say since I started here:"

She waddled towards the exit, following Midnight's example and aiming for the stairs...

"I. QUIT."

And waddled off...

Before she can say anything, Kyrie walks into the breakroom, looking for Ali
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
“Lousy jackass,” Ali growled as she jumped onto the couch, a large box of doughnuts bouncing next to her. After stomping off from the dining hall, and not wanting to really deal with anyone else headed to one of the few places that would more than likely be completely bare of Moemon in this mansion during dinner…

… The break room.

It was quiet. There was a lock on the door. Plus, there were plenty of things to eat, after all, she was skipping dinner and didn’t get a lot to eat. And after all the crap that she had to deal with today (all caused by that perverted Dragonair – Don Tanner), something sweet would be enough to calm her nerves.

Tearing open the box she had, Ali looked at all of the jam packed pastries inside (and some of them were packed with jam too, lol) and sniffed them. She had to admit they were quite tantalizing and oh so tempting. Heck, even after considering all the free work she and the others did over the last few months, Ali reasoned that it would’ve just been fair to enjoy as much free food as they wanted. Or even more!

Taking one of the Swinub Sweets pastries, Ali sunk her teeth into the sweet treat and immediately swallowed it down her gullet. And quickly she stuffed the rest of the pastry into her mouth and chewed quickly, the sweet food filling her cheeks as she reached for a second one.

“Ya know, ya shouldn’t stuff yourself silly.”

Ali gagged loudly as she began to choke on the sweets she was eating at the moment, Don Tanner suddenly appearing next to her! Although she had questions in her head, she was more concerned with the fact she was choking.

“And that’s one of the reasons,” Don Tanner chuckled with a wag of his finger.

One glass of water later…

Ali was breathing loudly as she kept a hand on her chest, trying to catch her breath, but keeping her glare set on Don Tanner who was seated in a chair in front of her. On the Dragonair moemon’s face was a large smirk, “So, those gray skies of yours cleared up yet?”

“Does my glare answer that?” Ali replied turning her head away from Don Tanner.

“Now don’t be like that,” Don Tanner chuckled sheepishly as he removed his hat, allowing his long hair to fall from its containment. “A cute little gal like you shouldn’t have a face like that.”

A small blush appeared on Ali’s face, but she still kept up her strong front, “We wasted so much time here! I mean sure, meeting Kyrie was a great thing, but still…”

Don Tanner sighed loudly, “Look, little disco inferno.”

“What?” Ali questioned with a look of disbelief on her face. “What’d you call me?”

“I want to say this,” Don Tanner continued, ignoring Ali’s question. “I didn’t know what happen, if I did, then I would’ve just let you and your friends leave whenever you wanted to. Frankly, what happened to you and your friends was a great injustice and frankly if anyone owes anyone, I owe you and your friends a lot. I get that.”

Ali turned back to Don Tanner, her look softening slightly.

“I know first hand that time is a precious thing that can never be replaced,” Don Tanner sighed lowering his head. “I know that the hard way, but in any case, I want to make it up to you and your friends in any way that I can.”

“Why do you even care?” Ali growled turning her attention down at Don Tanner, her glare starting to regain some of its fire. “Don’t you have a whimsical paradise here? With your perverted fantasies walking about?”

“… Do you know why I was gone for a long time?” Don Tanner questioned putting his hat back on his head. And without waiting for an answer, the Dragonair Moemon smiled brightly. “I was traveling, its almost every young moemon’s dream to be able to leave home to establish a name for him or herself in the world. Sometimes its in business, other times it’s with a team to conquer the Moemon League…

“And if I’m mistaken, that’s what you and your two friends were doing before you got caught up here.”

Ali turned away from the Dragonair, Don Tanner shaking his head, “I actually know how you and your friends probably feel, being kept from your dreams.”

“What?” Ali growled.

“You see this mansion?” Don Tanner replied holding his hands up. “As you can probably guess, a guy my age can’t get this thing through the business world. I inherited it from my old man, as well as his duties, and he passed away when I was real young, so I couldn’t really leave here and go on a journey. When I was still just a little Dratini Moemon, I would always hear tales of some of the greatest Moemon who went out on their journeys and became legends, like Lance the Dragonite, or Steven the Agrron, those guys went out and created names for themselves through constant battles!

“But I was trapped with my father’s duties at this mansion, trapped like a little Pidgey in a birdcage. It wasn’t until a few years ago that Shera and Horus actually decided to help me with my workload to allow me to go out and journey with some others here at the mansion, and I felt a great freedom be allowed to me. But, I still have to come back here every so often and take on some of the workload like now…

“I guess what I’m saying is, sure, I don’t know exactly what you and your friends were going through working here, but I can relate at the very least, and I don’t want anyone else to be chained to this mansion. I’d sell the place or tear it down, but I still loved my old man and I don’t want to lose the very thing he left for me in his memory…”

Ali blinked a few times as Don Tanner poured out that story, something you would hear from a very deep person, and one who wasn’t a pervert. It sounded sincere. And maybe he was very sorry for creating a very great inconvenience for her and her friends…

“I’m not asking for forgiveness,” Don Tanner continued. “I’m not even asking for you to like me. All I’m asking is that you at least let me try to make it up to ya.”

Ali was a little bit torn…

“I…” Ali started…
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.title: Rythem and Blues…

choices: Ali escorts Kyrie to bed...
What of Fontina? Or Maybe Midnight?
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
"I..." Ali stopped, turning from Don Tanner as if to stall for time. The words were simple enough, at least what she had in mind, but for some reason they seemed inexpressible. Surely Don Tanner's great sacrifice for his youthful ambitions was honorable, a tenfold version of what she and her friends had given up in order to work here. In a way, Ali was torn between a slowly fading rage and a strange urge to forgive. The look in his brown eyes was one of sincerity, somehow lacking the maliciousness to lie now, if at all. She was touched...

"Look, I-

But the moment was put on pause when a tiny knocking came at the door. Ali turned to the door quickly without leaving the couch, almost as if frightened to be seen alone with a character such as her ex-master. "B-But how'd you get in?" Ali asked sharply, craning her neck to glance at the Dragonair moemon. "This is my house, 'member?" he lifted a skeleton key from his pocket, "I got keys." Ali rolled her eyes as she composed herself; brushing off debris from her meal and straightening her tightening uniform. "J-Just a second!" she said in an elevated tone, relinquishing her position on the couch as she lifted her heavy form.

"O-Okay..." a familiar meek tone answered from behind the door, almost inaudible from behind the heavy wood. The Quilava moemon instantly recognized the innocent little squeaking coming from outside as Kyrie, no doubt coming up to check on her. But was she really so transparent that everyone knew that she would come to the break room? Ali took a deep breath as she placed her chubby hand on the doorknob, twisting it and pulling until the legendary moemon had been revealed.

"Hey Kyrie." she said in a tone that clearly reflected her moral dilemma.

"H-Hi..." Kyrie said quietly, staring down at the floor from the corner of her eye.

Things were silent between both girls and the onlooking Don Tanner. Kyrie kept her eyes off of Ali in any means possible, while Ali tried her best to seem as unintimidating as possible so as to refrain from frightening the skittish deity. "You didn't have to come all the way up here, you know." Ali finally said, lifting a chubby arm to scratch the back of her head, "I'm fine, really."

Kyrie's lower lip quivered as she continued avoiding her friend's gaze, tears forming in those beautiful golden eyes of hers. "I was... worried about you..." she managed through her slight sobbing. Slowly, the tears fell from their ducts and rolled down Kyrie's somewhat rounded cheeks. "I-I know I didn't have to come... but..." she paused, as if the words were like bites of food too big to chew, "I-I just thought you could... use a friend..." as the final words fell from her mouth, the gentle sniveling soon became tears that only a water god could produce. They were thick, yet perfectly clear; almost seeming too big for the tiny moemon to have produced.

"Kyrie, d-don't-" Ali started, but she found herself unable to finish her sentence as her godly companion continued blubbering. "A-An-And you said-" Kyrie continued talking, reaching into her apron for a handkerchief to dab her eyes and nose with, "Th-That you and your friends' time here had been... a waste..." she calmed down slightly, though not enough to cork the waterworks falling from her eyes, "B-But h-here is where I met you, and Fontina... and... and... please don't quit!" she bawled, looking up at Ali like a lost puppy does at a new master.

Ali couldn't resist. She waddled over to her friend and pulled Kyrie as close to her doughy shape as it would allow. At this the blubbering sea goddess' wails only grew louder as she buried herself in Ali's engorged bosom; the soft tissue of her breast muffling her anguished cries of concern. With one hand Ali wrapped around Kyrie's chubby form and pulled her closer, and with the other she held her head down into her chest in a very motherly fashion. "Shh.... it's okay..." Ali said quietly, "I wouldn't ever think of our time together as anything but awesome." she smiled, though no one could see it unless they were outside the door, "Let's get you into bed, okay?"

Looking back on it, Ali had experienced a very similar conversation before. One where a little girl was crying over a trusted friend leaving, afraid that they might lose the person most important to them forever. The night remained clear in her mind, right outside her house in New Bark Town. The conversation, a near word for word copy of the one experienced today, was significant as well. For those were the last words she'd heard from her brother, Ten. Maybe it was this that led her to being so accepting with Kyrie's skittish and downright tear-potent behavior...

"O-Okay..." Kyrie said, still buried deep in Ali's valley of cleavage.

Ali almost seemed to forget Don Tanner's presence in the break room, who's last words of the night were "So can I take that as a yes?" Ali stopped, turned her head, and smiled at the enigmatic Don Tanner without saying a word before heading out the door with Kyrie in arms...
