choices: As Don Tanner listens in, he spots a familiar cursed book...
As Fontina speaks, she begins to break down, Don Tanner comforts her
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
As Don Tanner watched the two smaller girls of the group walk off and out of the room, he yawned loudly and stood up. “Well, that was time well used, one down, and two to go.”

Things around the mansion may have changed quite drastically, what with the new help and all (mostly for the fact that they were practically forced into doing this under a misconception). And as master of the house, Don Tanner did have a duty to make sure that the house didn’t erupt into chaos, and for the most part, Shera and Horus did a good job of staying on top of that.

But still, it was his responsibility.

And since this was his fault, in a messed up way, it was up to the Dragonair master of the mansion to fix all of this, by any means necessary. ‘Now… Who should I go to next? The bootyluscious Mightyena girl, or the boobylicious Vaporeon? I wager that neither of them would be interested in talking to me… But maybe I should go for the safer bet…’

TTTTTT


Fontina sighed loudly as she kept a few books close to her expansive paunch as she walked through the maze that was this library.

She was rather upset, and now even more so given that she had just hit the man who was probably about to let them go free. Perhaps Ali and Midnight were just wearing off on her. Or perhaps tensions were just too high.

The obese moemon had moved automatically, and rather quickly for her size, back to her number one comfort zone, the library. It hadn't hit her until now how much exertion she had placed on her squidgy body today. She waddled up to a seat, fitting snugly into a comfy chair that she once could have stretched out on. Her weight, having slowly grown so familiar to her she had nearly forgotten, was now something she felt in full force. The water moemon was blue in every sense of the word right now.

She didn't know what to do...she wanted to be happy about the chance they'd be leaving this mansion, but what awaited them? They couldn't walk from town to town like they used to. Maybe getting out on the road again would be good for them in that respect, but Fontina somehow doubted they'd make any progress anytime soon, and in the intermediate time that meant scrounging up a lot of bus or cab fare. Furthermore, after so much wandering, Fontina had to admit she had grown used to the mansion and the many luxuries that it afforded even its servants.

Fontina let out a large sigh and for a while just relaxed in the chair, trying to catch her breast. Unfettered, her bosom heaved and wobbled. Fontina was not a vain girl, not at all. But even she couldn't help but see the silver lining of all this weight. Maybe if she was lucky, even after losing all this weight (whenever that happened) she'd stay a bit curvier. She had to hold out hope that something good would come of all this.

Just as she was about to open her first book up, the glasses wearing Moemon caught something out of the corner of her eye, seeing that there was a book laying the middle of the floor she just walked over. ‘It must’ve just slipped out of my arms and I didn’t notice… Oh well, I can always get it when…’

However, Fontina stopped when she realized that the book in question was the first book that had caught her eye when she entered the library – A first edition, writer’s cut of a rare, out of print book that went under the name of “The Unova Quartet – Tale of the Tao Trio”. Now, part of Fontina wanted to just get up out of that seat and pick up that book, but her massive behind was practically wedged in that seat, and after spending quite a bit of time and effort trying to find all the books she wanted, she was tired from walking about.

Then again, if she just left it there, then it would just be a waste of effort on her part!

“Oooh!” Fontina wined as she tried to lean forward in an attempt to reach the book without actually having to get off her large ass. Of course, with the melons that she was smuggling in her shirt squishing up against her bulbous gut and meaty knees, that was easier said than done.

After a few moments of trying, Fontina was about to give up when all of a sudden a pair of blue and white sneakers attached to a pair of white jeans walked up over the book. Slowly, the pants knelt down to reveal the familiar smirking face of one Don Tanner, “Here, let me get that for you.”

“Uh… T-Thanks,” Fontina mumbled, still a little annoyed with this dragonair Moemon, but a little embarrassed at the thought of wondering how long he had been around to see her try to reach out for the book.

Don Tanner lifted the book up in his hands and slowly walked towards Fontina, “Hmm, this is a good book, one of the few that my father read to me when I was a little guy. It’s got a great story!”

As the Dragonair Moemon handed the book to Fontina, the overly voluptuous Vaporeon Moemon turned her glasses covered eyes away from the sleek Don Tanner. She didn’t say a word to him as she held the book close to her meaty chest.

However, when she realized that Don Tanner was still standing in front of her, she had no choice but to speak. “Um, is there s-something I can help you with?”

“Actually, yes,” Don Tanner sighed as he removed his hand (revealing his long luxurious locks of white hair) and rubbed the back of his head. “I came here to apologize…”

“For stealing my bra?” Fontina pointed out with a flat look in her eyes.

“Wha?” Don Tanner gasped slightly as he jumped a foot backwards. “No! Well, maybe, but I wanted to apologize for the big stuff first, ya know, having you and your two friends being kept here to work off a non-realistic debt. No one should have to go through that, especially when they’re so young.”

“Apologies are nice,” Fontina sighed as she turned away from Don Tanner. “But they can’t undo the damages for the acts that warranted those apologies.”

“Oh,” Don Tanner muttered with his hand to his mouth. “Well… I know that a lot of time of yours was wasted and all but…”

“It’s not just that!” Fontina spurted out, immediately drawing her hands to her mouth. She had a lot of stress in her and it was finally seeping out, of course, letting that go in a library was never a proper way to channel stress in a loud manner. “I… I mean…”

Don Tanner noticed the flushed cheeks that were adorning the glasses wearing beauty, and sighed as he quickly sat down on the floor with his legs crossed and kept his gaze at Fontina. Needless to say, Fontina was a little drawn back at what the Dragonair Moemon was doing, “W-What?”

“Look, I wanna try to fix whatever problems I caused you girls,” Don Tanner replied with his arms crossed. “I don’t expect forgiveness, I don’t expect you girls to even like me – All I want to do is make amends for what I did to you guys, so, tell me whatever troubles that have been plaguing you ever since you came to this mansion. At the very least, you’ll have a good pair of ears to listen to your troubles.”

“Uh, t-thanks b-but,” Fontina muttered with her eyes turning away from Don Tanner.

“I’m not going anywhere,” Don Tanner interrupted with his gaze transfixed on Fontina’s face (and noticeable rack, but then again, from where he was seated, you couldn’t help but look at those generous sweaterpuppies while looking at Fontina’s face). “Now, you can either let old Don Tanner try his hand at helping your problems, or you can leave, but I gotta tell you, I am tenacious, and I won’t let this go.”

Fontina sighed loudly, in a sense, Don Tanner was trying to make things right… And technically it wasn’t Don Tanner’s fault all this stuff happened. The least Fontina could do was chew Don Tanner’s ears off…

“Well, you see, my biggest concern,” Fontina started, gesturing towards her mountainous, if not highly voluptuous figure. “Is this. Ever since we came to this mansion, I’ve been gaining weight like crazy, I’m like three… Maybe four times bigger than when I first came here and…”
1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.title: Let's start with Fontina, shall we?

1111321121122212111221221211111111211111.content:
"...and the worst part is, I have no idea why I've gained so much!" Fontina continued. "I mean, I know the meals here aren't exactly healthy but..."

Just then, Don Tanner saw a familiar book out of the corner of his eye. He turned to see a copy of Heavy Curses on the shelf next to him. "Hold up," he said. "Say that again."

"The meals here aren't exactly healthy?"

"No, back up a bit."

"I have no idea why I've gained so much?"

Don Tanner snapped his fingers. "Bingo." He walked over to the cursed book and held it up. "Do you recognize this book?"

"Yeah, I read it on my first day here, why?"

He frowned. "You didn't get a paper cut from this book, did you?"

"Yeah, why?"

He sighed. "You've been cursed."

"Oh! Oh, no!" Fontina was more comprehensive than she was surprised, but nonetheless, she was upset.

Just then, a page fell out of the book. "What the..." Don Tanner picked up the page.

"Ooh, lemme see!" Fontina said. Don Tanner complied. Fontina read the page. "Hey, it says here there's a way to remove the curse AND reverse its effects!"

"Wow, that's great!" While Don Tanner was slightly unhappy from the fact that Fontina's buxom figure would probably be gone forever, he was more happy to see her happy.

Fontina read more. "It says all the affected people have to be in the same room for it to work."

"Hey, let's split up," Don Tanner suggested. "I'll go get that fire chick and her pale friends, and you go get that big chocolate beauty."

"You mean Ali, Kyrie, and Midnight, respectively?"

She was rather upset, and now even more so given that she had just hit the man who was probably about to let them go free. Perhaps Ali and Midnight were just wearing off on her. Or perhaps tensions were just too high.

The obese moemon had moved automatically, and rather quickly for her size, back to her number one comfort zone, the library. It hadn't hit her until now how much exertion she had placed on her squidgy body today. She waddled up to a seat, fitting snugly into a comfy chair that she once could have stretched out on. Her weight, having slowly grown so familiar to her she had nearly forgotten, was now something she felt in full force. The water moemon was blue in every sense of the word right now. She didn't know what to do...she wanted to be happy about the chance they'd be leaving this mansion, but what awaited them? They couldn't walk from town to town like they used to. Maybe getting out on the road again would be good for them in that respect, but Fontina somehow doubted they'd make any progress anytime soon, and in the intermediate time that meant scrounging up a lot of bus or cab fare. Furthermore, after so much wandering, Fontina had to admit she had grown used to the mansion and the many luxuries that it afforded even its servants.

Fontina let out a large sigh and for a while just relaxed in the chair, trying to catch her breast. Unfettered, her bosom heaved and wobbled. Fontina was not a vain girl, not at all. But even she couldn't help but see the silver lining of all this weight. Maybe if she was lucky, even after losing all this weight (whenever that happened) she'd stay a bit curvier. She had to hold out hope that something good would come of all this.

"Fontina?" A delicate voice asked. Kyrie wandered into view, looking curious and worried. "Are you alright?" she walked up to Fontina. Kyrie wasn't plump enough yet to waddle, but she definitely had sway to her hips these days. Fontina sat up straighter, to see a little more past her massive chest.

"Yeah. So, good news...it turns out we weren't in as much debt as we thought."

"R-really? How did you find that out?" Kyrie asked, eyes wide.

"Turns out the 'master' has a different definition of valuable." Fontina said dryly. Kyrie drew up aside her, and lightly touched Fontina on the leg, in a small reassuring gesture. Her cute little brow was furrowed.

"But you sound so sad?" she asked. Fontina sighed.

"I guess, it's just how this was all for nothing. Our entire stay here was a waste of time." she said bitterly. Kyrie paused, thought, and then did something surprising to Fontina. The girl began to cry. Well, not bawl. But tears quickly welled up in her eyes, her chubby cheeks growing rosy.

"Oh." she said quietly, before dashing up. Confusion, then horror dawned on Fontina's face.

"Wait, Kyrie!" she shouted. "Not like - oh, for crying out loud." she was stuck in her chair. Now was not the time! Fontina struggled, trying to get free before Kyrie ran off too far for her.

“Ember? Eeeeeembeeeer! Where are, you, ya fat lard? Come on! I need your help! EMBER!!!!”

Suddenly, at the sound of somebody calling, three heads shot up at once.

One was Ember. The others were Ali and Kyrie. One of said heads shot up in guilt. The other two, with relief. I’ll let you guess which ones were which.

“Ummmm…. COMEING!” Ember shouted. She quickly looked around, seeing 5 additional empty donut boxes on the floor, adding to the 3 that were their before. She quickly stood up, releasing two very stuffed young moemon‘s legs. Not that they were in much of a position to move, anyways.

“Ember? Are you in the staff room again? I thought I TOLD you, NO SNACKING ON THE JOB!” The voice sounded closer now.

“Uh, uh…. NO! I’M JUST UP HERE…. UH… DUSTING!” Ember shouted desperately. She turned to the two girls laying on the couch. “Friends, I’m sorry, but I’ve got to go! I’ll be back as soon as I can! Remember, keep eating!” With that, she hurried her large mass out the doorframe, and slammed the door. Almost immediately, a pair of moans filled the room.

“A-A-A-Ali?” Kyrie said, so quiet, it was barley a whisper.

“Uhg….. Yea Kyrie?”

“My belly hurts.”

“Mine too, Kyrie, mine too."

And boy, did they! Ember had completely had her way with the poor duo of girls over the past few hours, taking full advantage of Kyries shyness and Ali’s already stuffed state to get as much ‘healing food’ down into their stomachs as possible. Which meant for Kyrie, three and a half dozens of donuts, and one and a half more for Ali, adding on top of the three she’d already eaten.

Neither of them moved for another fifteen minutes, other than letting out the occasional groan or burp. But after that amount of time, Ali became afraid that Ember may soon be able to wriggle her way out of working again to pay a visit. And so with much difficulty, she heaved herself and her hugely bloated belly off the couch.

She then worked on getting poor little Kyrie off the couch. With great effort, she managed to get her standing. Looking at her, Ali was amazed how much food she had eaten. Her scrawny, wraith-like figure was accented by an enormously stuffed belly, bulging out unnaturally. Of course, Ali knew she probably looked the same way.

After another 20 minutes of struggling around the mostly deserted corridors of the huge mansion, The stuffed pair finally made it to Ali’s room. After going in and shutting the door, (quietly, as not to alert Ember if she was anywhere nearby) the two short moemon lay on the single bed together, trying to calm their aching stomachs. Ali had something on her mind, and she knew It was the prefect time to bring it up. But she wasn’t really sure how mysterious Kyrie would react…

“Um… Kyrie?”

“Y-y-yes?”

“Well, I was thinking… Well, I just wanted to know if… Um…” Ali didn’t know where to begin. “What I’m trying to ask is, do you remember anything at all from your life before we found you?”

Kyrie thought hard for a moment. Really hard. She had been doing that a lot lately, trying to remember something, anything. But all she got was her name. “N-N-No. N-Nothing. “

“Well, I was just wondering.. What will you do if you can’t ever remember where you came from? Where you live?”

Kyrie had never thought about this. “I-I don’t k-know…” The poor girl looked so lost, it made Ali’s heart ache!

“Well, I was wondering…. If we ever get out of this place… Well, If you’d like to join Midnight, Fontina, and me. Traveling around and such.”

Kyrie just stared at her with those big eyes of hers, mouth open. Ali felt awkward. She had just made a fairly major offer… She had expected some sort of response. But weather that response would be joy or tears, she had no idea. She never did with this strange girl.

Just when the silence was getting long, Kyrie turned her gaze to the ground. When she looked up again, Ali saw tears in her eyes. Again. “You… You r-r-really m-m-mean it?”

“Well of course I do!” Ali said cheerfully. “That’s what friends are for, right? So what do you say?”

Kyrie just stared at her, amazed that someone would make her that kind of offer. “… Y-y-yes….”

Just then, a certain book of curses, hidden under a pile of its fellow paper brethren in the library, glowed purple for a few seconds.

“Ok, now that that’s settled, I’m gonna take a nap… Sleep all this food off…” Ali said.

“Ok… S-s-sweet dreams… F-friend…” But Ali was already asleep, hands resting on her stuffed belly.

Kyrie just sighed and leaned back onto the headboard of the bed, rubbing her own large tummy. Trying to remember something. Anything. Put her past remained a black hole in her brain.

And slowly, sleep overtook the mysterious moemon, until she too, fell unconscious, leaving her belly to digest her ‘midmorning snack.’

It was around dinner time when Ali woke from her food-induced slumber. She yawned, and made to roll over out of bed, nearly crushing a sleeping Kyrie in the process. Just barley able to stop herself in time, she flopped onto her back again, and got out of the bed from the non-occupied side. She gently tip-toed to the bathroom, looking back at Kyrie as she went. She looked so peaceful sleeping. Her long blue-green hair flowed neatly down her back. Her belly was still a little pooched out from the huge meal earlier, as was Ali’s.

Ali stepped out of the bathroom to find Kyrie just waking up.

“Hey, sleepyhead.” Ali said as Kyrie yawned and rubbed her eyes.

“H-hey.” Kyrie said quietly. Always so quietly.

“Kyrie, you really need to speak up more. I swear, your quieter than a Weedle. (Are Weedles quiet? I don’t really know.)

“O-ok.” She said, just as softly. Ali laughed. “Silly goose. So, do you feel like heading down to dinner?” Ali already knew the answer, but it was polite to ask.

“W-w-well, I guess we could..” Kyrie said, looking dubiously at her still-full stomach.

Ali smirked. If someone told her to go jump off a bridge, she’d probably do it. Not that anyone would ever want to.

“No, no, I don’t really feel like it either.” Kyrie looked relieved. “So, Kyrie, This has been bugging me.. Why were you so upset when you came to me in the staff lounge? Was Midnight mean to you?” A look of anger appeared on Ali’s face. “Cause if she did, I’ll-

“N-no! You don’t have too.. I mean, it wasn’t her…” Kyrie said evasively. “Well, n-not really..”

“Than what was it?”

Kyrie took a deep breath, and in a quick, quiet whisper, began recalling the events that had terrified her so much to Ali. Working in the kitchen. Being dragged off by Midnight. And seeing that lady butler and the large man fight… exchange blows, kicks! Hurting each other!

Ali put a hand on Kyries shoulder. She stopped and looked up from the ground into Ali’s face. Kyrie’s eyes were wet, and she was shaking.

“It’s ok, Kyrie. It's ok.” Ali said.

“I-I-I’m s-s-s-sorry….” Kyrie said, sounding miserable. “I-I-I’m o-o-ok..”

“Kyrie, its ok. I get it.” Ali did get it, though it was quite rare for a moemon to fear violence. It was almost an integrated part of life. Of course, It was possible that this fear of fighting was simply because of Kyries amnesia. Who knows?

"It its ok, now, right, Kyrie? No more crying.”

Kyrie sniffled. “O-o-ok.”

It was silent for a few moments. Then Ali realized something. “Hey, Kyrie. How did you figure out that Walker was a girl? She practically had to undress in front of me for me to figure it out!”

Kyrie smiled a bit and shrugged. “She just looks like a girl.” This made Ali laugh.

Kyrie began exploring the room, which was full of Ali and Fontinas various possessions and knick knacks. Kyrie asked for permission to look at this thing or that so often, Ali nearly burst. “Kyrie! You can look at whatever you’d like! Would it kill you to be a little less polite?”
Which had made the small moemon look so sad, Ali ended up apologizing herself.

Currently, Kyrie was standing at the rooms desk, looking at Ali’s small pocket-sized calendar. She flipped through the months slowly, looking at each picture of beautiful places from other regions, and studying the special occasions Ali had marked such as ‘Mom & Dads anniversary!’ and ‘Christmas!!!!!’ Kyrie didn’t even know what Christmas was, or if she ever had known what it was. But she made a mental note to find out in that wonderful library they had here.

Ali had started to doze off again when Kyrie came across a certain date. It was in August. Actually, it about nine days away. It read, ‘MY BIRTHDAY!!!!!!’ in huge letters. While Kyrie was studying the letters, something odd happened. She felt something. Like an itch that she couldn’t scratch. Suddenly, everything around her seemed to have a strange, too-bright quality about it, and every sound intensified. Her own breathing was deafening in her ears. What was happening? What was going on?

She tried calling out, but nothing happened. Her muscles seemed to weaken, then give out entirely, causing her to crash to the floor. Her vision started to go white around the edges, and the white slowly moved inwards, blocking her vision. The last thing she heard was Ali’s voice. “Kyrie?" A pause. "Kyrie, what’s up?" Pause. "Kyrie? Kyrie?!? Oh, no, no, no! Kyrie!”

Ali was half asleep when she heard a crash.

At first she thought she was dreaming. But then she remembered Kyrie was in the room. Probably dropped something. Hope she didn’t hurt herself.

She lazily opened one eye. “Kyrie?” No answer. “ Kyrie, what’s up?” Still nothing. She was getting nervous. She sat up in her bed. “Kyrie?” She didn’t see anything. Until…

“Kyrie?!?” she saw her. Her small form, collapsed on the floor, by the rooms small desk. “Oh, no, no, no! Kyrie!” She was practically screaming now. She flew off the bed and knelt by Kyries slight figure. She was lying on her side, eyes pointed under the bed. Her hands were twitching a little, her hair splayed messily over the floor. “Kyrie! Oh, come on Kyrie!” she took the girls face in her hands. She gasped. Her mouth was moving quickly, like she was talking. But no sound came. Her eyes were wide open, and staring blankly. Ali could hear her breathing. It was shallow and rough, but she was breathing. That was good.

Ali had no idea what to do. Should she call someone? Wait it out? She had no idea. For someone who was going on adventure as of a few days ago, she had very little first aid know-how. All she could think of was to keep her head elevated to help her breathing. At least, she thought that was right.

So she kept Kyries head in her lap. And began calling. “Someone! Someone! COME HERE! SOMTHINGS WRONG WITH KYRIE!” But nobody came. It was hardly half a minute cense Kyrie had collapsed, but it felt like an hour. Ali just looked into the young girls face. She felt like she was going to cry. But suddenly, she felt strange. Sounds got louder. Her vision became blurry. Kyrie’s wide eyes seemed to be sucking her in. “Oh great. Now who’s gonna save ME?” Was Ali’s last thought as she too, collapsed.


When Ali came to, she was in a room she’d never seen before. It was green, with a forest painted on the walls. From what she could see, it had a small girls toys on the floor. But her vision was focused on a calendar that was sitting on her (or whoever this was) lap.

Ali realized that she wasn’t really awake. It couldn’t be, because she couldn’t move her head. Like she was watching a movie. This was some sort of dream or something. But… Was Kyrie collapsing also a dream? Was that real? She had no clue.

Just then, Ali head a door open. Her head-or not- turned quickly. There in the doorway was a heavy-set man in a suit and tie. But something wasn’t right. His features were blurred out, like this was an edited piece of film.

“Hey there, darling. What’re you doing?” The man asked in a deep baritone.

“Oh, nothing.” Came the reply. It was high-pitched and clear, like a ringing bell. It had come from the person who’s perspective Ali seemed to be seeing. By the sound of it, She guessed it was the little girl who’s room this was.

“You excited for your birthday?” The man said, spying the calendar on the girls lap.

“Yea.” Ali could feel the girl smile, feel her excitement. It was like she was inside this small girls mind. When the girl looked back at the calendar, Ali studied it a bit more closely. It was dated back seven years ago, and coincidentally, It was only two days behind the current date. Several days ahead of the place where the X’s stopped, Ali saw a circled date, exclaiming ‘MY BIRTHDAY!’ She was shocked to see that date coincided with her own birthday.

Then the girl looked back up at what Ali supposed was her father. “So, do I get a cake this year?” She asked in her sweetest voice. Ali felt the hope in her mind.

The man smiled. “Not this year, sweet pea. But don’t worry. You’ll have the biggest party yet!” He gave her a beaming smile. “Balloons everywhere, Mr. Mimes, all your friends, and so many presents it’ll take you days to open them!” He exclaimed.

“Awesome!” Said the bell-voice. But Ali felt her disappointment. ‘Another year, no cake…’ thought the girl. Poor thing. Dad must be a health freak or something.

“Don’t be sad, honey.” The man said, sensing the girls thinly hidden disappointment. One of these years, you can have one. ‘Yea right…’ thought the girl. Ali didn’t know why he wouldn’t get the poor girl a birthday cake! It certainly looked like they could afford one. The room had countless dolls, toys, play sets, and even a queen-sized bed. And when the girl looked out of her window, the ground seemed floors below them, and she could see a huge, well-manicured lawn and garden. In fact, they looked filthy rich!

“Ok…” She said disappointedly. The man just came up, gave her a hug, and walked out of the room, shutting the door.

The girl got up from her bedside seat. Sure enough, She was very short, like a small child. She picked up a doll from the floor. “In a few days, I’m gonna be seven.” she said to the doll. “I’m gonna have a fun party, and presents.” She didn’t say it with too much excitement. “But still. No. Cake.” She sighed, and walked over to the corner of the room, where there was a full-body mirror. She looked into it, and Ali got to see just who’s mind she had been examining.

The girl in the mirror was small, even for her age, and thin as a twig. Her hair was a light green color, down to her mid-back, framing a almost doll-like face.

Ali gave a mental gasp.

It was Kyrie.

Then Ali's view started to fade around the edges, until she was plunged into darkness once again.

Ali’s finger twitched.

Then her eyes, wide and unseeing, came into focus. She blinked them rapidly. She was back in her room. Back in the mansion. She breathed a sigh of relief. What had just happened? She thought she had a pretty good idea.

Then, she heard a moan beneath her, and realized she was crushing Kyrie with her growing girth.

“Oh!” She said, rolling off the mysterious moemon. “Sorry! Sorry!”

‘I-I-I-It’s f-fine…” Kyrie said weakly. “A-A-Ali… I t-t-think I just… r-r-remembered something.”

“Yea, Kyrie. I think you did.”

Kyrie looked confused. “H-How would you know?”

“Because, Kyrie. I saw it too.”

------------------------


Meanwhile, dinner was just finishing up for the rest of the occupants of the mansion, and it was full stomachs all around. Fontina sighed and rubbed her bloated stomach. How was she supposed to lose weight with all this amazing food? It seemed that when ever anything was placed in front of her, she had no choice but eat it.

Across from Fontina, Midnight was looking a little green around the gills. No surprise their. After her cookies, she finished off a whole block of fudge, and on top of that, forced down five large servings of the six cheese lasagna that had just been eaten. Her stomach felt ready to burst at any moment, and she made sure that fact was known throught the table.

“Oh….. Way to much… Groaaan…”

Just as Fontina was about to remind Midnight of her table manners, a door burst open loudly. Through it rushed Ali, her growing belly and bust bouncing with every step. She sprinted straight for Shera. After a few seconds of gasping for air, she whispered something into the tubby moemons ear. The rest of the table strained to hear what was going on.

“What? What do you mean?” Shera said, looking worried. More whispers. “Right now?” Angry whispers. “Ok. Lets go.” Shera grunted as she got up, her own full belly making it a bit hard to move. Nevertheless, She managed a slow jog behind Ali as the vertically challenged moemon ran through the open doorway. Shera slammed the door behind her.

Everyone in the room looked confused. What had just happened? A murmur broke out among the remaining diners. Fontina leaned over to Midnight, but she couldn’t get any kind of conversation out of her but, “Oh, I don’t care what’s got that stupid pipsqueak all upset! My stomach hurrrrts!”

Fontina was worried. Neither Ali or Kyrie had been seen all day, and something might have happened! What if Kyrie was hurt or something? Fontina couldn’t just sit there wondering. So, with a grunt, she too, rose from her seat. Ignoring the complaints of her overly-filled stomach, she waddled as quickly as she could through the doorway through witch Ali and Shera had gone, ignoring the stares of the others seated around the table.

--------------------

“Ok. So, I just wanted to say that I happen to believe you” Shera started, after the pair of young moemon struggled to explain what had just happened. Even to Ali, it had sounded ridicules. Like some sort of stupid B-grade movie. So it was with relief that Shera had accepted it so easily.

“But also, I have some questions.” Shera continued. “Like, why did both of you see the same thing? Does either of you have any physic type in you? Because something like this definitely suggests some strong physic genes.”

“Nope!” Ali replied confidently. “My family’s fire types, through and through! Well, accept my great-uncle Herbert. He’s a Gravler. But that doesn’t count, right?”

“Right. And I guess we still have no idea what Kyrie is…. Do we?” Shera looked over questioningly at Kyrie.

“N-N-No.” She said in her typical whisper-quiet voice.

“Yea. That memory was kind of useless.” Ali commented. “It really didn’t help us learn anything.”

Shera nodded in agreement, and opened her mouth to respond. But before she could, she was interrupted by a quiet voice..

“E-E-Excuse m-me, I-I think I d-did learn something.” Kyrie mumbled. She blushed when she realized that Shera had been about to speak. “Oh, I-I’m s-s-sorry….”

“No, no! Go ahead! What did you remember?”

Kyrie blushed again. “W-well, I j-just noticed, that m-my birthday is soon.” She said quietly.

Ali suddenly remembered examining the calendar in the memory. “Oh yah! I remember that! Kyrie, did you know that your birthday is the same day as mine?
The 17th, right?”

Kyrie nodded.

Shera beamed. “Kyrie, that’s great! Your starting to remember things! This is a good sign. Can you remember how old your turning?”

But that question threw her. No matter how hard she thought, she couldn’t remember her age. It was even hard to guess. Physically, her small breasts suggested early teens, though her manner was one normally found in younger kids. Of course, nothing seemed quite normal about Kyrie…

Slowly, Kyrie shook her head no, sad to have disappointed Ms. Shera.

“Oh, that’s ok, Kyrie. It’ll all come back to you, I promise.” Shera said comfortingly.

“But for now, I better be heading back to inform everyone that nobody’s died or something.” Looking at Kyrie, she asked, “Do you want me to tell them what happened?”

Ali cut in here. “I think you should. Just not… Ya know. The weird parts.” Ahe said, referring to the whole ’both having the same flashback’ thing.

Shera laughed. “Well, I mind as well just keep the whole thing a secret then, shouldn’t I?” after suppressing her chuckling, she added, “Yah, I get it. Well, I’ll be off then. If either of you feel ill, just find me!” Then she took her leave, closing the door behind her.

Just seconds after the door was shut, a snarling growl ripped through the still air of the room, making both girls jump. Ali’s mind jumped to wild beasts, monsters, that creepy shadow in her room that had haunted her younger selves dreams. But no. It was Kyries stomach.

Ali couldn’t help but burst out laughing, more so at Kyries expression of absolute, the-world-is-ending horror and embarrassment at her empty belly.

“BUAHAHAHAHAHAHA! Oh gosh! Oh, Kyrie! I’m so sorry! It’s just.. Oh man…” She struggled out, fighting tears. Kyrie’s face was redder than a tomato. “Oh, man, sorry, sorry… Lets go get us some dinner…” She said, fighting giggles the whole time. She grabbed the suddenly hungry moemons hand, and lead her out of the room in search of food…

Ali had her laughter quite under control by the time she and Kyrie entered into the now-deserted dining room. The two hungry girls had hoped to find some dinner left, but no such luck. So Ali decided to make for the kitchen, where there was sure to be some cookies or something.

And there were. A new batch, just out of the oven, in fact. But there was also Midnight, apparently in some sort of food induced half-coma, telling Wester her life story. To his credit, he was nodding in all the right places.

“Oh, and that stupid BITCH Hannah was making out with him in the back hall! Can you *urp* BELIEVE it?” Midnight lamented to Wester, who was just placing another tray of cookies onto the counter. Midnight took one of the warm treats and stuffed it in her mouth. The portly chef just sighed.

Then, Wester noticed Ali and Kyrie standing in the doorway. He looked at them with eyes practically screaming, ‘save me.’ Ali just nodded.

“Oh, sorry to interrupt your interesting story, Midnight, but I must, uh, use the restroom.” The kind chef said hastily, practically running out of the kitchen. On his way out, he whispered a subtle ‘thanks’ to Ali before dashing off to nowhere in particular.

Ali rolled her eyes. Obviously, the poor chef had not been prepared for one of Midnight’s world famous pity parties. And by the looks of it, this one was the sweet 16 of them all.

Midnight was lying on the countertop, and by the looks of her hugely bloated belly, she had started snacking after dinner. She had chocolate smeared all over her face, and was flying in the sky on a sugar-buzz high. (Lol that rhymed :3)

Such a buzz, in fact, that she didn’t seem to remember her painfully full stomach. Ali and Kyrie could only watch in amazement as the curvy moemon munched on cookies, forcing them into her huge orb of a belly. Well, that is, until Midnight noticed the pair staring.

“HEY!” She yelled, wincing slightly as she quickly hopped off her perch on the counter and onto the floor. “What the HELL are you two *urp* doing here?!?!?”

“WELL, we had just come down to get something to eat, but all we found was your fat ass eating all the cookies!” Ali said in a hostile tone, egging Midnight on.

“Why you little..!” Midnight growled menacingly, trying as hard as possible to ignore her painful belly.

The whole thing probably (Ok, ok, definitely.) would have turned into a fight if Kyrie hadn’t been there. But she was. So, for her sake, Ali stopped the taunting just in time. (But made sure to full advantage of Midnights vulnerable circumstances, none the less.)
In the end, all that came out of it was Midnight storming out of the kitchen, rubbing her stuffed orb gently, grumbling something about stupid gnomes. Just as she turned into a different hallway, Wester appeared in a flash, apparently waiting for the dark moemon to leave his kitchen the whole time.

“Oh, thank you, thank you!” He said to Ali and Kyrie. “Midnight is a nice girl, but can be a bit… Well…”

“Snobbish? Selfish? Bitchy? Bratty?” Ali offered helpfully.

“I guess you could put it that way.”

In return for saving the rest of his fresh cookies from the mouth of Midnight, (Who surely would have regretted them anyways) the chef started reheating the leftovers from the nights dinner.

“Unfortunately, there never seems to be as many leftovers these days.” He said.

“No problem. We just want a little something to hold us over.” Said Ali, who helped herself to a cookie. What she really wanted right now was a feast, but apparently, that would have to wait…

*After a (rather enormous) makeshift dinner*

Turns out the pair didn’t have to wait after all.

“Ohh… Walter, how many leftovers did you used to have? Cause’ if this is less than your used to, I’m scared to think of what you usually have…”

Ali and Kyrie both lay down on the countertop, just as Midnight had done not to long ago. Also like Midnight, both were nursing large, food-stuffed bellies.

“Well, I guess I stretched the truth just a bit on that one. Leftovers don’t usually get eaten around here anyways, so I didn’t want to have this sitting in the fridge to go bad…” The chef replied. “Plus, you probably would be just fine if you hadn’t ate the rest of my cookies.”

Ali rolled her eyes. “Walter, your so funny sometimes.” With a huff, Ali pulled herself into a sitting position on the countertop, her bloated stomach jutting out a bit. “Well, I guess me and Kyrie here should sleep this off. Whacha say, Kyrie?”

“Uhhhg... Uh, I-I-I mean, s-sure.” The girl said with a blush. Her own belly was bloated outward in a way that looked almost unnatural on her otherwise wraith-like figure. With a struggle, she got herself to her feet, and the stuffed pair headed off to bed.

Meanwhile, Fontina was having some food problems of her own.

She had checked everywhere for Kyrie and Ali, hoping to see if they were alright. Everywhere! At first, she checked the infirmary. Nope. The trio‘s room. Notta. Kyries room. Zilch.

And then she came to the Staff room, where she found someone. Just not Ali or Kyrie. She found Ember.

She had politely taken a donut from her, just to get her out of her hair. But no. She offered another. And another! Fontinas still full belly didn’t approve one bit. But when Ember had started crying that Ali and Kyrie, her ’eating friends’ had left her, and how she needed a new friend to play with, Fontina got suspicious and tried to take her leave. No such luck for our growing beauty.

Ember had trapped her under her impressive girth just as she had Ali earlier in the day, and started feeding Fontana’s already stuffed gut a steady stream of fatty pastries. Fontina was powerless against this huge girl, and accepted her fate. Death by pastry.

After a full hour, about the time when Ali and Kyrie were finishing up there own huge meals, Ember finally said, “There. That should hold you over for the night.” And left her groaning companion to her pain.

Fontina just couldn’t find the strength or willpower to move herself from that couch. After such a large dinner, then this, her stomach truly hated her right now. It moaned at groaned at every movement, bulging out to proportions that Fontina would have thought impossible for an average stomach.

And so, it was in this state of pain that Fontina drifted into a state of half sleep, half food-coma.

It has been a week cense we last checked in on our gaining girls. It has been a rather eventful three days. Lets look back on them, shall we?

On the outside, everybody has been happy. Settled into a routine. Wake, breakfast, work, snack, work, lunch, work, snack, work, dinner. Then another snack. Maybe another? Sure, why not. One more? Ug, no, can’t, too full. Fine then. Just one more.

But beneath the outer cover, life was a little stressful. The first reason is directly derived from the admittedly food heavy routine above. The girls weight.

They just couldn’t seem to get there eating under control. They always happened upon the kitchen or break room a few times a day, and when they did, they just couldn’t resist a bite or two… Or three. And so their weights continued to rise. Ali’s ‘assets’ increased in size, though unfortunately they were outpaced by her slowly growing belly. Fontina was stressed, as her own curves continued to be blown up by another 10 lbs. It was Midnight who was suffering the worst, however, thanks to her nightly self-pity binges. She was already well on her way to growing out of her uniform, much to Sheras chagrin.
“She’s growing out of those things faster than I can sew them…” She had said, shaking her head.

Even petit little Kyrie had put on some weight. Not a shocking amount, but enough that others were noticing the difference. Her wasp-waist had grown to, well, normal proportions, while her tiny breast had grown slightly. Her flat belly had grown softer, and there a bit of a bulge in her tight dress.

And that brings us to another reason for stress: Kyrie.

Not that Kyrie was a problem. On the contrary, everybody loved her, even Midnight. It was just impossible to resist the charm of the small, shy moemon. No, Kyrie wasn’t a problem, but her past was.

Through out the week, Kyrie continued to have her strange little ‘flashbacks.’ Several times a day, she would collapse on the floor, bringing everyone with her into a strange past world. (This was quite a shock at dinner, when half of the tables occupants had suddenly collapsed. Took quite a bit of ‘splainin to get that worked out.)

Through these strange glimpses into the past, a picture was slowly revealed. But what it was turning out to be wasn’t too pretty. From what they could tell, the mansion of her past was huge, five stories high, and much more elegant then the one they were in. It was home to dozens of moemon of all ages, from young children to elderly seniors. They couldn’t figure it out. Not an orphanage, not a rest home. What was it?

Things got weirder when they discovered some sort of ranking system. In conversations, people always mentioned how ‘I’m just a D’ or ‘She got moved up to B.’ They realized that each floor had a designated letter, A being the highest. And that’s what Kyrie was. everybody treated her with respect and envy, even fellow “A’s” But that was basely the extent of their knowledge. But all of them felt sure that whatever was going on in Kyrie’s past wasn’t very good….

And with that rushed description of the past week, we catch up with reality…

-----------------------------

The first thing Celia felt was the ground.

”Ouch! Wow, that was bad…” The girl said, getting up from the ground, rubbing her tender bottom. “Well, at least I made it ok… I think.” She mumbled, looking herself over, making sure there were no deformities, no missing limbs. Looking at her medium breasts and partially-developed hips, she determined that she was about the right age… Maybe a bit older. But nothing too bad. It definitely could have been worse, with the rush she had been in. Kyrie should still be able to recognize her.

Kyrie! She suddenly remembered why she was here, the reason for her hastened escape. What the hell was that girl doing? Hadn’t she given her detailed instructions? Made it ABSOLUTELY clear that said instructions were freakin’ IMPORTANT?!?!

But no, she had arrived back to where she had come from to find everything all wrong. She had fallen right into that beasts grasp, and had hardly gotten out of there alive. What the hell was that girl thinking?

Fuming, the green-haired moemon marched through the woods, trying to find an opening in the canvas of green above her. She couldn’t keep angry for long in her beloved forest, though, and soon began to think clearly. What could have happened? Had Kyrie just gotten sidetracked? Or something bad, like hurt or captured by that freak again? She began to worry. That wouldn’t do at all… And how was she supposed to find Kyrie anyway? It had been what, a week? That’s what she had been aiming for, but she didn’t know exactly. Well, expecting it had been a week sense she left, Kyrie could be miles and miles ahead by now…

But that question was answered the minute she stumbled onto a small clearing in the canopy.

“Aw, man, Kyrie. What did I tell you about controlling your powers?” She mumbled to herself. Then she took off at unnatural speed toward the towering storm cloud just a mile away…

‘This has got to be it.’ Celia thought to herself, standing in the heavy rain outside of the building. She had located the very center of the storm, which happened to be right on top of this place. But she had to be sure. Kneeling down and closing her eyes, she concentrated, searching, psychologically feeling the mansion for the presence of sentient minds. It was hard, what with the heavy rain pounding around her, interrupting her concentration, but she quickly found what she was looking for. There were twelve moemon, twelve pinpricks of light in her consciousness. (I think there are twelve characters… Don’t quote me on it though.) Three were asleep, their lights dimmer, and one of them, the brightest, blue one, was Kyrie. It had to be.

She opened her eyes and stood up. How to do this? It all depended. Was Kyrie being held captive? Or was she just staying for the night? Only the fist option made cense to Celia. Kyrie should be miles away by now. But she wasn’t.

Nevertheless, she wasn’t going to go breaking into private property without knowing for sure what was up. So she decided to go the old fashioned way, also known as the doorbell. If the place happened to be crawling with evil devils or something of the sort, she was sure she could take care of herself. If it wasn’t, well, all the better for her.


-----------------------------------


Well, It was that time of day again. The time between work and dinner. That annoying 30 minutes at the mansion when you had nothing to do, and you were hungry. But you can’t eat, right? Dinners just around the corner. So you just sit there and suffer. Or, ya know. Go to the break room.

Which, coincidentally, is where we find our growing girls at the present.

“Jeez, Kyrie. That’s like, your fourth one! Save some room for dinner!” Ali, ever the hypocrite, said, her own mouth full with the last bite of her own fifth donut.

Actually, it was Kyries fifth too. But she didn’t mention that, she just set the donut down gently.

“Ali, you’ve had what? Like, twenty? Kyrie, pick that donut back up. You need some meat on you, anyway!” Midnight shot challengingly, caring more about peeving Ali than about whether Kyries BMI was healthy.

Kyrie, of course, obediently picked the pastry back up.

Ali looked back at Midnight, sensing her challenge. “I’ve had two, for your information, and Kyrie is perfectly healthy. Kyrie, calories kill. You don’t want anything to do with them. Put the donut down.”

Kyrie glanced hungrily at the treat, but promptly complied.

“Cmon, stop it. Or you’re gonna give Kyrie a heart attack.” Fontina said, annoyed at her friends. Not that they even acknowledged her.

Before Midnight could unleash her snappy comeback to Ali (Something along the lines of, ‘carbs are your friends’) There was an obnoxiously loud series of dings and dongs, elaborately interweaved into a half minute song.

After a few seconds of silence, Ali blurted “… What the heck was THAT?”

As if to answer her question, Shera poked her head to the room. “Hey girls, dinners ready. You should come downstairs. Oh, and if your wondering, that was the doorbell.”

“Oh. What kind of doorbell is that?” Ali asked. Midnight just shrugged, unable to thing of a reason for such an obnoxious doorbell. The three got up, and Midnight and Ali left the room behind Shera. Kyrie lagged behind a bit. Looking around fugitively, she quickly stuffed that last donut into her mouth before following her friends.

The four some worked their way through the mansion like pros, as they had finally gotten the feel for the confusing hallways. They reached the first floor just in time to see Shera letting the person who had rung the doorbell into the house. Despite their rush to get food, they stopped to see whoever it was. It was a girl, first off. She appeared to be a young traveler, like themselves, seeking shelter from this freak storm. She had long, light green hair that almost reached her waist, moderate sized breasts, and was of average height. She wore a short sleeved shirt, which started out green at her shoulders and faded to white at the bottom, and a pair of blue jeans. She had a round face and toned muscles you could see beneath her soaking-wet shirt. But what really stood out about her was her piercing light blue eyes, which were currently shifting from side to side, as if looking for something.

Just then, Shera noticed the girls standing there. “Oh, girls! I’d like you to meet Celia. She got trapped in this weather too, so she’ll be staying till’ it passes by. Celia, this is Ali, Fontina, Midnight, and-”

“KYRIE!” Celia shouted. Much to everyone’s shock, she ran up to the young moemon and gave her a joyful hug. “Kyrie! Gosh, dang it, I was so frikkin worried!” Celia said, letting her go. “What have you been doing? I thought I told you… Hey!”

Timid little Kyrie had not been able to handle this treatment, and was currently hiding behind Fontina, her head just peeking out to look at this weird newcomer.

Celia was confused. What was wrong with Kyrie? Did she not recognize her? No, that couldn’t be it. But then why…?

Her thoughts were interrupted by a hand on her shoulder. Whipping her head around, she saw it was Shera. “Cilia… Do you know Kyrie?” Cilia hesitated, then nodded. These people seemed nice enough.

“Than I think we need to have a little discussion.” Turning to the girls, she said, “Hey, you girls go to dinner. We’ll meet you there in a few minutes.” The girls, stunned from whatever had just happened, nodded and walked off. Turning to Celia, Shera sighed. “I don’t know how you know Kyrie, whether you’re her friend, or her cousin, or what. But I’m praying you’ve got some answers, cause things are getting weirder by the second with that girl.”

“You can tell me everything. I’ll guarantee I’ve seen weirder from her.” Celia responded. And then Shera told her tale.

------------------------------

“So Kyrie knows nothing.”

“Except her name and what she knows from her flashbacks, no. Nothing at all.”

“Those flashbacks… There strange. She’s not a phycic type.”

“Do you know what type she is?”

“Yes.”

“… Are you going to tell me?

“Nope.”

Shera sighed. She had told this girl everything that had happened with Kyrie, everything she knew, anyways. Yet every time Shera asked something of Celia, the answer was ‘Not now.’ This girl with the piercing eyes was nearly as much of a mystery as Kyrie was.

“So. Are you going to tell me anything about her past? You seem to know a lot.”

“Yes, I know a lot. Almost everything, I would think. But you don’t need to know anything yet. Not now.”

Celia had to admit, Shera was kind, Kyries friends were trustworthy, and she had been told the truth. But her knowing of Kyries past could do only harm.

“Shera. I’m sorry I can’t tell you anything, and I’m sorry if I sound disrespectful. I mean, I’m only 17. (at least, that was her best estimation. She really had no clue.) But I’m going to stick around her for a while. This whole thing has thrown a wrench in my plans… I’m going to have to keep Kyrie here until she recovers some. Would you be willing to let me do that?”

“Of course you can, dear. Be our guest. I understand if you don’t feel at the liberty to tell anything.” 17? Shera was thinking. The girl carries herself like an adult.

“Thank you, Shera. Now, did you say something about dinner…?”

Actually, she hadn’t, but whatever. “Ya. We better get there before its gone! C’mon, I’ll show you the way!”

With that, the pair headed toward the dining room.

After hours of climbing up the treacherous mountainside it was to be expected that, even though our team of heroines was nothing if not persistent, Midnight, Ali, and poor Fontina were beyond exhausted; barely cognitive. In fact, to keep their minds busy, Midnight and Ali spent the latter half of their trek upwards coming up with a new word just to express how tired they were. So far after three hours of climbing, bickering, and complaining, the best they had come up with was "tirexhaustified"; but that could have been the sleep deprivation getting to them.

But in all actuality, they had long mentally abandoned their bodies and simply passed through with the motions that were handed to them, relying on instinct entirely. It had gotten them far enough, until one of them bothered to question just why it was they were climbing anymore. Then a long period of depression ensued as well as homicidal thoughts towards the wellbeing of their self-proclaimed leader- climbing this stupid rock being her idea in the first place.

Truth be told, Midnight hadn't exactly bargained for just how hot things were going to get or just how that would affect their team. Sure, she'd been through victory road with Ali and the Fontster before (it got kinda steamy in there) but at least there was a nice underground lake. Here was just elevation and multiple climaxes of heat. Had she known that she would be leading her team to a death-pit of... death... then she probably wouldn't have even bothered climbing this stupid volcano. Probably.

Maybe...

Possibly.

Point being, it was hot and nobody was having any fun anymore. Not that there was much fun to have been having at the start, but they were having a lot less fun now that they were all dehydrated and sore.

"Midnight..." Ali wheezed as she coughed up some flem mixed with the heavy soot in the air, "I want you to know... that I hate you."

"What?!" Midnight barked from too far ahead, having headed up as a sort of scout to make sure the footing was okay for the vertically challenged Ali and the generously deep dimensions of Fontina. Couldn't have the fiesty little Quilava moemon unable to reach or the dangerously busty Vaporeon bouncing off the mountain, could she?

"I said that I hate you!!" Ali yelled louder over the high winds, "I wish I'd never met you, because then we wouldn't be trapped on this stupid mountain- we're gonna die up here if we don't find a way down!!"

"Allison, you don't mean that!" Fontina yelled from underneath the smaller girl, clinging desperately to a ledge so as not to be blown away, "If something happens up here then--

"No I mean it, Fonty!!" Ali barked back, "She needs to hear it, how I finally feel!!"

A good couple of yards above Ali in altitude, the exchange between her two team mates went entirely ignored by her. The high winds and even higher temperatures had made things unbearable enough. In the distance, she could faintly hear the sounds of the Earth churning magma from the few active parts of the Volcano. She squinted her dark eyes in pain, her own sweat dripping from the tip of her dark chocolate brow and rolling right into her eyes. Oh what she'd give to be on a beach right now, surrounded by chocolate and money...

But dreaming wasn't going to get any closer to the top of this mountain. She persevered. If she was weak then she would fall, never getting any closer to her dreams of wealth and glory. She would never be able to rub it into her stupid family's face that she wasn't just another girl- someone special! And if she looked weak here, how would the other girls carry on without her...?

The Mightyena girl gave a mighty grunt as she heaved her weight upwards and grabbed at a piece of rock. Her nails, sharp and chiseled resembling claws, dug into the surface. She grinned to herself; as soon as she got her friends to a safe place with enough room to spread out, they would all take a break and call it a day. She could relax and take a nap, of course that would only come after--

KACHICK!!

"Midnight!!" Ali hollered at the top of her lungs as the Mightyena woman clutched blindly to the piece of rock in her hands, "I want you to know that I hate you!!"

And with that, the dark moemon slowly peeled from the side of the mountain like an old sticker. Her body leaned backwards at a fourty-five, then ninety degree angle before coming off of the surface completely, falling head first to the bottom of Stark Mountain.

"Midnight!!" Fontina shouted as she herself began to lean over, searching desperately for her companion, who was slowly falling out of sight beneath the heavy soot. "Ali, you've got to do something!!"

"O-Ohmigod..." Ali shook, feeling her fingers tremble beneath her own weight as she watched Midnight fall to her imminent death.

"Ali!!" Fontina shouted again, "We're in a volcano, shouldn't you be able to do something?!"

"I-I... I-I can't!" Ali whimpered beneath the sound of ruptured geysers, "Oh God... Oh God...the last thing I told her was... was..."

Fontina began her descent downwards, stepping down the many rocks she had climbed today in hopes of reaching her fallen friend. "W-We've got to get down there!" Fontina stammered, "Sh-She'll hit that alcove we passed pretty hard, but she might still make it! A-Ali, we've got to--

CLI-CHICK

Suddenly her footing was lost and Fontina slipped, saved only by her fearfully tight grasp on the mountainside. Her big blue eyes shrank down to mere dots in her fear, sweaty azure hair seeming to weigh a thousand pounds by itself. She flexed her pitiful muscles, only further atrophied by her relaxing week at the Resort Area. She had lost her footing, and had no way of pulling herself back up!

"A-Ali!!" she squeaked, "Y-You've got to help!"

The Quilava moemon's head slunk downwards, only to see one of her very best friends hanging on to an inch of her life by, literally, an inch of skin. Her will shriveled and died as she lifted out a feeble hand, nursing onto the mountainside like a small child.

"I-I've got you!"

However, Fontina's weight was too much for the younger girl- as soon as she grabbed hold of Ali's sweaty hand, the voluptuous girl sent herself as well as her friend tumbling down towards Midnight. They hollered and screamed, fearful of what fate await them in the chilly grip of death...

At least it was cold.

Ali heard a voice – It was unfamiliar, but it was a warm and childish voice, but it certainly didn’t seem to belong to a devil that would torture her for life. Ali tried to think, she tried to figure out what was going on…

It was then that something cold was laid atop of her forehead, making her eyes widen and she yelped out. “COLD!!!”

“AAAH!”

At first Ali’s eyes closed up again, the light was almost so blinding and her brow was soaking wet with what she assumed was cold water. After a few seconds, Ali reopened her eyes to see her situation – Wherever she was, it certainly wasn’t any sort of building she was accustomed to. The walls were made of some sort of dried clay and rocks that had torches attached to the wall that was used to light the room. Ali realized she was resting atop of what appeared to be a number of soft leaves and a pelt of some sort of pokemon hide that was incredibly soft to the touch.

One other thing that she noticed about herself was that save for a few bandages and rainbow colored feathers wrapped around her body, the young Quilava girl was practically only in her birthday suit. Immediately, Ali’s face went red when she realized this little fact and she brought up her arms to wrap around her almost exposed chest – Only to flinch at the pain that erupted around her ribs. “URK!”

“Oh! N-No! D-Don’t do that!”

Ali blinked a few times when a pair of petite hands wrapped around her arms and gently pulled them away from her chest – Ali followed the arms to see that they belonged to a young (roughly around her age, give or take a year) girl with bronze colored skin and short black hair that had the tops of her hair held up with a makeshift clip to make a pair of big strands stick up from her head (they kinda resembled animal ears). The girl herself was roughly around Ali’s height, and was dressed in a black animal skin bikini top and matching furred skirt.

One thing that Ali noted was the girl was rather chubby – nothing too major, but she had a noticeable pudge to her waist, her thighs were thick, her bulging breasts were straining the bikini top she had, and her face had a cute curve to it. She also had yellow and black face paint on her cherubic face, adding an additional level of cuteness to it – If Ali had to guess, this was a Tepig Moemon, which was weird since she was sure that Tepig girls were native only to the Unnova region…

“If y-you move t-too m-m-much,” The Tepig girl struggled to say (her English could use some work). “Y-Your wounds w-will get w-w-worse.”

Slowly the Tepig girl began to push Ali back down to the bed, trying to get the Quilava girl to rest. Ali had so many questions – Who was this girl? Where was she? What happened to…

Ali’s eyes nearly bugged out of her skull. That’s right! Where was Fontina and Midnight?!? Ali’s breathing began to grow rapid as she tried to process what happened in her head, but she calmed down slightly when the Tepig girl griped her hand, “D-Don’t worry! Y-You’re safe… A-And so are your f-f-friends.”

The Tepig girl shifted to the left slightly and Ali turned her head to see that there were a couple of other makeshift beds in the room with her – And resting on the beds was none other than her friends! Albeit, they were in the same condition that Ali was in – Knocked out but breathing, alive, but nearly naked (save for the weird rainbow colored feathers and bandages which made Ali’s face grow even redder). Her two friends seemed to just snore lightly as Ali breathed a sigh of relief.

“W-We treated y-your wounds a-a-as soon as p-possible,” The Tepig girl stated, which garnered Ali’s attention once more. “W-With some r-r-rest, you three s-s-should be fine.”

Once again, Ali breathed a sigh of relief and smiled – But then that smile slowly melted away as many questions appeared in her head and she finally spoke. “Where… What… Who are you?”

The Tepig girl’s face blushed slightly as she bowed her head towards Ali, “Ah-Ah! I’m s-s-sorry! I… I f-f-f-forgot to introduce m-myself! I… I am Lin-Hua of the Stark Tribe! I… I… I was the one to f-find y-you and y-your f-friends.”

It was then that Lin-Hua turned away from Ali with her hands on her cheeks and gushed out, “O-Oh! T-T-That was s-s-so embarrassing!”

‘… How was that embarrassing?’ Ali thought as she was about to open up her mouth to say something…

Only to be interrupted by a loud growling sound, and her face turned as red as a tomato – It was her stomach. It felt as if Ali was starving – She didn’t know how long she was out, but she was definitely hungry…

“Um… I-I have some f-f-food here,” Lin-Hua stated as she spun around to reveal a wooden tray that had been loaded down with fruits, veggies, and even some meat on the bone. “I… I wasn’t s-s-sure when y-you three would w-w-wake up, s-so I’ve been bringing a l-lot of food to g-g-give you all when y-you all woke up…”

That was a lot of food… But considering how hungry she was…

The woman above her seemed to notice this, as she quickly and visibly lost enthusiasm in discussing with Ali.

"It is as I feared." sighed the Priestess, "Girl is potato."

"Poh-tay-toe?" Lin Hua curiously parroted her mentor's lament

"Yes. Means she is now unresponsive. Like sleep, but much much worse." one hand seemed to disappear from Ali's line of sight, only to reemerge with a large crudely-formed cleaver, "Must put child out of misery and let do what must do."

"No stop!!" Ali suddenly cried out as Xiao-Ming's wild swing stopped just above her nose, "I'm not potato, I'm not potato!"

"Ah, is good!" the woman cried out joyously as she stroked Ali's hair, "Xiao thought for second there that little girl would lose nostril. Good to know you're still alive and function fully." she smiled as a loud 'CLANG' resounded through the cave, "You are strong, like good all fire-types should be; blood of Entei runs strong in you, not like water companion."

"W-Water companion?" Ali mumbled, "B-Blood of- just what is going on here?"

"I have to explain again?" Xiao answered wryly as she inched towards the cleaver again, "You sure you're not potato?"

"I'm not a potato!!"

"Okay, is good. Just making sure. You took pretty hard blow to head there, is miracle you are not potato. Companions and I saved you and friends before too much damage. Take you back here for three days or so, you have been sleeping as magical Ho-oh feathers heal." she picked up Ali's head and rested it in her lap, "Everyone says Foreigner Girl and her friends not make it, but little Lin Hua there asked that we save you three. You have lots of thanks to give for little Whelp. But for now, you rest."

Her touch, while rough, was rather soothing to the distressed Ali. She found her rough calluses calming, in a strange way, and felt safe knowing that she was in strong hands. "But where... where am I?" she asked weakly as she looked upwards at the bronzed goddess, "How did... how did we survive?"

"Is not important right now." Xiao-Ming said in a soothing voice, "What is important is that you are in good hands. Best hands. Best hands in whole tribe now, little Ember." she cooed as she stroked Ali's hair lovingly, "Do you think you can eat? Yes? No? Either way, you build up strength." On command Lin Hua brought the wooden plate teeming with food to the priestess, who took it upon herself to bring the food to Ali's somewhat reluctant mouth. "We will deal with Chief later- for now we make sure that littlest flicker of all survives... and her companions too. Possibly, Xiao is not so sure about the fat one."

"<Priestess!>" Lin Hua called in her native tongue

"Alright, alright. Fat one lives too."
113312.title: Rescue

Before that, Xiao enters the hospital with bad news - Water tribe is attacking!
1133121.content:
It had been a few hours since Ali had woken up in the weird tribal hospital with the chubby Tepig girl Lin Hua and the buxom Ninetails priestess Xiao-Ming. And needless to say, Ali was still slightly out of it throughout all of that time. Since the two other fire type moemon had left earlier, the entire room was dead quiet – Save for the rhythmic breathing of her two knocked out friends…

There were still so many questions that floated in Ali’s head, of course, with no one conscious around, the young Quilava girl was all alone – With only the sounds of the flickering fire and the echoing voices outside kept her company. Well, that and the growls of her stomach.

Ali’s mouth watered slightly as she looked at the large plate of fruits and veggies that both of tribal moemon had left for her hours ago. They had suggested that she regain her strength by eating – But with one of those women trying to get her with a cleaver, she was a little wary of trusting them – But it was food, as long as she just got enough, then there wouldn’t be a problem.

Taking an apple from the tray, Ali quickly bit into the fruit allowing the juice and meat of the apple to go into her mouth – And instantly, the young Quilava’s eyes widened – It was extremely tasty! She had have apples before, but for some reason this one tasted like it was a natural sugary food. It was the best tasting fruit she ever bit into!

Almost immediately she munched down on the rest of the apple until minutes later – Only the core of the apple remained. With her tongue, Ali greedily licked up the sweet juice that had gotten on her face – She just wanted more of tasty fruit…

“Hehe… <You act like you haven’t eaten in ages.>”

Ali blinked a few times as the familiar native tongue was spoken and turn to the side to see Lin Hua standing a few feet away from her with a bowl of water in her hands. A few question marks appeared over Ali’s head as she tilted it slightly, “Excuse me?”

The chubby Tepig girl yelped slightly when she realized what she did, “S-Sorry, s-speaking your l-l-language is… Hard. I try best to speak with you. But, is hard…”

“Uh, don’t worry about it,” Ali replied as she subconsciously lifted her arms up to cover up her slightly exposed chest… Only to realize something. “Huh? It… It doesn’t hurt anymore…”

Lin Hua smiled brightly as she placed the bowl of water near the food and quickly turned back to Ali. Almost immediately, Lin Hua began to remove the colorful feathers from Ali’s bandages, “Priestess explained earlier – Ho-oh feathers heal. Even slight pain be gone now.”

Eventually, Lin Hua had removed all of the feathers – And there were a lot more than what Ali had seen before, there were at least seven feathers in Lin-Hua’s chubby hands. Curiously, Ali turned towards her knocked out friends – Midnight had at least three of them visible, but Fontina only had a couple of them in her bandages. “Uh, why did I have more of those on me?”

Lin-Hua struggled for a second, trying to come up with the right words, her already reddened face grew a bit redder until she stuttered out, “T-Tribe no trust o-outsiders easily. Lin-Hua had begged to save three, but still… Still tribe wary. Help child of Entei readily, even help d-daughter of darkness slightly…

“B-But, child of Suicune – S-She seen threat.”

“Threat? Fonty?” Ali questioned with her eyes narrowed. “She wouldn’t hurt a fly!”

Lin-Hua flinched greatly and spun around with her hands on top of her head, “M-M-May so, b-but, Stark T-T-Tribe no t-trust daughter of Suicune – Natural enemy of children of Entei! S-So, while w-we help, t-tribe no want t-t-trouble from d-d-daughter of Suicune…”

“Then… Then what’s going to happen to her when she gets better?” Ali asked shifting slightly in the bed she was in. “And what about Midnight?”

“W-Who?” Lin-Hua asked.

That was right, Ali didn’t introduce herself or her friends to Lin-Hua or Xiao – That made the young Quilava girl blush slightly as she rubbed the back of her head, “Uh, I-I mean my friends, what’s going to happen to them when they get better?”

“W-Well,” Lin-Hua sniffled slightly as she turned back to Ali. “You, as little ember, be welcomed with open arms – Daughter of Suicune and daughter of Darkness however…

“They most be put in prison – They be held as invader from opposing tribe, maybe for life. May be put to hard labor… As slave… Or worse…”

Ali’s eyes narrowed when she heard that, and her eyes glowed a slight red – She wasn’t going to let anyone do that to one of her friends! If it was Midnight, even though Midnight was a pain in the ass, Ali still wouldn’t let anyone make the Mightyena girl become a slave. The rage that Ali was feeling deep inside her was welling up, and she could feel the natural flames of her fire-type attributes burning brighter.

What the young Quilava girl didn’t realize that as she was getting angrier and angrier, the flames in the room were growing brighter and fiercer. Lin-Hua certainly noticed though and shook slightly at the display of power that the wounded moemon displayed in front of her. “<T-This is…!>”

“Lin-Hua, right?” Ali stated as she pulled the blankets away from her and slowly stood up from the bed. “Can you take me to the guy in charge? I need to talk to him about my friends…”

“T-The Chief?” Lin-Hua gulped, remembering that she had just met with the head honcho of the tribe earlier. “W-Well… Lin-Hua asked to bring little ember to Chief when you able to walk…”

“Then that’s perfect,” Ali stated before she looked down and immediately the fire that was in her calmed down and was replaced with a flame of embarrassment. “B-But before that… Lin-Hua, w-where are my clothes and underwear?”

“U-Under…w-w-wear?” Lin-Hua questioned, blinking a few times at the weird word that Ali just stated – She had never hear of such a word before…
