11331211.content:
The red clay the made up the walls of Xiao-Ming's infirmary were the prime material in the construction of the Throne Room. Their surface, baked hard and dry over millennium of exposure to the relentless heat of the volcano, seemed to convey a certain hearty warmth. One could rub their palms across certain areas of the wall and swear to not feel a thing, other than the humbling heartbeat of heat that drummed within the mountains of the Stark Tribe.

The walls of the Throne Room were not as welcoming.

Tall shadows of distorted figures danced across the miserable maroon canvas. Literally, they danced and hooted and hollered with vicious pride over their latest kill. The smell of meat dripped from the air as screams and cheers blended in a cacophonous symphony of blood-lust as moemon, male and female alike but all dressed in the same simplistic style of garb consisting of furs and bones, celebrated their recent acquirement of uncooked grub.

Torches lined the room in symmetrical fashion as their hearths shone valiantly with their own spells of fire and gallantry as they fought off the darkness. Four lit the corners of the room, tucked away behind a large wall of carved brimstone where most of the madness occurred. But in the center, where no moemon stood, lead a line of eight torches with a walkway big enough for several people to tread at once. It was of a different style than the rest of the room, clean and polished, and led up to a large circle of the same material. Beyond that, a staircase.

And beyond that: a king.

Intimidating as he seemed strong, the leader of these animals was a large Infernape moemon who sat in stony silence. His skin, where it was visible, had been burnt a burgundy shade of brown, and the rest hidden in his collection of white hair. Visible were his legs, wide and trunk-like as they bulged with muscle, though the sheets of white fur that grew from them made him seem much more simian in appearance. His feet were naked, untouched by fur but ripe with calluses. Clothed only in the necessities, his loincloth was made from some sort of pelt. It looked rare. His crown? Only the gold band that separated his skin from his flaming red head of hair.

The King sat as if in a daze, his hairy arm propped up on one of the rests of his throne as it supported his scarred cheek. He seemed unconcerned with the madness about his presence, focused only on his own shadow and the mysteries that the Darkness contained.

When something caught his eye.

A shape, a small shape but a shape still, became present in the hall. One foreign to his mighty rule. It grew closer without trepidation. It roared in it's tiny voice, "Yo, you the king?"

She seemed... confident.

Lithe, slender, yet without a hint of fear present within her movements. Despite their size differences, the smaller of the two seemed confident that she could break free of any scuffle should one occur. The larger one, the King, stifled a haughty scoff at the idea.

Alli took a mighty step forward, delicate brow furrowed in anger as she sized up the leader of these barbarians. Her own proportions, while not as firm and strong as his, had their own advantages. She could dodge and weave better than this muscle-head any day, she'd be willing to bet. Being dressed in bandages had its advantages too; less fluttering around. Less to get caught on.

Alli knew what she was doing. But by the piercing look in his powerful eyes, so did their Chief. He had been roused, interest peaked at this child's audaciousness. His head, along with his eyebrows, raised to show that he was unsatisfied with the forthright of such a young girl.

Behind her pattered the footsteps of Lin-Hua. She wasn't really "into" watching the girl she had just pulled so many favors to save die at the hands of her King. The chubby Tepig girl was obviously on edge, having no earthly idea what to do in a situation like this. She reached Alli in the middle of the circle that laid before the King and began tugging on her arm. "<Excuse her, chieftain,>" she squeaked upwards to the muscular man in the throne, "<she is only just now starting to get better from her injuries. I think she may have hit her head a little harder than expected...>"

But there was no hesitation in the King's voice as he roared in his native tongue, something obviously scary enough to make the admittedly skittish Lin-Hua look like she just wet herself. Alli's gaze never drifted from the "King", despite all of the cheering and madness trying to coerce her otherwise.

"I'm here to talk to you about me and my friends!" Alli shouted after the King calmed down a bit

The simian man's face twisted into a smarmy grin before he chuckled out something in the language that flowed in abundance here. Alli turned to Lin-Hua for a translation, "Y-You think I would waste time w-w-with puny la-language?" Lin struggled to say, "I have r-royal tongue of Entei to speak with."

Alli rolled her eyes, "Look asshole it's obvious you can understand me, so let's just get this straight," she said in her best commanding voice, "I appreciate everything your medic team's done for me and my friends. But that doesn't give you the right to decide where we spend the rest of our lives, and it really doesn't give you the right to be such a prick!" she hollered, "So I'd really appreciate it if you would just let me and my friends go back to the Resort and get on with our lives!"

There was a silence in the hall as the King processed the message. His scowl grew deeper and his brows more creased. For the first time he rose from his seat, revealing to Alli just quite how tall he really was. He began to sneer at the smaller girl before his lips began to move. "Since is just this once, I'd much rather not have Whelp send message for me. Stuttering is terrible." his voice was deep and gravelly, "I am King. I who, what, when, and where everyone to do. As King, I declare that Daughter of Darkness with five feathers in bandages be sold into slavery and left to the hands of my men. You are feisty Little Ember, I sell you to adviser as wife. And Daughter of Suicune with three of my feathers in bandages? She dies by my hand as soon as she is healed."

Alli winced, recoiling slightly, "Y-You can't do that!"

"I can. Wu-Kong is king. Little Ember and her comrades are on Wu-Kong's territory. Means yes, yes I can do that." the Infernape man said with a grin before bursting out into a fit of howling laughter, the rest of the courtroom following suit.

The mad laugh track in the background faded away from Alli's hearing, as did Lin-Hua's futile attempts at tugging her away from the Throne. All she could hear was the sound of her own heartbeat as her vision slowly merged. Without warning Alli broke from Lin-Hua's grasp and charged up the stairs, grabbing Wu-Kong by the chest hair.

"Look." she said curtly as she brought her face to his, "I am Allison Elm of New Bark Town in the Johto region. My friends and I, Midnight and Fontina, all have dreams to follow just like I'm sure you used to before becoming this high-and-mighty piece of muscle. We have families we need to see and people we'd like to see. And I'll be damned if some buffed up lunatic who really needs to find a razor is gonna keep us from it!" she snarled, "So remember this, if you keep us here, that means I'll be here. And you've got to sleep sometime."

"A-Alli!" Lin-Hua squeaked in the courtroom

"What?!" she turned around, not releasing the ivory hairs that sprouted from Wu-Kong's chest.

It seems that, in her unbridled rage, Alli's field of vision and hearing had shrunk a bit or she would have noticed the changes. For once, there was no screaming. No laughter, no animalistic cries of joy and hunger. There was only silence as the tamed group of feral moemon stared at the second and much more dramatic change in events. That being that the eight symmetrically placed torches in the room had suddenly become lava lamps. Not only had the fire been replaced by magma, but it was flowing skyward.

"Wh-What the..." Alli mumbled as her grip loosened.

"Y-You were speaking our language!" Lin-Hua piped up once more

"What, threats and violence?"

"No! I mean... y-you were speaking like us. Y-You use words of our tongue!"

"I-I didn't know I-

Wu-Kong's stony countenance broke into a smile. "You are Allison Elm of Johto, yes?" he grinned, "Johto is holy ground where Lord Entei was resurrected along with his kin by Ho-oh. This, as well as new decoration in Throne Room, and his tongue within you proves that you are truly child of Entei. His power is within you."

As soon as the words left Wu-Kong's mouth, everyone began to bow.

"You are new God-Queen, Allison Elm of Johto region."

113312111.content:
"Oh, man," Midnight moaned, "what hit me?"

Everything was confused in her head. She remembered climbing a mountain... no, it was a volcano... and they were looking for something... and she had fallen, and Ali was shrieking her head off about something.

Ali! The little pipsqueak must have distracted her while she was climbing. She was going to have words with a certain undersized Quilava, for sure. Or had Ali been screaming because she'd fallen off the mountain?

It was a little hard to think the morning after hitting a mountain headfirst.

Come to think of it, she wasn't sure it was even morning. She wasn't even sure where she was, for that matter. It looked like an infirmary, but the decor was straight out of Better Caves and Jungles. Fontina lay in the pile of furs next to her, looking like she'd been through a mangler. Did Midnight look like that? She certainly felt like it.

And where was Ali? Midnight looked around, worried. Sure, she was a shrimp, but she wasn't so small that she could be hiding in here. She was gone.

Midnight stood up woozily and stepped towards the door, only to find her way blocked by a pair of surly, burly guards. The surlier of the two barked something at her in a language she didn't recognize, while the burlier one prodded her still-sore breastbone and forced her back into the room. She felt a growl rumbling in her throat. Fine, if they didn't want to let her through--she'd just have to take out the trash. It was too early for Burly and Surly.

Before she could lunge, though, a chubby girl with a painted face forced her way between the two guards, babbling something in the same gibberish. They backed off, looking confused and chastened. Then the girl turned to Midnight.

"Daughter of Darkness!" she said. "Please, d-don't fight. You're honored guests now."

Midnight raised an eyebrow. "Now? What were we before?"

"You were... sort of... p-prisoners," the little Tepig stammered nervously, looking at Midnight's impressive biceps, "b-but not anymore, of course. The God-Queen has issued a full pardon, and commands an audience in the throne room at your earliest convenience."

"Who's this God-Queen? And what have you done with Ali?"

"W-well, it's hard to explain... please, just come along. We shouldn't keep her Infernal Magnificence waiting! I-it's rude!"

"Fine. Once I make sure Fontina's okay," Midnight said, bending over the Vaporeon's bed. "Then I'm gonna have a few words with this 'God-Queen' of yours."

------

"Oh, you've got to be freaking kidding me," Midnight said when she saw exactly who it was who bore the title of God-Queen, and who was currently perched on the throne of the fire tribe, dressed in raiment of gold and rubies and surrounded by guys who were hot in every sense of the word. One of the lithe, scantily loinclothed boys massaged Ali's shoulders, while a second rubbed her feet and a third offered her goodies from a tray laden with fresh, ripe fruit.

"I know, right? I just came in here, said a few things, blah blah blah, I'm a god. Hold on." Ali held up one finger as one of the sultry hunks dangled a bunch of grapes in front of her face. She chomped down on half the bunch, they drew back, ripping them off of the stems. "It's unbelievable."

"Yeah, and I don't believe it. What's the deal, they fattening you up as a human sacrifice, or what?"

"No! I'm the real God-Queen. I made some torches go nuts and everything. It was a sign."

"Oh, yeah, right, how do they pick their leader? Is it like drawing straws and the shortest wins?"

"No, and--and stop calling me short!"

One of the hotties popped a fig in Ali's mouth, and she chewed angrily. A tough-looking guy by her side asked something in the mystery language.

"H-he asks if you would like the brawny one executed for her insolence, God-Queen," Lin Hua asked.

"No! Don't execute anybody! Especially not my friends!" Ali said. "Don't do anything to them unless I tell you to."

"And what exactly are you planning to tell them?" Midnight snapped. "Since when are you allowed to boss me around?"

"Since I became God-Queen," Ali retorted. "And they were gonna do some pretty awful things to you until I showed up, so if I was you, I'd be a little nicer."

"Is that a threat?"

"Please," Fontina said, voice quivering. "Let's all just go home."

"You can go home if you want. Me, I'm gonna stay a while, Who needs some crappy mystery treasure when you've got a whole tribe at your beck and call. Hey, you! Melon me!"

One of the serving boys rummaged through his pile of fruit and came up with a good-sized cantaloupe, which he presented to Ali in thick wedges. She snarfed it down happily, juice dribbling down her chin.

"Oh, yeah. This is the life!"

122.content:
Ah, the beach, an excellent way to spend the warm days of summer – The cool crisp ocean water, the white hot sand, the smell of barbecued foods, and of course, all the wonderful sights to be held.

“CANNONBALL!”

A large splash caught the attention of almost all the nearby beachgoers, trailing their eyes to see a tall, thin and lithe Wartortle Moemon, water dripping off her long silver-white hair as she emerged from the water. Her tank top and swim trunks clung tightly to her surprisingly flat frame and if it wasn’t for her long hair, people would’ve assumed she was a guy. “Ah, that just hits the spot! Nothing like just jumping into the sea to on a hot day! HEY! COME ON IN! THE WATER’S FINE!”

The girl was shouting out from the water towards where her and her team had set up their beach site. Although, from where she was standing, the Wartortle Moemon could only see one member of her group just sitting underneath the large umbrella. “What the?”

Running from the water, the young woman ran up to the sight just to see one of her friends – A voluptuous, beautiful young woman with long black/blue hair simply relaxing in one of the few lounge chairs that was already set up on the beach, her long sundress clinging to her lovely figure. “Hey Lilith! Ain’t ya going to come into the water?”

The slightly older, Vileplume Moemon yawned slightly as she reclined into the chair, allowing some of the sunlight to fall onto her feet and the top of her hair, “Ah would, Shelli. But fer right now, Ah jus’ feel like lounging, after all, it was a lotta work ta become a Vileplume and ah jus’ wanna relax.

“Why not git Loupi ta join ya?”

“I would, but she kinda disappeared when we got here,” Shelli huffed as she crossed her arms over her non-existent chest. “I swear, sometimes that girl doesn’t think enough.”

“Aw, she’s sweet,” Lilith replied. “Anyway, Ah think Ah’m going ta work on my tan, Ah’ve always wanted ta get one, and this is the perfect chance.”

“Then what am I going to do?” Shelli asked raising an eyebrow. “It’s boring to swim if there’s no one to race.”

“Well, last Ah thought, ya were the one who wanted to come ‘ere,” Lilith pointed out as she reached into the basket she had next to her lounge chair, pulling out a bottle of sunscreen. “And we got ‘ere ‘bout two weeks before yer surfing contest. So, it’s a vacation, and Ah prefer ta lay right here, and maybe catch a few rays.”

“Fine, I’ll go find something else to do,” Shelli sighed before she ran off on the sand.

Lilith sat up in her seat and began to stretch her arms, “Hmm, thank ‘eavens that Ah wore my swimsuit underneath. Ah think Ah should get my tan while Ah got the chance.”

There was nothing quite like the feel of a good boardwalk, seasoned by years of sand and sand, under your bare feet. Well, except for the sand itself, of course. But the boardwalk was a close second. Shelli breathed in the smells of the beachfront. Frying fish, fresh board wax... even the fragrant aroma of the requisite fifty-something shirtless beach bums was familiar and comforting.

They say life began in the ocean, Shelli reflected. Or from an asteroid or somethin'. But that asteroid probably landed in the ocean, right? No wonder it felt like home.

There was a crowd around Meg G. Karp's Seafood Shack, but it wasn't hard for the lanky surfer chick to see over them and catch a glimpse of what was going on. It looked like some kind of eating contest, with several competitors chowing down on plates laden with crisp crustaceans and heavily-breaded molluscs. She was only mildly interested, and was about to turn away, until she spotted...

"Loupi?" Shelli raised her voice. "Hey! Loop!"

The pudgy young Psyduck looked up from the fried flounder she was devouring and grinned cheerfully. "Hey, Shelli! Are you here to compete too?"

"No! No, I'll just--'scuse me, comin' though--cheer you on from the sidelines." Shelli leaned over the rope separating the audience from the competitors. "You holdin' out okay?"

Loupi patted the stack of plates next to her proudly. "Five down... however many plates to go!"

"Well, just don't bust your guts open or anythin'. Looks like you're actually doin' pretty good. That big Sharpedo guy's way ahead of you, though. Like, by eight plates."

"Oh, that doesn't mean anything," Loupi said. "We didn't start all at once. It's an all day event, you start when you want and you have an hour to eat as much as you can. I still have like forty-five minutes to go!"

"Yeah, but he's had thirteen plates. And he's still goin'."

"So? His hour's almost up. And if I ate five plates in fifteen minutes than I can eat, ah... twenty plates by the end, right?"

Shelli raised an eyebrow. "You sure that's how it works?"

"Oh, come on!" Loupi said, stuffing another clam into her mouth. "Maybe I'm not the best math-er, but even I can do that problem! I dare you to look me in the eye and say four times five isn't twenty!"

Shelli grinned. "Tell you what, Loop. If you actually manage to eat twenty plates of food, not only will I apologize for doubting you, I'll personally pay the rental fee for the forklift we'll need to move you afterwards."

"Agreed," Loupi nodded. "Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a face to stuff."

"Good luck. Just... seriously, Loop, don't hurt yourself or anythin'. It's not worth it just for... what's the prize."

"Some surf thingy." Loupi jerked her thumb at the sign above the stage.

"Meg G. Karp's Seafood Shack presents the third annual blah blah blah..." Shelli read. "The contestant who can eat the most plates of food in an hour will win the grand prize of... of..."

Her eyes opened wide.

"A Rocket-brand Serial Blast-Off 2000? B-b-but only three of those were ever made! They're... they're legendary boards! You mean... you mean you're trying to win one of those?"

"Trying, poo. I'm doing it."

"Oh, Loop." Shelli's eyes moistened. "Sometimes you're just completely and totally awesome, you know? I've wanted an SBO 2000 ever since I was a Squirtle!"

"Cool! Maybe I'll let you ride it sometime."

Shelli's face fell. "What."

"You know, when I'm tired of it."

"Are...are you serious? You're not serious. You don't seriously mean you're going to seriously keep it for yourself."

"Well, I'm the one winning it, aren't I?"

"You... buh...wuh..." Shelli stammered. "But it's a legendary board! And you called it a 'surfing thing'. And you don't even surf!"

"I know. I'm gonna use it to iron my raincoats."

"Of all the selfish...disrespectful... ooh! I just can't believe you, you freaking hodad!" Shelli fumed, stepping over the rope.

"Hey, audience is supposed to stay behind the line," growled a Krabby with a mouthful of crab legs.

"Oh, stuff it. Isn't that cannibalism?"

"Yeah, well, your face is...is dumb-alism," the Krabby shot back. "Like a big... dumb... I'm just gonna go back to eating now."

"Good," Shelli snarled. "Anyway, I'm not an audience member. Starting now, I'm a competitor. And you can just find yourself another ironing board, missy, 'cause I'm gonna win!"
1221.title: Board of Discord

choices: Lilith's weighty mother who greets her daughter and friends with a big hug
The somewhat offputting Auntie Vanessa (a Victreebel moemon) which upsets Lilith
Her Papa! A big hearty Victreebel Moemon who spoils his baby girl rotten!
123.content:
The South. All in all, it garners a relatively negative stereotype. One that encloses sexism, miseducation, typism, and redneckary. And in some cases, yes this is very true. But to Lilith, the volumptuous Vileplume moemon, it meant something else. It meant home. For this is where she grew up; with hot summers and cold winters, with plenty of friendly people, grits and hushpuppies, and the big ol' fields she used to play in. Since then, she has blossomed from a spoiled Oddish moemon into a beautiful, mature... if not somewhat dainty Vileplume woman.

Even now, Lilith is more than excited to see these wide open fields again as she romps through them with her friends. One, Shelli, a wild and untamed surfer chick from the more hustle-and-bustle areas of Kanto, and the other, Loupi, an awkward little girl from the rurals. She loved them both dearly, especially after how long they've been travelling together. However, while the love was more than mutual, both of them weren't quite as willing to spread it right now.

"I'M STARVED." Shelli, a young Wartortle moemon, crossed her arms over a non-existant bustline. She was certainly pretty enough, but had it not been for the long stream of cloudy silver hair, most of the young gentleman around town would have mistaken her for one of themselves. "Lilith, you said we'd be there in two days. It's been a WEEK." she growled at her older companion, "We wasted all of our food money on those stupid tickets in Saffron so we could get here, and that was when I was under the impression that we would only spend a day or two out in the forest." Shelli narrowed her eyes, "Either we get there today, or I'm heading back."

"Yeah, what she said." the smaller Psyduck moemon, Loupi, agreed with her gravelly voice. She, while cute in her own right, was far from actually attracting a crowd like her two older prettier friends. For one, she was plump. Not fat, but her rearend was almost as big around as her belly. Two was her fashion sense; Lilith had lectured her countless times that "raincoats don't go with everything, hun", but to no avail. Lastly, she was just immature in general; she liked guys and everyhing, but... "So either we get some food, or I'm outie." Well, you get the picture.

"Oh but you promised!" Lilith wailed, "You two said that you would accompany me back home to the ranch so you could meet my family!" Perhaps the most obvious hint to Lilith's heritage was her very thick, very "Southern Belle" accent. Rather than the rough drawl that most southerners had, Lilith's was smooth and lovely. In fact, it was just as smooth and lovely as she was, with her elegant curves and beautiful face all wrapped up in a dark blue sunday dress that just barely touched the tall grass of her family plantation's field. "Look, girls, I really do appreciate all this, and I do believe that you'll both have a wonderful time back at my ol' ranch, so please... just a li'l bit further?" she tilted up her red bonnet to reveal quivering pale eyes...

...
...
...

"Fine." Shelli huffed, letting down her tough act slightly with a wavering smile, "I'll meet your parents and whoever else is at this family reunion, but can we just pick up the pace a little?" she rubbed her washboard abs (revealed by a tube top, in leiu of a tank top which was removed due to the head), "I mean, we haven't eaten in a few days, I think we could very well die out here if we're not careful." Loupi panted, sweating profusely, "Yeah... die..." (she had not removed her raincoat.)

Lilith chuckled cutely, "Oh don't worry 'bout dyin', the strappin' young Tauros moemon who work for Daddy are always out here in the fields." Shelli and Loupi wavered, "Wait, so your dad has..." they gulped in unison, for fear of upsetting Lilith's provenly violdent temper, "...slaves?"

"What?" the vileplume moemon laughed again, suprisingly brushing off yet another southern stereotype she had come to endure from her friends, "Oh no no, they just work for 'im... slaves, you girls are so silly." Shelli and Loui simply looked at eachother in a confused fashion, usually a quip like that would have sent the usually sweet and demure Lilith into a frenzy... "Wow, she must really like being home a lot, you didn't get slapped or yelled at or nuthin'!" Loupi pointed at Shelli, who was just as equally amazed. "Yeah... you'd figure after not eating for three days she'd be ready to punch me through a barn already..."

"Y'all comin'?" Lilith chimed, standing on a hilltop majestically. She looked lovely. Long black hair looked almost blue as the sun reflected her locks from afar, and the wind casually blew the bottom of her sundress. She looked ravishing...

"Don't tell me you girls caught a titch of the vapors?"
***
"Pant..."

"Pant..."

"Pant..."

"Oh Loupi cut that out now!" Lilith scolded her diminiative little awkward, "Mommy'll be at the door to greet me any minute!" the Psyduck moemon ducked down, "Yes ma'am." she quacked, shrinking slightly into her raincoat fearing Lilith's belated rage from earlier. "So, aren't you gonna ring the doorbell, Lilith?" Shelli asked, noticing that in her hurry to look good, her southern companion had neglected to push the pale white button on the plantation.

Speaking of which, was huge. When Lilith said "ranch", Loupi and Shelli just assumed that it was a farm out somewhere in Hicksville. But this, this old mill house was absolutely gigantic. Obviously added on at the topmost floors (due to Daddy's large fortune no doubt) with the finest wood available, all painted white. Acres upon acres of land spread out wide, as the three of them learned earlier, into an adjoining yard full of crops. It was a Down Home Delight!

"No need, Shelli." Lilith explained, "We Vileplume can detect eachother's pollen, I'm sure- oh, here's Mommy now!" she said excitedly, apparantly smelling her mother through airborn pollen.

Soon the door opened to reveal...
123.title: Down Home Delight!

choices: In the kitchen - Morgan reveals a large feast! (This is a snack!?)
The three come across another of Lilith's relatives...
Shelli and/or Loupi get lost in the large house somehow
1231.content:
For a moment, it seemed as if Lilith was exaggerating about detecting another Vileplume, and Shelli was about to bring it up until the ground seemed to quake, making Shelli and Loupi shake slightly. Lilith on the other hand was smiling so bright it would rival that of a Lunatone’s shape.

“IS THAT MY LITTLE LILITH!?!”

Both Shelli’s and Loupi’s eyes widened at the sight of what emerged from the large door from the door. Lilith seemed unfazed by the fact that a slightly taller, older and exceedingly wider version of herself emerged from the house. There was quite a difference between the two Vileplume Moemon, the fact that while Lilith had long blue-black hair, this one had short curled hair of the same color that curved around her slightly rounded face. And while she was wearing a fancier and frillier dress than Lilith, this woman’s seemed to hug her impressive curves.

“LILITH!” the older and larger Vileplume Moemon screamed in joy lifted her arms up.

“MOMMA!” Lilith cried back as she leapt into the embrace of her apparent mother.

Both Shelli and Loupi stared in amazement and somewhat surprise as their voluptuous friend was almost completely engulfed into the curves of the larger Moemon. After a rather heartwarming and slightly awkward moment, the larger Vileplume Moemon noticed the two water type Moemon on her porch. “Oh my! Little Lily, are these the dears you’ve been tellin’ me about? Shelli and Loupi?”

Being released by her mother’s impressive hug, Lilith smiled brightly at her two companions, “Yep! Momma, this is my team, Shelli and Loupi!”

“What a bunch of cute little kids!” The larger Vileplume mother cooed as she smiled at the two. “Welcome to our humble homes, dears! You can call me Momma Morgan!”

“Uh, it’s nice to meet you?” Loupi questioned as she tilted her head slightly to the side.

“Y-Yeah, likewise,” Shelli chuckled slightly as she held up her hand towards Morgan.

“Aw, that’s not how we greet friends of the family!” Morgan replied as she stepped forward.

Before Shelli and Loupi could react, they were immediately engulfed in a massive bear hug that was actually starting to turn the two water Moemons blue in the face. Lilith on the other hand was more concerned with something else, ‘Momma seems different for some reason. I wonder if she’s let herself go a little bit…’

“C-Can’t… Breathe!” Shelli wheezed out, which unfortunately fell on deaf ears.

“Me… Too…” Loupi added.

However, it wasn’t the two moemons’ cries for oxygen that finally freed them, it was the loud growls of their (and Lilith’s stomach) that actually managed to grant them their freedom from the death hug! “My! Where are my manners! You three must’ve been walking all day! Come in! Come in! I’ll fix you all a snack before dinner!”

Almost blissfully unaware of the damage her hug caused, Morgan waddled back into the house, leaving the door open. All the while, Shelli and Loupi were trying to gather her breaths while Lilith was still in her thoughts.

“Lilith… Ya didn’t tell us that your ma was so…” Shelli wheezed loudly as she stood up first. “… Friendly.”

Lilith snapped out of her trance and smiled brightly at her two friends, “Oh, come on you two. My family’s one of the friendliest around! Wasn’t my attitude any indication what my family would be like?”

Shelli chuckled slightly as she rubbed the back of her head of hair while Loupi sighed loudly and began to walk into the house. “I’m going to get something to eat.”

Loupi’s direct statement reminded both of her companions that they haven’t eaten in the same length as well. So without a word, the two followed their Psyduck Moemon into Lilith’s home.
1231.title: A BIG Reunion and Greeting

choices: Sure, a swim sounds absolutely lovely!
No, I think we'll stay inside and wait for dinner. We're absolutely famished!
12312.content:
Ten minutes later, the trio found themselves crowded around a table in the kitchen eating sandwiches and drinking sweet tea. Well, two of them were; Loupi was plowing her way through a tub of ice cream, ostensibly to "cool me down". Busy sating their long endured hunger pains, none of the girls paid any heed to the creaking of stairs or the sound of boots quickly approaching.

"Weeeell, tan mah hide an' call me a leather jacket! Lookit what tha Meowth dragged in! Long time no see, cuz! Yer lookin' fine, as always. An' who're these lil' fillies you done brought with ya?"

Sounding like a Southern Fried Stereotype, the young Ivysaur moemon had barged into the room, catching the otherwise occupied girls unawares. Dressed in a kerchief, ten gallon hat, boots, jeans, and plaid shirt, he looked the spitting image of the Hollywood cowboy. Loupi and Shelli stared at the boy, spoon and sandwich sliding out of their grasp. Lilith merely glared.

"Well, shoot, ain't ya gonna introduce us?"

"Knock off the act, 'Tex', before I knock it off for you. I swear, you're always tryin' your hardest to embarrass me in front of my friends. Loupi, Shelli, this here is my cousin, Raymond. His ma is my daddy's sister."

"Tch. You're no fun." Ray muttered, returning his cousin's glare. He quickly turned to the two young girls comprising the rest of his audience and turned charm to 'stun' "It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance. You can just call me Ray, everyone does." He extended his hand.

"Um, Shelli. Nice to meet you." Shelli took his hand tentatively and shook. "This is Loupi and... erm... she's a little busy at the moment."

Loupi had returned to her ice cream moments after Ray's outburst and seemed to be in a world of her own.

"Ah, well, that's just fine. I'll get to know her later, never you fret."

Ray sat down and helped himself to sandwich, never taking his eyes off the Psyduck moemon.

"It's hot as blazes out there. You guys wanna go fer a swim or somethin'? There's this pretty lil' swimmin' hole out yonder. We could go for a dip."

As group leader, it was supposedly up to her to decide. On the one hand, a refreshing dip sounded delightful. On the other, her cousin was quite the pervert and she wasn't exactly sure she'd like to run the risk of one of them mysteriously 'losing' an article of clothing while in the water. Plus, she was still hungry and most of the sandwiches were gone.

She made a decision.

Gender: Female
Pokemon Based off of: Bayleef

Description: A tall moemon with an increduous bust, her outfits usually consist of name brand halter tops and sarong skirts. She keeps her bangs short, framing her pretty face, and wears the rest of her long, viridian locks in a low bun at the back of her neck. She wears a leaf themed choker around her neck.

She's kind hearted hopeless romantic and has been friends with Perry since she was a Chikorita moemon. On a side note, she's the only one of her friends with any cooking talent.

Often seen with a sneaky twinkle in her eye and something that isn't hers in her hands, she has gotten her friends in more than their share of trouble. 132.content:
Olivine City – Home to the Glitter Lighthouse and the rare Steel-Type gym that brought many Moemon Teams to the city. But the normally quiet streets of the coastal town were filled with tourists from almost anywhere thanks to the Annual Lighthouse Festival, moemon of all shapes and sizes walked the streets, viewing the vendors, enjoying the cuisine, and overall just enjoying the festivities.

“My, this is a rather strange festival…”

Standing off to the side of the large crowds was a tall girl with viridian colored hair that framed her face and was tied in a bun around her neck. The girl seemed to have an air about her, wearing a fancy halter top and a sarong skirt with a leaf themed choker around her neck…

… Which for some reason was drawing a lot of attention from some male moemon who walked by her. “And the locals seem somewhat strange as well.”

Unfortunately, her assumption for their stares was wrong, the sights were actually shot towards her incredible bust, which was amazing since the rest of her body was sculpted rather well. But enough of that.

This was Lynn, a Bayleef Moemon who was in a group of traveling Moemon, and at the moment she was kind of in a rut. The reason being was that when her group had arrived at Olivine City, her two comrades had run off into the crowds, completely excited for the group to reach the festival on opening day.

Lynn on the other hand, wasn’t as enthusiastic as her comrades – April and Perry – Mainly because the city was celebrating a lighthouse. “I suppose I should try to find those two… We still need to find a place to stay for the evening.”
132.title: Beachside Cuisine!

choices: Lynn heads to the House of Kamakiri... Neither of her friends are there though
One of Lynn's friends is there!
Other?
1322.content:
“I suppose I should find those two,” Lynn sighed as she looked at the rushing crowds of moemon walking in front of her. For a moment the Bayleef Moemon hesitated since there so many people walking in front of her, Lynn thought that she would just get pushed to the side.

Then again, the more time she spent just standing there thinking, the better chance that both of her friends would be getting more lost in the crowds. Lynn had to do something and…

“Excuse me, miss?”

Lynn blinked a few times when she turned to the side, seeing that someone was standing right next to her, a young man with spiked back, lime colored hair that displayed his sharp face. The young man didn’t seem too much younger than Lynn herself (maybe a year or two) and was quite sleek. He was dressed in a tan shirt, a dark green vest, matching pants and seemed to have a white scarf draped around his neck. What seemed to catch Lynn’s eyes were the weird arm bands he had on that looked to have dull blades attached to them, and he was carrying a pile of large fliers in his hands.

Lynn smiled at the young man, “Yes? Can I help you?”

“Ya better believe ya can!” the young man chuckled with a toothy grin as he held up one of the fliers. “The name’s Eiji and I’m part of one of the events here at the festival, so I’m advertising one of the events here at the Lighthouse Festival. Check us out if ya got the time, miss!”

A little curious, Lynn gracefully took one of the fliers from Eiji’s hands and read the paper in her head, ‘Foods of the World – All you can eat during the Lighthouse Festival. Location – House of Kamakiri.’

“We’re trying out a new menu at the restaurant,” Eiji explained rubbing the bridge of his nose. “And we want the customers to choose what foods we’ll be serving.”

“My, it sounds… Interesting,” Lynn answered back. “But I really should find my friends soon and…”

“They could be there, miss,” Eiji replied with a wag of his finger. “After all, this is a popular event here in town, and it’s a cheap meal for everyone to enjoy! Who wouldn’t pass it up? I’m sure if ya go there, ya’ll be able to find yer friends in a snap!”

“Well, thanks,” Lynn answered before Eiji jumped into the crowd of people, tossing more of his fliers into the air. “Foods of the world? I don’t know…”
1322.title: Foods of the World!

choices: Oh sure it was! Lynn enjoys herself at Kamakiri House and meets the regulars!
Actually, before she can even THINK about having a good time, Eiji serves her...
13221.content:
Deciding against standing out in the open, exposed to the elements and the rowdy festival goers, Lynn opted to follow Eiji back to his marvelous cookhouse. Truth be told, it had been a while since the elegant Bayleef moemon could just sit bak and enjoy a meal to herself, having to cook for Perry and April was a really stressful job and didn't provide much thanks. So why not indulge a little for once, she never got to do anything really for herself! And as the young Scyther moemon pointed out earlier, there was always the possibility that one of her friends wandered into the House of Kamakiri in hopes of something to eat. However, putting that all aside, Lynn's rumbling tummy seemed to guide her to the strange oriental smells coming from the east.

A small booth was crudely erected in front of a small rentable station, not really much to look at but a smorgasborg to smell for. The familiar smells of rice, fish, shrimp sauce and mushrooms filled the air and wafted into Lynn's nostrils. They were all things that Lynn had cooked for her friends at some point and thusly smells that were fairly familiar to her in all aspects, only combined in entirely new ways! As politely as possible, the timid though buxom young moemon nudged her way through the roaring crowds to get a closer look, noticing that she had lost Eiji's trail sometime while navigating through the mosh pit of eager eaters. Finally, she had made it to the front of the mosh... and her big brown eyes nearly bulged out of their pretty little sockets when she saw just how loaded that fille of fish was!

And not just the fille; kalkarash dipped in teriyaki, something that resembled Huntail pie with barbecue sauce, some sort of exotic fish cut open to reveal a flowing inside of rice sauce and possibly vinegar, down to the simplest meals like hamburgers hot dogs and ruben sandwiches! The spread was compelling, and like she said before Lynn was trying to do something for herself for once... she felt her hands shake as she reached out for a sample when a hand grabs her by the shoulder.

"Oh hey there!" Eiji's sharp voice startled the unsuspecting moemon. "O-Oh my!!" she yelped, spinning around to face the wiry man, "Y-You startled me, Eiji!" Lynn giggled as she put a hand over her breast. Somehow, Eiji managed to avert his eyes from Lynn's hooters long enough to avoid suspicion (of course, Lynn was never the finger-pointing type anyway) "So my fair lady, I can assume you'll be sampling our wares today?" he weasled his way into it, Eiji had obviously been doing this for a while and knew his way around a customer. Lynn smiled and turned her attention back to the stand, once again mobbed with greedy hands, "Oh yes, but I think I might just start off with a sandwich." she said politely, "I-I'm not too sure I could even pronounce some of the other items."

"No problem!" Eiji said, closing his eyes with that wide grin of his, "That's how all our regulars start off, Hoenn items are very popular here- but really tricky to say." his thin hands wrapped around her wrist, "You see over there, I think that's called googlemesh and eh, I'm not even sure... oh yeah, that's Huntail Kidney pie, big around this time of year actually... not so much with the jellyfish crowd we get this time of year though."

And was Eiji's idea of a tour; pretty much him talking and talking non-stop about what food was being served, a little bit about himself and the resteraunt, it was all a little awkward for the sheltered Lynn. Normally people were never so forward with her, going to far as to just grab her hand without taking consideration, slowly leading her back to the main House of Kamakiri and away from the stand- still bursting to the brim with crazed partiers. However, it seemed that Eiji was pretty dead-on about getting her that sandwhich, almost like he was mad for a sale! Like he would do anything just to get her to eat there! That was almost as scary as the crowd...

Lynn gulped, her golden leaf choker catching her throat slightly. Maybe spoiling herself a little wasn't the right idea after all...
13221.title: Lynn's Adventures in Mosh

choices: A few minutes later, Clover reappears with a large plate of food!
Lynn talks to another (chubby) customer...
132211.content:
True to his word, Eiji had brought Lynn over to the House of Kamakiri – And at the sight of it, the nervous feeling she had in her mind had disappeared. Like the rest of Jhoto, the restaurant itself was styled in a Japanese style, designed to resemble that of a large, yet cozy Japanese teahouse. The restaurant even went so far as to have the waitresses dress up in several cute and colorful kimonos (although, all of them were colored in several different shades of green).

Then there was the wondrous smells that hit Lynn’s nose, instantly making her mouth water…

“Here we are!” Eiji announced, snapping Lynn out of her daze, realizing that he was standing in front of an emptied table (how there was an emptied table in the almost jam packed restaurant). “I’d like to serve ya, Lynn, but I gotta get back to the kitchen. So, I’ll get one of the waitresses to get your orders.”

Lynn would be lying if she said she wasn’t a little relieved by Eiji leaving her to the table, but still, the smells that lofted through the air were messing with the busty Bayleef moemon’s head. Slowly, she sat down, enjoying the smells and obvious atmosphere of the House of Kamakiri…

“Welcome!”

Lynn blinked a few times when she realized that a small glass of water was set in front of her. She turned to her right to see that one of the waitresses standing right next to her table. The waitress had a cute, cherubic face that was topped with curly white hair that flowed over her bright skin (her skin could be on par with porcelain with color wise) and she had rosy cheeks. Lynn wondered when this waitress appeared next to her, mainly because it was kinda hard to miss this waitress however, with a large green kimono stretched over her heavy set frame, hugging her curvy body. Aside from the bulging belly, thunderous thighs and slightly ponderous breasts (although they weren’t as big as Lynn’s), Lynn guessed that she was a Flaaffy Moemon, albeit a bit bigger than the usual ones that Lynn saw on her travels. “Welcome to the House of Kamakiri, I’m Clover and I’ll be waiting on you today.”

“Oh, hello,” Lynn replied with a slightly nervous smile. This waitress seemed to have energy that could rival Eiji’s energy, but at least she seemed to be a bit more in control of it.

“Do you know what you want to order?” Clover asked holding up a pad of paper and pen.

“Um, well,” Lynn was about to say that she didn’t even get a menu to look at…

“Oh, right!” Clover chuckled as she smiled brightly at Lynn. “Eiji told me a few seconds ago that you’d be interested in trying some exotic foods. Let me tell ya, I used to be a regular customer here, everything is excellent!”

The smile on Clover’s face was enough to make the nervousness that was welling up in Lynn’s stomach melt away into what it originally was – Hunger and curiosity. “Alright, well, then how about you bring me something that you thought was the best dish here?”

“One special coming right up!” Clover announced brightly.
132211.title: Current Worker, Former Customer

choices: Later, Eiji comes by to see how his newest customer is holding up!
Much, MUCH later, April and Perry finally find Lynn. Stuffed to the gills.
1322111.content:
Clover smiled brightly one last time before turning away from her new viridian haired customer, as she did so Lynn's eyes couldn't help but travel to the enormous lumps that jutted out from underneath her kimono, making up her backside. Lynn giggled, trying her best to avoid staring and hold her tounge. She was always good at that, being polite and reserved. If Perry or April were here they might have said something to upset that poor waitress. "In the long run," Lynn said to herself, "It's probably good that I got to do this for myself!" she said warilly, picking up the glass of chilled water that Clover had delivered.

And so she sat there for a while, just taking in the sights and smells that the House of Kamakiri had to offer. Just like Eiji had promised, almost everything there looked foreign. From the simplistic dishes of Kanto- mostly hamburgers, hot dogs, and things of the like- to the crazy concoctions that hailed from Hoenn; things like Mieliepap and Dakar. Of course it would be ridiculous to claim that Lynn even knew about those latter dishes, being the somewhat sheltered and naive girl that she was, all she knew was that the food here was exotic and new. Something that, in a way, frightened her. What if she was allergic to the recipies that Eiji used? What if she caught one of those diseases she heard about on the news that foreigners caught in Hoenn? Like her face swelling up to the size of a basketball?! That'd be terrible!! "Okay, okay, just c-calm down Lynn." she said to herself, trying as hard as she could to keep her hand steady around the sweating glass, "E-Eiji seems like he knows what he's doing, so you should be fine... oh no, but what if he's not the one cooking?!" Lynn inadvertantly started to panic, millions of terrible thoughts swarming into her head all at once. All of which ended with her leaving with some sort of strange disease or mutation about her.

She was so enravelled in her own paranoia that she didn't notice the strange looks that her fellow customers had started giving her. She was jittery and drinking a lot of that water, struggling to remain mannerful in her hysteria and choke down those awful thoughts. Suddenly, she heard a loud 'CLACK', causing her to jump up and let out a small yelp. The Bayleef moemon was pretty embarrassed when she saw that it was only Clover, who had come to deliver her food in a timely manner. "O-Oh, I'm so so sorry!" Lynn gushed, turning an intense red, "I-I guess I just... a-are you sure this food is safe?" she squeaked, lowering her head in shame of asking such a personal and offensive question. The cotton-haired moemon raised an eyebrow, a concerned look on her face, "Sweetie, the food's just fine here- we have excellent Health Inspection reports." she said just as quietly, patting Lynn on her tiny shoulder, "Now eat up, I think you'll really like this."

What Clover had brought her, while foreign and strange, looked very delectable. The main course, a somewhat comforting sight, was some sort of meat stew. In the large bowl, Lynn could clearly see two uncut, ripe tomatoes on the sides being marinated by the oily stew and the meat floating inside. To the side of her bowl, there were some fried Pecha Berries (a delicacy in Hoenn that never seemed to travel to the KanJohto continent). And lastly, possibly the side item, was a simple familiar dish of fried rice; something that Lynn had cooked many a time for herself, April, and Perry. All in all, this food wasn't actually too unfamiliar to her- like before, it was just cooked in a different way. {i"Maybe I shouldn't get so worked up..." Lynn said to herself, stirring the soup slowly with her spoon, "I mean, they use the same ingredients I do... so why not give it a little try?" Her eyes travelled over to the dimpled smile of her Flaafy waitress, awaiting her customer to take her first spoonful of Moambé. Deciding to be grown-up and mature about this whole 'culture-shock' thing, Lynn decided to hold her nose and give it a try...

Cold spoon...
In the soup...
Lift...
Wrapping her soft lips around it...
Swallow...

...silence...

Suddenly, after maybe only five seconds after swallowing her confection, Lynn's eyes nearly bulged out of their sockets from the intense spicyness that travelled back up her throat and settled on her tongue. She let out a raspy gasp for air, chugging what was left of her water and still stumbling around the table to find something else. While Lynn struggled, closing her eyes in the intense pain, Clover only giggled, "Yep, that was my response too, it must be the Tomato Berries Eiji uses." she said cheerfully. However, she stopped laughing once Lynn stuffed her mouth full of rice to absorb the spices, choking down the lumpy side dish. "There, feel better now?" Clover asked innocently, "I take it you don't like the spicy stuff too much, I'll just take it back and get you ano-"

"No way!" Lynn said ecstatically, spooning more and more Moambé stew down her throat, "I love this!" Clover laughed, she had never quite growing accustomed to the spicyness herself and therefore just a little bit surprised. "Well alright then!" she said merrilly, "I'm glad you like it, if you need anything else, be sure to call me, we're pretty busy today so I've gotta apologize in advance."

Lynn wasn't paying any attention to the needless ramblings of her waitress. This food was AWESOME, so new, so different; the only food she'd ever eaten that made her throat hurt! It was all just so new to her... and even better with rice!

"Um... can I have some more... please?"
1322111.title: "Um... can I have some more... please?"

choices: April and Perry decide to test the food as well... Allowing Lynn to keep eating
Maybe we should check the rest of the festival, get Lynn outta here...
13221112.content:
A few hours since Lynn’s first order…

Outside the House of Kamakiri, two particular girls stood outside the restaurant – One was an average figured girl with short blue hair that swept the left side of her face with a sleeveless top and cutoff jeans that showed her average figure. At the moment she was tapping her foot against the pavement a few times while looking down at her companion, “April, sometimes I wonder if you can even control that devilish mind of yours…”

The other girl that stood outside the restaurant could almost be mistaken for a tween girl, mostly thanks to the large brown eyes, a baby face, and looked to be as flat as an ironing board. Over that skinny body of hers was a small purple and white colored hoodie that had the hood covering her light purple colored hair and had skinny jeans that showed off her petite and skinny figure. And as she was addressed, the young girl known as April shook her head with a sneaky smirk, “Don’t act like it’s my fault Perry. You were the one who had to look at those King’s Rock charms…”

“It was only for comparison!” Perry defended as she lifted her right wrist up, revealing a crown shaped rock that was around her wrist. “Besides, my King’s Rock is always going to be the best! And don’t change the subject, we gotta find Lynn!”

“What do I look like?” April questioned with a roll of her eyes. “Lynn’s keeper? She’s older than me, I think she could take care of herself.”

“That doesn’t mean we can just leave her behind,” Perry retorted with her arms crossed. “We’re a team and a team doesn’t leave anyone behind! Besides, as the leader, I have a responsibility to know where each member of the team is and…”

“Please don’t give me this speech again,” April sighed as she walked near the opened entrance of the House of Kamakiri. “Look, I’m starving, can we at least get something to eat before we find her?”

“You’re just asking for the same speech again,” Perry huffed. “Until we find Lynn, we can’t eat. So, as soon as we find Lynn, we can eat…”

“Found her,” April replied as she pointed towards the inside of the restaurant.

Perry peered into the restaurant, and with her eyes widening, indeed inside the restaurant was their Bayleef Moemon friend – Lynn, seated at one of the tables that had several empty plates and bowls stacked up on the table. And there was Lynn herself, with a pair of chopsticks in her hand as she slurped up a large amount of noodles.

“… Holy hell, did Lynn eat all of that?” April questioned as she stepped into the restaurant… Only to have Perry run in front of here.

“Ah! Lynn! There you are!” Perry laughed as she ran up to Lynn’s side, unaware that Lynn was more preoccupied with her current dish. “I see you’re sampling the cuisine with gusto!”

‘More like with gluttony,’ April thought to herself as she eyed all of the empty plates and bowls, and watched as the latest one was placed on the top of them all.

“Oh… Perry, April,” Lynn groaned as she lowered her arms to her stomach (which was now pooching out from under her halter and over her skirt, bulging out greatly). “G-Great to see you… You have to try the food here. I-I haven’t even gotten past the first page of the menu…

“Everything is… AWESOME…”
13221112.title: The rest of the crew...

choices: The next morning and having calmed down, Lynn insists on breakfast at Kamakiri!
Pretty soon, April and Perry find their own vices at the fair...
132211122.content:
"Come on Lynn!" April grunted, pulling with all her might at the bloated Bayleef moemon's hand, "Aren't you full yet?!" The poor diminiative girl was overpowered swiftly however, generally due to her lack of stature and strength when compared to Lynn's superior build. "Mmph, but everything here is so good!" the elegant moemon cheered through a free sample of fried dough, "Why didn't anyone tell me that festivals were so much FUN?!" And comically, she continued in the opposite direction as April was dragged reluctantly by the hand along with her. "CUT IT OUT!!" April groaned

Perry, a good five or six feet in front of the rest of her party, stopped and turned to face them; "Come on April, let Lynn let her hair down a bit?" she shouted over the crowd, "I haven't seen her this excited since the festival in Cherrywood!"

"ARE YOU NUTS?!" April shouted back, making no headwind in her drive to snap Lynn back to reality, "If we let her go, she'll never come back!" the smaller moemon whipped back to face her grass-type companion, "Probably because she'll still be EATING- PUT THAT DOWN, I'M NOT PAYIN' FOR THAT!!" she barked, slapping the toothpick of crawdaunt meat from Lynn's pinched fingers. "Oh you're no fun April!" Lynn slurred, her usually sensible and rational side overshadowed by her latent need to party. The Aipom moemon could only grumble, usually these roles were reversed- she didn't quite appreciate the irony of the situation. "Look you big-tittied freak, we can't keep paying for stuff like this!"

But Lynn was too far gone; lost in the sights, smells, sounds, and mostly tastes of the Glitter Lighthouse Festival! Unaffected, the buxom moemon went from booth to booth participating in whatever they had to offer no matter what it may be. From the Steel Yakuza group who ran the wind up Goldeen catching competition, where a large number of buff muscle men let Lynn partake in many many free tries due to her wonderful "personality" (if a CC cup size counted as a personality) to the booth of highschool kids who were trying to raise money for their school with a bake sale, pretty pointless when all the guys gave Lynn free donut holes (again, wonderful wonderful personality) and all stops inbetween. She won a stuffed Urasing in the bottle tossing competition, a free ticket to the Stardust bakery run by a nice little family of Clefairy evolutions, an inflatable katana, and a shirt that said something vulgar. She was having a blast, and it was only the first row!

"Um, okay I think I'll give it a shot!" Lynn said eagerly, handing a slick-looking Beedrill moemon a few crumbled up bills from the bottom of her purse. He agreed eagerly and handed over two of the largest order of shishkabob on his menu. "Enjoy little lady!" he said eagerly, "How's that folks, two of my biggest orders gone, all to that pretty lady over there- can't keep this up all day, come get it while it's hot!" Immediately, Lynn started to tear off little bits of meat and mushroom from her stick with fervor, "Mmm, dish ish rully good!" she said, cheeks swelling with masticated meat mush. "What hasn't been very good today Lynn?" April asked sarcastically. Never one to quite understand sarcasm, the Bayleef moemon actually took a second to consider the question. "Huh, it's all been pretty tasty!" she said in a rather airheaded fashion, "Ooh- skiball!"

April groaned, having long given up hope of snapping Lynn out of this unfamiliar party animal state. "You could at least buy me something if you're not gonna let me take anything!" she grumbled. Lynn cooed, "Aww... here, you can have my extra share of shishkabob!" she said sweetly, handing over the spear and all of its contents to her simian-based compadre. "Thaaanks." April said, grimmacing at the grease dripping off of the dish, "Maybe something that won't kill me next time?" However, as predicted, Lynn had surrendered to her ambitions yet again and had stepped over to the skiball booth. "Why does no one listen to the short girl?!" April lamented, trudging along disdainfully while taking a bite from her 'reward'.

However, as April got closer to the booth, now that the crowd was dying down a bit, she heard something that sounded particularly promising towards getting Lynn home; "Oh I'm so sorry Mister, I-I seem to have spent all my money..." she said apologetically. 'YES!!!' April pumped her fist triumphantly, letting the shishkabob fall to the ground in light of going home. "Well that's alright, come back again some time- I'll be here all week!" the forgiving Remoraid moemon said, sending a shiver down April's spine and a twinkle into Lynn's eyes. "All week?!" they both said simultaniously, one with much less enthusiasm than the other. "Yes ma'am, the Glitter Lighthouse Festival is a week-long event! You must be tourists!"

And with that things started to cool down a bit. Now that Lynn didn't have any money to blow, she only partook in the free events, which were scarce. But that didn't stop her from watching with the same anxious look in her eyes. But still, now that she had simmered down, Lynn's freakishly distended stomach was starting to get to her. "Ooh..." she cried an hour or two after her money puddle had shrivelled up, "I'm so tired..."

"WELL IT'S ABOUT DAMN TIME!!" April shouted, "LET'S FIND PERRY AND GET OUTTA HERE!!"

"No need!" Perry's familiar voice called from behind the two, "Have fun while I was gone?" Lynn smiled widely despite the pain in her over taut gullet, "Perry!" she said enthusiastically, "Did you have fun at the festival?" April however was less than pleased with her tomboyish partner, "YOU LEFT ME ALONE WITH HER FOR FOUR HOURS!!" she shouted, "I THOUGHT SHE WAS GOING TO SELL ME FOR A ROUND OF DARTS!!" Perry seemed to ignore April's cries in lieu of Lynn's condition, "Partied out Lynn?" she asked, "Jeez, probably a good thing too, by the looks of you if you'd kept this up you'd be as big as a house!" she chuckled, patting Lynn's distended stomach.

"Oh... not funny Perry..." Lynn moaned

"Ah come on Kid, let's get you back to the Moemon Center."
132211122.title: Lynn's Wild Side

choices: Several rounds later... Noir's break comes, and he talks to a sugar high April
Let's follow Lynn and Perry as they get to the House of Kamakiri
1322111222.content:
The summer nights were definitely a blessing, and yet they were short enough for people to get the most out of their days. And April wasn’t one to pass that up, especially since she was taking some of the team’s funds in order for her to actually get her own chance at the festival. After Lynn’s food induced fun spree, the group had returned to Moemon Center in order to sleep indoors for free, but of course, that didn’t mean that the group had instantly hit the hay…

… After all, Lynn was insisting that the group should start the next day at the House of Kamakiri in order to get some good breakfast food. But April knew that if all three of them did go to the weird restaurant, then the day would probably be just a repeat of the events of the previous night.

“Not going to happen,” April muttered as she left a note with the large remainder of money that the team had.

April figured that at the very least that if Perry was with Lynn, then they could just lessen the damage and make sure that Lynn didn’t go too far with this weird out of character binge (both in the food and fun sense).

So, that allowed April a chance to really enjoy the Lighthouse Festival… on her own terms at the very least.

-------


Unfortunately for April, during the morning where the sun was just starting to shine, most of the booths were still setting up for the day, so that meant that she was just stuck walking around. Even the local shops wouldn’t open for a few more hours in celebration to the festival…

“Gah!” April hissed as she stuck her hands in her hood’s pockets out of frustration. “If I had known that these things weren’t open, I would’ve just gone to the beach for a few hours!”

Indeed, it was a rather quiet morning (save for the crashing waves and the sounds of pounding hammers and other noises), which was dull… Which in April’s opinion was one of the worst things to deal with (it was just below with dealing with her teammates’ shenanigans and getting caught for some petty crimes).

“We should’ve just continued to the next town,” April growled as she continued her trek. “The Gym Leader isn’t even here right now, so we’re just dealing with this and… Wait, that stand! It’s open!”

Finally!

Something to end the boring morning, and April quickly dashed over to the stand, which seemed to be an old fashioned balloon popping stand with a single young man working it. But it wasn’t the type of game that had attracted her, it was the fact that all the prizes seemed to be novelty sizes of various sugary sweets. A tinkle appeared in her eyes when April skidded to a halt in front of the booth, licking her lips in anticipation.

This didn’t go unnoticed by the booth’s worker, blinking his dark eyes at the Aipom Moemon – And although April didn’t really pay attention towards him, she would’ve noticed the fact that he was actually quite handsome with finely combed back black hair that was pulled back into two long tails that had yellow rings holding them back. His slim figure was covered with a black vest, a white short sleeved shirt and black jeans and they did a good job of showing his physique. The Umbreon Moemon smiled at the sight of April, “Ah, my first customer of the day! And how are you today miss?”

“Fine! Just give me the darts!” April asked holding up some cash towards the Umbreon Moemon.

The young man merely shook his head, “No need to pay, little miss, since you’re my first customer, I’m giving you a free round.”

The young man lifted up three darts and held them up to April who quickly snatched them up…

-Three popped balloons later…-

“Winner!” The Umbreon Moemon announced as April jumped a few times in victory. “Choose your…”

“The jumbo bag of cotton candy!” April quickly selected as the Umbreon Moemon quickly pulled the selected prize down from the post. “Yes! Sweets!”

The young Umbreon chuckled as he crossed his arms, “Heh, you remind me of my little sis – Kay, she’s always full of energy and loves sweets. Care for a second round?”

At the moment though, April was already tearing into the bag of cotton candy – Nothing like blue, artificial sugar as an excellent breakfast to provide energy for the rest of the day. And it wasn’t until she emptied the contents that the bag that she realized that the Umbreon Moemon was waving towards her.

“Hello? Miss?” The Umbreon Moemon questioned blinking a few times. “Are you okay?”

With a small cough, April recomposed herself, although there was a small twinge of red on her face, “Uh, yeah, I just like sweets is all.”

The Umbreon could only chuckle again, “And that reminds me of my sister Fontina. Anyway, care for a second round, miss?”

“Please stop calling me miss,” April sighed as she held up some of the currency of Jhoto. “I have a name and it’s April.”

‘And there’s Pamela’s personality,’ The Umbreon thought to himself as he took the money. “Very well, April, feel free to call me Noir, after all, that’s the name written on my name tag here.”

Noir pointed towards the silver tag clipped on his vest, a large smile on his face.

“Is it supposed to be upside down?” April questioned as she began to take aim at the balloons.
1322111222.title: April's One Weakness...

choices: Meanwhile, Lynn and Perry are checking out the House of Kamakiri...
Perry finds something tempting of her own...
13221112221.content:
POP! POP! POP!

"And there goes three more balloons, making it an even seventeen rounds Tough Guy!" April cheered through her namesake's grin. Noir, far less amused with this than he had been when it all started, could only sigh, "April... seventeen's an odd number." he lamented, holding his head up with a gloved hand. He pushed his hair back, blocking the vision of his tiny financial undertaker with the underside of his forearm as he leaned on the counter depressingly. "Whatever, just gimme my candy." the tiny hustler said as he held out a sticky palm.

For nearly two hours now, April had reduced more and more of Noir's balloons to tatters as she worked her way down the board in a linear fashion. First she popped the first three, then the next, all while keeping a perfectly straight line and not missing a single shot. The prize rack, once riddled with sugar and artificial flavoring, had only a few more clear bags of cotton candy; the Jumbo sizes being the first to go. Of course by this time the fair crowd was starting to emerge from their hotel rooms and shuffle out for another day of partying, but that didn't really seem to matter much to either of them. April was just getting started...

Eating, that is. Seventeen rounds of cotton candy had left her with enough sugar to feed the average family of four. But anyone who knew April well enough could tell you that she was definitely not average, and if there were three other moemon around to grab at her candy they wouldn't get a single hair. She plopped the biggest of her remaining bags onto the sandy ground and unwound twist tie at the top, rolling up her sleeve with her now-free throwing arm and shoved her designated shovelling arm into the bag, emerging with an entire fist full of green sugary ambrosia. "YUM." she said in a husky voice before opening her mouth and emptying the entirity into her gaping maw. Her cheeks bulged with the high-sugar delicacy, their swelling dying down as it melted and dripped down her throat.

At first Noir, as well as any other onlookers who may have glanced over at the sharp popping noises, was shocked to see such a small girl put away all that sugar in such a timely and inefficient manner. But of course, "at first" was about two hours ago. Now he was only wishing that she would either miss at least one balloon and lose eligibility to choose the jumbo prizes, or at least not devour the cotton candy he had put his sweat blood and tears into making in front of him like an animal.

"Should you really be eating all that sugar?" Noir said coldly, "It can't be good for your metabolism... it might even stunt your growth."

April, too jacked up on glucose to think straight (and who wasn't too fond of short jokes to begin with), smiled wickedly at the Balloon Stall Guy. "Oh and what's that supposed to mean?" she said sharply, releasing the mutilated bag of sugar and letting it fall over dead to the ground, "Maybe if you worked a little harder at your job, actually getting out of your booth every now and then, you wouldn't be so PALE, you could get a DATE, have a GIRLFRIEND, eventually get a LIFE!!" the simian moemon growled as she grew closer and closer to the still barely composed Noir. "Are you saying I'm unattractive?" Noir asked as he glared down at the loudmouthed moemon before him

"What self respecting moemon lets herself get picked up by some pale guy AT THE BEACH?"

"That's it!!" Noir raised his voice, shooting up like a bullet and declaring his rage with balled fists on the counter, "I AM TOO ATTRACTIVE!!" he shouted, April not shaken in the least by his outburst. "Nuh-uh!" she refuted childishly, "You're pale, lanky, and awkward, and you know what?" she reached back for her recently mauled bag of sweets, "Your cotton candy ishn't eben dat GOOD!" she spat through sugar. "THEN STOP EATING IT AND TAKING ALL MY BUSINESS!!" he hollered.

"Noir?" a foreign voice interrupted the childish feuding between the two, "What's going on?" It belonged to an Espeon moemon off to the right. She was dressed in a pink sun dress, the sort of thing that was meant for the more conservative way to visit a beach, and had her pink hair let down to her back. But above all, the thing that stood out most about this moemon was her weight. For such an elegant, lithe subspecies that the Espeons seemed to be, this one seemed almost -dare we say- too fat to live up to that connotation. While certainly pretty-faced, she was by and large (emphasis on large) one of the biggest moemon April had ever seen... except for maybe that waitress at that restaurant Lynn yammered on and on about. Her swelled forward from underneath her plain lavender sun dress, making a dome of purple that bounced and wobbled along with the rest of her as she slowly made her way over to the balloon stand.

"You know this jagoff?" April asked venomously, "Seriously?"

"She's my sister!!" Noir bellowed

"Y-Yes I am... now, back to my question, what's going on here?" she was of course referring to the fighting, and why a large majority of cotton candy had been given to the smallest customer ever. "Noir, is there some kind of problem?"

The jet-black moemon groaned, "No... no problem, Pamela..." he said defeatedly. There was no way he was going to admit that he had lost his head over a silly little insult to his dear sweet sister. "Everything's cool, April was just whooping our little balloon stand's figurative tail." The hyperactive munchkin's flat chest swelled with pride. "You bet, haven't missed a single one yet!" she grabbed at her cotton candy prizes gleefully, "And I made off with a good portion of your stash too!"

Pamela let out a squeak. "Y-You what?!" she turned to Noir, "NO ONE'S GOING TO COME TO A STAND WITH NO JUMBO PRIZES, HOW DO YOU EXPECT ME TO PAY OFF MY STUDENT LOANS WITH NO CUSTOMERS!!"

"Whatever, not my problem~" April said nefariously as she swung a string of her cotton candy bounty of her shoulder, munching on a handful as she walked away...

Victorious... it just made the sugar high seem so much sweeter.

Celadon City, a city both rich in culture, money and nature – Known for its beautiful atmosphere and beautiful women. Truly it was a calming city where anyone who just wanted to relax could sit back, enjoy a nice warm day, and not have any worries or problems…

“WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU SPENT ALL OF OUR MONEY?!”

… Scratch that last statement please…

Standing outside the local hotel was a trio of Moemon, one of whom was yelling her brains out one of the others. “Megan! That was all of our money! And you just spent it on clothes!”

The one who was yelling was an elegant and rather curvaceous young Moemon with creamy white skin with forest green hair that was combed down the left side of her beautiful face. In an attempt to cover her curvy body, this Gardevoir Moemon wore a green turtle-neck sweater with a long flowing white skirt.

She had long sandy-blonde hair that was tied into two long tails that ran past her trim waste, “No need to blow a gasket Greta, its not like I spent all of the money on my self, I was considerate enough to get Suzie a few snacks…”

“That’s another thing!” Greta groaned with a slap to her forehead. “We can’t spend our precious money on candy either!”

The Suzie that the two were discussing was sitting on a nearby bench, merely munching on some of the candy that Megan had purchased her. Suzie (her real name was Suzanna, but she preferred Suzie to that any day) was a slightly pudgy Clefairy Moemon, with cute face that would garner anyone’s attention way from her chubby, pear shaped frame that was covered with a frilly bright pink dress that matched her pink fluffy, yet curly locks of hair.

“You’re acting like we can’t just get any more money,” Megan sighed with a wave of her arm, which had several clothing store bags, evidence from her shopping spree. “But don’t worry about it, I’ve got another way for us to get some cash.”

From out of the bag, Megan fished out what appeared to be a small flier that had three ‘7’s on it. “The Game Corner’s hiring! They pay well and the tips alone by working there ought to be enough to pay for those expenses you’re always griping on about.”

Greta sighed loudly, “There’s no way we’re going to work at a place like that. We can find other jobs in a city this big.”

One hour later…

At the Game Corner’s head office, a familiar trio sat in the lobby, waiting…

“I can’t believe we couldn’t find any other jobs in this city,” Greta moaned loudly as she hung her head in defeat.

“Aw quit complaining,” Megan replied. “You said we needed to work, and this is the best way for us to get some green fast. They even have positions for people who are over fifteen years old, so that means that Suzie can actually help out with the team for once.”

“Suzie doesn’t wanna work!” Suzie huffed with her cheeks puffed out.

“We all have to work,” Greta scolded with a dull look on her face. “And sometimes, doing work means that you have to do things you don’t want to do. And thanks to you two, we all have to work just to be able to live and…”

“Excuse me,” a soft voice stated.

Standing in the doorway to the main office was rather mousy looking woman with short purple hair, large rimmed glasses and dressed in a violet business suit, in her hands was a clipboard. It was easy to see that this woman was a Ratatta Moemon, mainly because when she spoke, she showed off the small buck teeth she had in her mouth. That didn’t derail the fact that she had a cute face. “Mister Sunny will see you three now.”

“Alright, remember you two,” Greta reminded as the three Moemon stood up from their seats. “We need these jobs, so please be courteous and nice to the guy. We want to be hired so…”

“Please, with my looks, I’m sure I’ll get a job,” Megan answered as she entered the head office first, followed by a slightly annoyed Greta and a pouting Suzie.

When all three entered the office, they all saw the mysterious Mister Sunny sitting behind his desk, his bright red suit immediately drawing their attention to his sleek body frame. His face was rather rugged with dark blonde peach fuzz on his face and bright blonde hair that was styled back, he was a Ninetails Moemon, “My, my, my, Roxanne was right. We finally have our employees that we needed, and exact numbers too!”

Jumping from his desk, Mr. Sunny ran up to Greta first and began shaking her hand, “Greta if I’m correct? It is a pleasure to meet ya!”

“Uh, yes, you too?” Greta muttered out loud.

And just like that, Mr. Sunny turned his attention towards Megan and bowed slightly, “And if I read the paperwork correctly, you must be Megan?”

“Yep, and a gal could get used to that,” Megan replied before Mr. Sunny knelt down slightly so he could look Suzie in the eyes.

“And you’re Suzanne?” Mr. Sunny asked.

“Suzie likes to be called Suzie!” Suzie corrected.

“That’s fair!” Mr. Sunny laughed as he spun around and began to walk to his desk. When he reached his desk, Mr. Sunny spun around and sat on it. “So, nice to meet you all, I’m Kit Sunny, but you can call me Mr. Sunny or Sunny, of boss, or handsome, or whatever compliments you can think of.”

“This guy’s a little over the top,” Megan muttered under her breath.

“Anyway, let’s cut to the chase,” Sunny sighed with a look of worry on his face. “We need some people to help out at our casino, and frankly we don’t have a lot of time. The jobs we’ve got open are basically just acting as waitresses and some one just to look over the buffet area. I’ve read the applications you all filled out, and from what I can read, Megan, Greta, you’re old enough to qualify for our waitress positions and little Suzie (that’s a cute name by the way) can work the buffet area with one of senior staff members.

“You’ll learn as you work, the jobs aren’t that tough, the pay’s good, you get to keep whatever tips you make, and you can get free access to the buffet. There are a few more perks, but your supervisors will tell you them in your orientation. Like I said, we’re somewhat short staffed and we need someone to fill the three positions, so, you three interested?”

“We don’t really have a choice,” Megan answered back with a hand on her hip.

“What Megan meant to say was yes, and thank you for the jobs!” Greta replied as Suzie turned her entire body to the side.

“Excellent!” Sunny laughed as he smiled brightly. “Well then, I’ll have Roxanne lead you three to where you’ll be working, if you have any troubles or concerns, feel free to visit me! My door’s always open!”

"Thanks Keslie. You gonna join me?"

Keslie glanced back. Bridgette had gotten out of the vehicle, but it looked like only enough so that Harley wouldn't be sleeping on her anymore. Keslie gave Mary an apologetic smile.

"I'll catch up. Once we're all ready."

"Kay." Mary said, already half turned away. Keslie walked over to Bridgette and put a hand on her shoulder.

"Why don't we go check out the boardwalk? The beach isn't going anywhere." she said. Bridgette nodded. She had managed to blush red through her dark complexion looking at the scantily clad beachgoers. There was a decent line of shops and stands only a few paces away. No one really thought twice about leaving Harley behind. This happened enough that they knew the Abra moemon would somehow find them without any trouble.
1522.title: Life's a Beach
