15221.content:
Mary had skipped around the beach, a swimsuit flung over her arm, and had spotted the changing rooms / washrooms. She raced towards them, already fumbling at her top. Her grin made her almost look frenzied. Nonetheless, she caught the eyes of a couple rather beefy male moemon exiting the men's changing rooms. One whistled at her. Mary didn't even notice.

Inside, there were lockers and booths for changing, and Mary wasn't having any of either. She threw her swimsuit down right inside the door. She tore off her top and flung it down besides her swimsuit. That left only a minimalist yellow bra cupping her breasts. Firm and perky, they were quite an impressive sight. They fit the D-cup bra snugly, not an inch to spare. Mary got more than a few startled and/or interested stares from other beachgoers as she stripped. Next came the pants and belt. Mary's undwear was white with a little lightning-bolt print. They looked almost like a child's pair, especially given her slender waist. Almost. A few of the other moemon girls exchanged glances. She wasn't going to....?

A few minutes later, and a series of stunned moemon girls exited the changing rooms. One made cupping motions with her hands, looking like she was weighing something imaginary. A few shook their heads. Then, Mary exited exuberantly. She was only barely decent in a skimpy sunny-yellow bikini. It covered no more than her underwear, which was to say very little. Mary skipped along, carrying her clothes back to the jeep. She didn't notice someone had followed her out of the changing rooms.

"Huh. Harley?" Mary asked, looking around the jeep. It was empty. Mary shrugged, and then on a limb, began pulling herself up the side of the vehicle. It was quite easy for her to clamber up so she was standing on the top of the doorframe. Her bust wobbled ridiculously, and it was only by the grace of this story's content rating that nothing popped out. Behind her, someone cursed and hid behind a car as Mary turned a full circle, trying to spot someone she knew. No luck. So Mary shrugged, hopped off the car, and popped her clothes in.

"Imma make a sandcaaaaaaaaastle." she yelled, racing towards the sand, bouncing all the way.

152212.content:
Harley yawned and moved her queenside rook to D4 . Across the picnic table, an elderly gardevoir woman, marked by her curt green (now mostly white) hair and pale skin, hemmed and haaed.

"It's been a while since I've seen a young 'un pass up a day like this to play chess with an old coot." the woman said with a smile and a twinkle in her eye. Harley laughed and looked around.

"Looks like any ol' day to me." she said. "We're on a, watcha call it, vacation. So I'm vacationing. Don't move your knight, I'll take that pawn you need later."

"I saw that." the woman said, tapping her chin with a bony finger. "Vacation? You from the college then?" she tentatively moved a knight in the way of one of Harley's bishops.

"No." Harley said, ignoring the knight and moving a pawn so that her opponent now had free access to her king. "We do, well, odd jobs. Heh heh. Detective work, mostly. Except sometimes...."

"Detective work?" the woman asked, surprised. She had seen through the ruse and was capturing one of Harley's knights. "How odd. I worked as an assistant to a P.I. for many years. I was something of a detective myself."

"Lucky that." Harley said. "Check. So what's the big mystery here?"

"Who said anything about a mystery here?" the woman asked, studying the board and trying to figure out how she had missed one of Harley's bishops pinning her king.

"You're not from this town. And you're gathering clues." Harley nodded in the direction of the woman's lap. Despite not being able to see it, she seemed sure. The woman sighed and put a small notepad on the table that she had been sitting on.

"Think you're clever, don't you. Yes, well, it's the oddest thing. The businesses here used to be dead. The beach was mostly a local treasure. Good, but not on route to anything. Now, suddenly, it's the place to be, and the businesses are booming....especially all the food stands. Check."

"So? Probably got featured in a paper or something."

"I don't think so. There's something more. My intuition never steered me wrong. And I know a kindred spirit when I see it."

"Heh." Harley chuckled. "Maybe. Checkmate."

"What?"

"It was nice talking to you, Ms. Adeline." Harley said. "I'll see you around." she got up and walked away at quite the leisurely pace. The old woman looked at the board in confusion. Sure enough, there was her king, pinned. She sighed, placed one finger on its crown, and began to topple it. She paused though, leaving it titled.

"When the hell did I tell her my name?"
152212.title: A friendly game

Keslie decides to drag Bridgette to the changing rooms
1522122.content:
While the beach itself was a buzz, the boardwalk wasn’t too far from being completely crowded, several shops lined the wooden sidewalk, allowing some beachgoers a chance to get some food or just get out of the warm sun… And maybe perhaps purchase some fun trinkets to take back home to remind the people of their beach trip.

Although, for a certain Absol Moemon, she was glad to get out of the blazing sun and get into a slightly air conditioned shop, “Oooh… Why did it have to be the beach?”

“Bridgette, it wouldn’t be so bad if you took that sweater off,” Keslie sighed as she held up a rather colorful Hawaiian shirt from the rack nearby. “Heck, even one of these would work for you it’s baggy enough for your tastes.”

Bridgette’s face grew a bit redder, as she pulled the collar of her sweater a few times, “I’m fine, I really fine.”

“You’re literally baking in that thing,” Keslie sighed as she gestured towards her own outfit, a simple skirt that was tied around her waist with a strapless top that concealed her red and black bikini underneath. “This is the beach, you need to learn to loosen up and enjoy the atmosphere.”

“She doesssssss have a point you know,” a sleek voice slithered through the air.

Both Keslie and Bridgette turned towards the rack of clothes that Keslie was standing in front of to see a sleek young man dressed in a purple and black floral print Hawaiian shirt that was opened up to show his slightly muscular build and black swim trunks that seemed to have a red jagged tooth-like charm strapped to the waist. His black hair was styled back with a single long tail that was braided back and his eyes were covered with a pair of red shades.

However, the most prominent feature on the young moemon’s body were the almost countless tattoos that ran along his tanned skin. Bridgette looked a little too long before she turned to the side with her face getting redder by the second. “Sorry for eavesdropping, but I couldn’t help but listen in on your conversation.”

The young Moemon pushed himself from the rack of clothes and pushed his sunglasses up, “From the looksssss of you two ladiesssss, itsssss a given that you’re touristsssss.”

“And you are?” Keslie asked, knowing that the guy was probably here because he saw her and was probably trying to pick up a couple of ‘chicks’, but you can’t just judge a person on a few past experiences.

“I’m just a wandering soul walking on the sandssssss of thisssss beach,” the young Moemon hissed back with a smirk on his face. “I’m also an employee of thisssss shop you’re standing in. People simply call me Griff.”

To illustrate his point, Griff pointed towards a nametag that was clipped to his opened shirt that had his name written on it.

“Is it supposed to be upside down?” Bridgette asked with her head tilted slightly.

Griff looked down at the tag and spun around to obviously fix the messed up tag. A second later, Griff spun back around with the tag now gone, “That thing’sssss nothing but a pain.”

“So, any reason why you interrupted our conversation?” Keslie asked with a dull look in her eye.

“No particular reason,” Griff chuckled pushing the shades up to his forehead. “I just know touristsssss when I see them, after all, most people like to spend time on the beach… Unlesssssssss, you’re new touristsssss. Besidesssss, I figured that you’d come up to the counter a few minutes into the future asking about some attractionsssss here, the beach isn’t the only attraction here.”

“Alright, then what would you suggest then, Griff?” Keslie questioned, crossing her arms over her chest.

“There’sssss an arcade not too far from here,” Griff answered rather quickly with a yawn. “Itsssss part of a small restaurant called Seaside Shoresssss that servesssss some delectable treats, such as a seafood pizza and…”

“Well, thanks for the information, Griff,” Keslie thanked before she and Bridgette stepped out of the shop, leaving Griff to just stand there.

The Seviper Moemon merely shrugged his shoulders as he lowered his shades, “Asssss much asssss I enjoy the sightsssss, I prefer the quiet anyway.”

Outside the shop and into the sweltering sun, Bridgette was already drenched in sweat once more, pulling the collar of her sweater a few times trying to air out her body. “So, what’s where to next?”

“Bridgette, I’m serious, you should really change into a bathing suit,” Keslie interrupted, making Bridgette gulp slightly. “I know you’re shy, but if you keep hiding underneath that sweater, you’re going to get heatstroke.”

“Uh, well,” Bridgette stammered, considering the suggestion that Griff had decided, besides, she was a little intrigued with that seafood pizza that he mentioned.

15221222.content:
"Bridgette, this isn't negotiable. You may legally be an adult, but your still my friend, kiddo. And friends look out for each other, even if the other doesn't like it. There's a changing booth right over there, at the sand."

"H-hey, isn't that an ice-cream stand?" Bridgette asked, pointing. Keslie perked up like a fox at the hunt.

"Where? Wait - that's not nice Bridgette. No, come on."

"Ohh, that always works...." Bridgette sighed. She simply slumped, letting her weight give Keslie a hard time. Still, she got dragged to the changing rooms. She pretty much closed her eyes before they entered. Then, they came to a stop. A door clicked. Bridgette opened her eyes. She was in a booth. Then, fabric was flung over the door.

"I already have my bikini on, so I just need to lose a layer. So I'll be here waiting for you to come out. In your bathing suit. Only your bathing suit."


Yea, yea...." Bridgette sighed under her breath. There was even a mirror. There had to be a mirror. Bridgette began to undress. The baggy sweater first. Dark flesh was revealed, and plenty of it. Bridgette, despite her youth, had slightly saggy breasts, quite a weighty bosom, if nothing impressive. Her stomach was more noticable. A smooth dome of dark chocolate. It was actually slightly cut into by her pants, which went next. Bridgette groaned. She looked fatter every time she saw herself. Of course, she didn't see herself very often.

"Bridgette."

"I'm coming!" Bridgette complained. She sighed, turned away from the mirror, and continued changing.

"Happy?" Bridgette asked, opening the door and sulking. She wore a blue one-piece that, while modest, showed her pouchy body quite well. She looked up at Keslie.

"Not exactly." Keslie said, a serene smile on her face. She was dressed in a strapless bikini top and bottom, both tan, almost invisible on her body. She could have been a model. Well, her butt sure curved away from her, but other than that...

15221222.title: More gratuitous stripping

choices: As the two wait, Mary comes into the restaurant
Nah, let's check on the investigation, shall we?
152212221.content:
Bridgette knew that the longer she stalled to walk out on the sandy shores of the beach in her revealing outfit, the worse it would be. She knew that she should’ve just gotten it over with…

… But, the Absol Moemon just couldn’t bring herself to do it…

Besides, getting something to eat was starting to sound pretty good, her paunchy stomach was growling lightly since she had opted out of eating breakfast today (one of the small tricks that she had in trying to lose weight)… But instead of dying of embarrassment, Bridgette would rather just be inside and away from the beachgoers from staring at her paunchy body.

“I… I’m kinda hungry,” Bridgette answered with her head lowered slightly.

Keslie smiled slightly, at the very least, Bridgette was at least trying. “Alright then, how about we hit up the boardwalk again? That guy with the speech impediment may have been a bit of freak…”

Meanwhile in a certain shop not too far away…

“ACHOOOOO! Damn touristsssss.”

Back in front of the changing rooms, Keslie continued, “But he got me interested in that one restaurant that he was spouting off about, that Seaside Shores place. Wanna try to find it?”

Bridgette only nodded her head, allowing her hair to bob up and down a few times before Keslie took her hand, surprising the darker skinned girl. “Well then, let’s go!”

-------


It didn’t take long for the two to find the restaurant – Seaside Shores, heck it was only about a shop or two away from that one clothing store that had that weird Seviper Moemon in it. The restaurant looked to be more of a classic beach restaurant with an opened porch that had a ceiling to it and several beach charms about it. And while the beach was busy, it was rather weird to see that the restaurant was almost completely empty…

… Not that Bridgette would complain about that little fact.

The two friends entered the wooden restaurant, and immediately both of them stopped – A wondrous smell was lofting around the cool restaurant (there were several fans around, so it kept the place breezy at the very least) – Various cheeses, seafood and spices filled the air, and made the two gulp slightly with the smell filling their senses.

“Ah! Finally, customers!”

The two drew their attention before them, and standing before them was a slim young with bright skin and spiky blonde hair that was combed out of her sharp (yet oddly cute face). Her slim petite figure was covered with a pair of white shorts and a black tube top that showed her almost curve-less figure. With the electrified smile on her face, it was easy to see that she was a Jolteon Moemon. “Welcome to the Seaside Shores, the name’s Kay and I guess I’ll be your waiter for as long as you two are here!”

“I like that enthusiasm,” Keslie chuckled as she followed Kay to one of the multiple emptied tables in the restaurant, Bridgette following soon after.

There were already menus on the table that allowed the two girls to look over them while Kay got them some glasses of water. And it didn’t take long for the energized Moemon to return with the icy cold drinks, “So, what can I get ya gals? Some cool drinks or maybe something tasty?”

“Can you tone it down a little?” Bridgette asked, moving a little bit away from Kay.

“What she means,” Keslie coughed out loud. “Is that we don’t know what to try, what would you suggest?”

“Dunno,” Kay answered with a shrug. “I only got this job a few days ago… But from what Gary tells me, oh, yeah, he’s the chef here… Anyway, Gary says that the seafood pizza’s pretty good.”

Bridgette’s ears perked up, and this didn’t go unnoticed by Keslie who smirked, “One of those sounds good, medium will be good. And a couple of diet colas too.”

“Not a problem! It’ll be ready in a few!” Kay announced with a playful wink before she trotted off towards the kitchen.

“… Is everyone on this beach weird?” Bridgette asked before she took a sip of her ice water.

“I kinda like the energy everyone’s got here,” Keslie replied with a smirk.

They're done, and exit the restaurant....with an extra?
1522122211.content:
"Hee hee hee." Keslie's ears picked up a very familiar, very troubling snicker. It couldn't be...but, turning around to see, it was. There, in the doorway, Mary stood aside, watching carefully while hiding herself, practically pointing her rear end at them as she leaned around the corner. She ducked away, and a moment later several angry beachgoers, plastic shovels and the like raised like torches and pitchforks, ran past. Mary snickered to herself gleefully.

"Mary!"

"Ididn'tdoit!" Mary yelped, jumping in surprise. Keslie gave her a look, making the Raichu moemon blush and kick at the ground in guilt.

"It was a missunderstanding." she said, pouting. Keslie rolled her eyes.

"Well, as long as nothing comes of it I suppose. Would you like to join us for lunch?"

Mary glanced back outside, winced, and nodded. "That'd be safe- I mean, that'd be great. Whatcha having?"

"Pizza." Keslie replied. "Hmm, probably should have gotten a large now..."

"I can get ya two mediums, if you'd like?" Kay replied, having sidled up to them as Mary joined them. She was behind Bridgette, making the pudgy girl jump in her seat. "You want something to drink, sugar?"

"Sugar!" Mary said, grinning widely. "What'cha got for soda?"

"Hmm. I can do you one better. So, two mediums?"

"Yes please." Keslie replied. Kay scampered off. Bridgette sighed. Mary wasn't going to eat a whole pizza by herself, but one would have been too little. That meant there'd be more pizza to go around now....lucky she had skipped breakfast, because she knew that she wasn't going to be rationing herself if this pizza was any good. Besides, she hated wasting food. She didn't like to even think of her past, but the one thing she couldn't help but think of was her anger at others wasting food while she skipped another meal....it was no wonder she had ballooned once she got the support of this eccentric group.

"Woah." Mary said. Kay had returned with a glass of pink lemonade nearly so large to be called a pitcher. It was rimmed with frosted sugar and had a whole strawberry wedged in the side. Mary took a fingerfull of sugar, and then sipped the drink. Her eyes lit up.

"Liquid candy." she said, downing a gulp of the glass. Kay giggled.

"I try to stay healthy - not easy working here, trust me - but this is my weakspot."

"Heh, I'll run it off in ten minutes." Mary replied. "Pizza in another ten."

"She really will." Bridgette said, exasperated with her friend's behavior. Two peppy electric moemon was too much for her. Those two would probably hit it off so we- was that an actual sparkle in Kay's eye as she looked at Mary?

"Really....okay sweetstuff, I'll go see if those pizzas are ready." Kay said, walking off after letting her eyes linger a moment longer. Mary was her normal oblivious self.

"I love the friendliness here. We definitely picked right." Keslie replied. Bridgette just shook her head. The sooner she could down her worries in grease and cheese, the better.

Luckily, the pizzas did come in another ten. "Seafood" pizza wasn't entirely accurate, because Bridgette was pretty sure pepperoni didn't come from the sea. The pizzas were a smattering of toppings, most going with the beachy theme - such as pineapple, some anchovies (which Bridgette didn't actually mind). So, everyone could eat their favorite. Kay was attentive and friendly, which made sense since they were the only customers currently. Still, she seemed just a bit too eager at times, almost hovering around them, Mary in particular. Maybe it was Bridgette's imagination. In any case, the pizza was really good. She downed one slice before she knew it, and immediately had a second in her hands. Her friends ate with similar gusto. Bridgette realized (or rationalized) that that old rule, about waiting an hour after she ate to swim, could buy her loads of time away from the beach. All she had to do was eat her fill. So down went a third, and fourth slice, with enthusiasm.

"Anything else?" Kay asked, clearing off empty plates. The pizzas had been cleared out. Keslie looked a little upset, rubbing an overstuffed belly. Mary, well, she was Mary - she was probably full, but that didn't slow her down. Bridgette was handling it a little better, but she had cleared out nearly half the pizzas by herself, and could feel her belly filled nearly to capacity.

What IS Harley up to?
15221222111.content:
"I think we're all...." Keslie paused. Her stomach grumbled, and she licked her lips. "Well, maybe we should get something more. We don't treat ourselves often."

"What are you-" Bridgette's objections vanished as her mouth filled with saliva. That had been very good pizza. She could squeeze in a few more slices. Besides, that'd give her an excuse not to swim for even longer. She nodded her agreement.

"One more medium should do it." Keslie said to Kay.

"Tell you what. How about I make it a large and join ya'? It's my lunch break."

Bridgette frowned over this stranger inviting herself into their group, but Keslie just gave a good-natured smile. "Sure. I'm sure the girls have no objections."

"Nah, come sit with us!" Mary said, gesturing at a seat. They turned to her. Bridgette's resolve collapsed under their expectations, and she just muttered her agreement, wishing she had her sweater on to hide in.

"She's shy." Keslie said. Kay giggled.

"Okay. Second course, coming up." she said. She left them alone, for the first time in a while, and the trio were free to discuss amongst themselves.

"This is good food." Keslie said. "I'm very impressed, for such a little establishment. I wonder why so few people frequent here?"

"Maybe because there are so many choices." Mary said. "I ran past like four different restaurants on my way here, and cotton candy vendors, ice cream places..."

"We should take a tour afterward." Keslie said. Bridgette lit up.

"Yes, let's." she said. Keslie gave her a sly smile, letting Bridgette know that she had seen that response coming.

"Alright. Assuming we're not too stuffed to move after this." she said. Bridgette sighed and poked her tummy. It was soft, and it was threatening to touch her healthy-sized thighs right now. She said nothing though. She wasn't jealous of her friends' bodies. She wouldn't stoop so low. She just wished she could feel more comfortable in her own skin.

"Order up! Hee hee." Kay said with a laugh, putting a steaming hot pizza down on the table. She pulled up a chair and wedged herself between Bridgette and Mary.

"So, what brings you all to this little corner of the world?" Kay asked, taking her first bite of pizza. Bridgette focused on the food, but overheard the conversation.

"Oh, vacationing. We run - we are, basicallly, a little private investigation firm most of the time." Keslie said

"Woah, cool! Crimefighters?"

"Well, on occasion. Mostly it's just lost items, background checks, the occasional unfaithful spouse, so on."

"Awesome." Forget rose-tinted glasses, apparently Kay was wearing rose earmuffs as well, hearing only what she wanted. "That sounds awesome."

"It's pretty cool." Mary said. She let out a wide grin, "I'm basically zuBatman. Woman. Y'know." she and Kay shared a laugh. Bridgette rolled her eyes.

"How about you, Kay?" Keslie asked. Kay was taken aback momentarily.

"Oh, me? Not much to say. One of seven kids, yea. I kinda wasn't sure what to do after school. I mean, yea, I like to stay in shape, but I didn't want to work in a gym my whole life or anything. So, I went wandering...wound up with this job, guess I kinda missed Blaize."

"That's actually pretty interesting." Keslie said. "Blaize?"

"My biggest sister. Literally." Kay made a gesture like she was hugging a barrel. "Big girl, but she was like a second mother - our mom was great, but when you've got seven....anyway, she was the best cook in the world. Obviously enjoyed her own too. We still got along, she was, heh, larger than life. After I started wandering, I kinda missed having homecooked meals, being able to hang out in the kitchen on a rainy day...this was the next best thing." As she talked, Kay and the rest of the group chowed down on the pizza. Bridgette could feel her stomach getting distended, but she figured she could make it to the end. Fortunately, Kay hadn't eaten yet, and dug in voraciously now. She liked to keep herself in shape, eh? Bridgette could only imagine what a month of working here would do to the Jolteon moemon. Then again, the gang was staying nearly that long on vacation, so maybe she should be worried....not now, though. Now was just a slightly (more than slightly, really) heavier meal among friends.

152212221112.content:
Harley was up to something, that was for sure. She was up to about forty feet, holding calmly onto the railing in front of her seat. The ferris wheel she had found was one of only a few rides on the beach, like a theme park in its infancy, but it was a decent ride nonetheless. Harley's mouth was sticky with the remnants of cotton candy, and she hummed happily to herself as she crested the peak of her revolution. For a few brief moments, she got the boardwalk and beach all in view, picture perfect. The boardwalk was rather extensive, but nothing legendary. Packed tight with gimmicky shops, but nearly a third of it was propery sit-in eateries, and nearly half of them sold food of some description. Not too odd, especially as there seemed to be plenty of people to fill every shop and eatery. A good mix of tourists and locals, Harley guessed by the way many frantically went from stall to stall to stall (tourists making the most of their day) to calmer-moving individuals with a clear purpose in mind and who maneuvered the crowds expertly (the locals).

Harley hadn't actually yet changed into her bathing suit, but here, lifted up closer to the naked sun, she was wishing she had. The heat flustered her a little, and she began to look for somewhere cool to go once the ride was over. Unfortunately, there didn't appear to be that many places that would offer her a quiet respite - oh sure, plenty of places had air conditioning, but they were also packed, and Harley would be prodded mercilessly to buy something while she was in there. She decided the quickest and surest course of action would be to get herself an ice cream. Once she got off this ride!

By the time she was off, Harley was sweating. She usually had a calm, some would say mysterious, demeanor, but it was broken by her need to combat the heat. There were enough ice cream vendors around that she only had a short line to wait through. It was soft serve, even! She got a simple cone full of vanilla - she just needed to cool off, after all. However, it was gone in a flash, the cold tasting better than the actual flavor. And it didn't change a thing. Harley went sweating into a shop.

"Hey, excuse me." she asked, spying a name tag. "Where you got around here that's cool? That I can sit down?"

"Darned Tourissssstssssss....." said a familiar (for us) face. "There'sssssss covesssss on the beach jussst north if you can walk it. If not, try the movie theater. Are you going to buy ssssssomething, or jussst sssssstand there?"

Harley blinked at him. "You talk funny." she said with a laugh. "Thanks. Oh, I mean thankssssss." she laughed and exited the store, apparently oblivious to the twin beams of hate directed at her back.

"Worssssse every time I talk to them."

1522122211121.content:
After dealing with the speech challenged Seviper Moemon, Harley had decided to head towards the coves to the north. At the very least, she would’ve been able to soak her feet in the waters hopefully.

It didn’t take long for the Abra Moemon to find the cove, and much to her prior thoughts, there wasn’t a soul in sight in the beautiful scenery. The circular costal recess was surrounded by several rocks that were dulled down from countless years of erosion with a rather large pool of sea water that had a large rock seated in the middle of the pool of water, almost acting as a small island in the water. Taking off her shoes and socks (which was more difficult since they were knee socks), Harley sat down on one of the smooth rocks and dipped her feet into the water, “Ahh…”

With the cool ocean breeze being captured in the rocky surroundings, Harley had to admit that the Seviper moemon was right with this location. There was a good mix of shade and sun, a cool breeze, and the salty water that flowed around her feet – This was almost the best place to spend a hot day…

… but that brought up a good question. ‘Why aren’t there any other people here? If this is such a good place to kill a hot day…’

But, Harley immediately shrugged off and threw her arms behind her head, yawning loudly. If there was no one around, then it would be a perfect time to take a nap and get away from any noise.

“Oy!”

Too bad that just as Harley was about to close her eyes, a loud splash echoed through the air, making her look down at the pool of water to see someone standing up from the pool of water, just in time to see…

15221222111211.content:
"What are you doing here?" the man asked, brushing seaweed from his shoulders. He had just emerged from the water, apparently, still dripping wet and looking more like a swamp thing in swim shorts than a man. He had a sharp nose and a prominent jaw, and clearly at home in the water, looking so natural even half in it. A water moemon of some sort, and Harley just guessed (randomly, of course) that he was a totodile. He had a large sack over his shoulder, and eyed Harley with suspicion.

"Touring the beaches." Harley said calmly, stifling a yawn. "Is this off limits to tourists?"

"Yur a tourist?" the man asked, shifting the bag slightly. It was something bulky and awkward, whatever it was. Harley nodded with a disarming smile.

"Get back to the beaches." the man said gruffly. "It's not safe for tourists 'round here." he turned around and exited the cage. Harley shrugged and followed him out. The man whipped around.

"You following me?" he growled. Harley cocked her head to the side.

"Didn't you say I should leave?"

"Huh? Oh, right. Yeah, good then." he said. He kept cocking his head back at her, but started heading for another cove, of which there were nearly a dozen. Harley stopped to watch him. He had stopped looking back. He entered the fourth one down from Harley. Harley shrugged and headed back to her cove. She seated herself back down and yawned. No sense following that up while the burly man was around. Harley closed her eyes and listened to the waves until she promptly and quietly fell asleep.

When Harley awoke, the sky was orange. It wasn't sunset, but she could see the sun heading for the horizon. Harley got up and scratched her head. She usually didn't sleep that long. She exited the cove, and took a moment to stretch. As she did so, something in the sand caught her eye. A fresh set of footprints, not yet washed away, leading past her cave and into the sea a little bit later. Looked like some sort of swimmer had just left the way he came. What fortuitous timing. Harley shrugged to herself, and decided to see what made that cove over there so special.

Mary on the other hand, well, after downing all those sugary drinks and more than her fair share of seafood pizza, she was literally bouncing her seat (along with the large mounds that were confined in her tight swimsuit). “Whatnextwhatnextwhatnextwhatnext?”

“Harley one of your friends?” Kay asked as she trotted back over to the table. Kay did spend a good portion of the time with the girls and helped them chow down on some of their food (and even decided to help pay off some of it, of course), but since she was still an employee she had to go back to the kitchen to do some work. However, the odd thing was, only the three Moemon girls were still the only customers in the restaurant, but they paid it no mind.

Keslie raised an eyebrow at the invitation, sure, the Jolteon Moemon did hit it off well with the group, but still, to offer residence after just spending a couple of hours together? Either Kay was incredibly generous and kind or she didn’t really care if someone stole something from her. “We wouldn’t want to impose…”

“Nonsense!” Kay replied, placing her hands on her trim hips. “Sides, around this time, the hotels are usually packed up tighter with tourists and get so loud because of kids and such, you should take up my offer, we’ve got a great view of the beach and one of my roommates is going to grill out later tonight! You haven’t lived till you tasted one of Jaws’ burgers!”

“I thought I told ya not to call me by that name,” A loud groan echoed through the nearly deserted restaurant, garnering the attention of Kay, Keslie and even Mary (who was trying to lick the glasses clean of whatever lemonade she might’ve missed) towards the front entrance, just in time to see the same Totodile Moemon that Harley had bumped into at the coves (not that anyone here would’ve known that). He even still had the same sack that Harely saw him with earlier, albeit it seemed a bit smaller.

“Ah! Perfect timing Jaws!” Kay cheered as she ran over to the sighing Totodile Moemon.

“What did I just say?” ‘Jaws’ sighed with a shake of his head. “Do I look like a Sharpedo? And how hard is it to remember Simmons?”

“Ah, but Jaws sounds so much cooler!” Kay explained, expecting that her answer would be acceptable.

Jaws sighed again as he smiled, “Kay, ya know I yer bro – Noir and I used to be teammates a while back, and if I can handle ya and yer sister Miyu staying at my place, then a few more guests ain’t gonna kill me. Although, I wish ya tell me ahead of time if ya wanna invite someone over instead of putting me on the spot like that.”

Keslie sighed loudly as she rubbed the side of her hair, “Well, I guess if we won’t be a bother!”

The sun that shined over the wondrous beach gave the entire ocean a look that it was almost on fire, the reflection in the water waving about. Several young couples were seated on the sandy beach as they watched the sun slowly disappear over the water’s horizon, with good reason, there seemed to be a certain something in the air that would bring couples closer together – Both physically and romantically (although, depending on the couple, the two could be the one in the same).

Of course, there was one thing that could shatter that very romantic aura between couples… Two big things actually…

“HARLEY! WHERE’D YA GO?!” Mary yelled through the air as she walked on the cooling off warm sand, Kay walking alongside her as the two graced the beach in front of many of the couples. Unknowingly, the two bouncing mounds that were Mary’s breasts that struggled to escape from her confining bikini top as well as the toned bods of both electric Moemon had caught the attention of a good number of half of the couples on the beach…

It seemed that every time the two passed in front of a couple, when there was a loud slapping sound that echoed through the air behind them. Of course, this continuous event was falling on deaf ears of both Mary and Kay as they continued their search for the missing Abra Moemon.

“Humph,” Mary sighed loudly as she slouched forward, giving Kay a good view of the curved behind. “Where’d Harley go to?”

“You said she usually sleeps in weird places,” Kay pointed out, remembering that story that Mary had told her earlier. “Maybe she’s someplace like that jungle gym or something.”

“Yeah! Yeah!” Mary cheerfully replied as she jumped back, giving her chest a healthy bounce. “Ya know anywhere like that?”

“Hmm, I dunno,” Kay answered with her shoulders lifted up and a cute, if not confused look on her face. “I’ve been mostly working since I got here… But I know someone who would know!”

Kay grasped Mary’s hand and began pulling the curvaceous Raichu Moemon across the beach. At first Mary struggled at the sudden contact, but immediately managed to keep up with Kay’s pace. “C’mon! He should be off work ‘bout now! We might just be able to catch him!”

“Ooh! Hide n’ seek and tag?” Mary gleefully stated with a large grin on her face. “This day just keeps getting funner and funner!”

TTTTTTT


The boardwalk, while still busy with the night crowd, did have a few shops closed up for the night, which for one certain tattoo covered, Seviper Moemon meant only one thing. “Another day, another sssssssssssmoke.”

Indeed, leaning against the side of the shop he worked at was none other than the Seviper – Griff, a lit cigarette in his mouth to help burn away his stress that he had gotten from the day’s gaggle of annoying customers. Of course, there were a few that didn’t annoy him, like those two girls that were his first visitors, they only had a few questions (and that Ninetails Moemon did at least provide Griff with a decent wake up call with a beautiful ‘view’). Another was that weirdly dressed Abra Moemon, once again, no sale, but still, he had to answer questions, not too bad, just a mild annoyance.

But the real trouble was roughly about when the lunch hour had occurred, a mob of Moemon had rushed into his shop, trying to find some ‘curvy party crasher’ that had apparently ruined a volleyball tournament that was organized by a whole bunch of college students. When Griff had told them that he didn’t see any ‘curvy party crasher’ (whatever that meant), a small number of the mob had marched out of the store to continue their search…

However, a majority of the mob had seemed to have caught sight of a few interesting trinkets, shirts or whatever crap that was stocked in Griff’s shop. So, for the next two hours, Grif had to continuously ring up purchases, answer questions (some about the curvy party crasher) or even had to do the unthinkable – Act courteous!

The only good thing about that experience was that Griff was able to fill up his quota for the day and then some, which had allowed the Seviper Moemon close up shop earlier than usual (the boss really did care for profits, but was otherwise very lax when it came to opening and closing). And here he was, enjoying his before dinner-time smoke, the sound of beachgoers in the background, but was drowned out by Griff’s head as he focused only on the tobacco’s burning taste and…

“GRIFFY!”

Griff’s eyes nearly bugged out from behind his shades, making him drop his cigarette from his mouth and onto the ground, “Damn it…”

“There you are Griffy!”

Turning his head to the side, Griff saw that standing only a few feet away was a certain slim, Jolteon Moemon that he had the misfortune of knowing for the last couple of weeks or so – Kay. She always seemed to have a knack for catching the Seviper and surprising him whenever he had just taken his first puff of a cigarette and somehow managed to ruin it…

Griff’s thoughts of anger quickly melted away to confusion and curiosity when he noticed that Kay’s hand was grasping onto another person’s hand – his eyes traveled up the arm and then focused onto a pair of the largest, bikini-clad mountains that he had seen in his time working on the beach (and that was saying something!), at least on a Moemon that had a figure that was as slim as Kay’s (save for the precious curves of this young lass’s hips and the small dome of a belly). Not wanting to get annoyed to death, Griff closed his eyes at the Raichu Moemon he was leering at and returned to his angered demeanor, “Oh, itssssssss you… Kay, what do I owe this interruption to?”

“Aw, you know that I’m saving your life whenever I interrupt you!” Kay giggled as Mary lifted her hands up to her nose to block the smell of tobacco smoke.

“Eww… That’s smelly!” Mary complained with her other hand waved in front of her face a few times.

“Classy,” Griff mumbled, using his sandal covered to crush and put out his cigarette. “Who’ssssss thisssssssss sssssssupposed to be? Amazon of the ssssssssummer?”

Before Kay could say anything, a stifled snicker echoed through the air, making both Kay and Griff turn to the curvaceous Raichu Moemon who had just erupted into a loud explosion of laughter with her hand held up towards Griff. “Hehehahahaha! He t-talks so hohoho weird!”

Kay smiled brightly as well and joined in the laughter, making the Seviper Moemon develop a large bead of sweat that rolled down the side of his head. ‘That was my last cigarette, and I’m ssssso tempted to pick it up from the ground to ssssssssmoke it… There’ssssss two of them now!’

The bright sun beamed down making the large blue waters and golden sands sparkle beautifully. A cool breeze swept through the area and brought the scent of saltwater with it. A group consisting of four female Moemon and two guys rode a boat across the large ocean. The girls: Milly the Miltank, Tina the Medicham, Oceana the Dewgong and Lady the Machoke all looked excitedly out. For this moment their competition for love was set aside for this neutral joy of the trip. Ranger the Lucario was looking quite happy himself seeing them getting along for the first time in so long. They were going on a vacation to an island called Colostic Island which though recently opened up was highly ranked for their glorious beach, five-star hotel and their wonderful food. Who won’t be happy about going to a place like that for free?

The answer to that was the sixth member of the team. He sat in the shaded area of the boat and didn’t even look a bit ecstatic. It looked like he annoyed even thinking about the days to come…but even if he didn’t show it he was a little happy. It was his first time being invited on a trip with a friend; he just hated beach, the sun and most of all the company of the people he would be stuck with. But it made Ranger happy so he decided to suffer though four painful weeks. Someone had to stop the love craving animals from smothering him.

As the boat docked the group of them gathered their stuff before taking a nice little bus ride. Arriving at the hotel, which really was walking distance from where they got off. Even Greg was impressive at the hotel in front of them. It had to be like hundred floors tall and like four hundred floor if you turned it to its side. The door was unbelievably large and as it opened cool refreshing air blew over them. The lobby was shiny and so clean it look like you could slide across with no problem. Topical plants and flowers decorated the area giving it a vivid and lively aura. Milly was in pure shock this morning as her blue eyes stared down. In her disbelief she could do nothing but continue to look in horror. The most terrible thing to have ever happen… she had gained 11 pounds. It was kind of obvious since earlier her pants were uncomfortable tight and she was struggling to get them close. But to have gain that much was just unbelievable to her, after she worked so hard to keep it down. She continued to gape at the result long after it had vanished from the scale; her mind was in panic as her body remained in a frozen state. She was finally snapped out of it by pounding on the door.

“Hurry it up already, other people need the bathroom!” The furious voice cut through the room as if it wasn’t a door blocking it. That was her brother ‘Bull’ a Tauros though is real name is William which their parent annoyingly shorten to Billy. Billy and Milly… their parents were so corny. The Miltank stun-locked mind was freed by his voice and she quickly began to do what she needed in the bathroom. “Don’t make me break down this door!” He threatened after waiting about a minute.

“Gosh, hold your dang Ponyta! I’m hurrying!” She barked back at him as she tried to quicken her pace a bit. After couple of minutes more of listening to her brother moaning and complaining she burst out of the bathroom and went straight to her room. She was mostly upset about her weight gain but also incredibly peeved by her brother's annoyance while she was in the bathroom. Once in her room she closed and locked it. She walked in from of her full size mirror which was more than tall enough with her short self. She began to examine herself more closely.

Light flush skin, a nicely curvy body with a generously large bust and nice wide hips gave her a hourglass figure effect. Her body would be great if wasn’t for that fat belly of hers. Grabbing and shaking it her whole body jiggled a bit. As she squeezed it in her hands she definitely thought she could feel those extra pounds of forming there. Milly turned and to get a side image and her belly was definitely sticking out more. A frown appeared on her face and she put on her traditional pink blouse and bellbottom pants on. Normally loose they were snug on her body now which only upset her more.

“It looks like I’m going to have to cut down some more,” the girl told herself with much dismay. With someone with a huge appetite and sweet-tooth such as her dieting was such a pain. But it had to be done if she wanted to stand a chance to win the love of her life. With a sigh Milly left her room and went downstairs to the kitchen. She got herself an apple and a tiny bowl of plain Cheerios. She got out the skim milk that no one else in her family would dear touch and put a small amount of it in. And that was her breakfast. It was three times smaller than it usually was. As she began to eat her mother walked in and concernedly eyed her meal.

“Milly, that’s a little small for just breakfast.” Her mom pointed out. Her body swayed as she entered; Milly’s mom was a heavy set woman with gorgeous curves and large size gut to match it. It wasn’t too bad as she had a couple of inches on her daughter; the fifteen year old girl was a near splitting image of her mom thus she could tell exactly how she’d look with a lot more weight. That would be too much for her to be comfortable with and it was probably the same for Ranger. “Don’t you normally eat a little more than this?”

“I’m lowering my calorie intake…” The teen told her mom has she slowly chewed her food. After swallowing a bite she continued. “Even though my intake hasn’t change I’ve started to gain weight…”

“Hmm… I see. Milly give me some of you milk.” She suddenly asked which made the girl stop and look directly at her.

“What, why?!” The blue-eyed girl questioned her parent with a look of utter confusion. It was just a random thing for her mother to say all of the sudden.

“Just do it, Mildred.” The older lady ordered sternly, Dad and Bull were really starting to rub off on her. Milly did what she was told and filled up a bottle… she actually had more milk than usual which was quite odd. After giving it to her mom, she took a small sip of it. “Hmm… I see. Have you been spending time around babies or young kids, Sweetie?”

“Yea, my new part-time job at the daycare. What’s that got to do with anything?” Milly had started the job close to two weeks ago. It was fairly good pay in afternoon on weekdays and early morning on weekends for only a couple of hours. But the relevance of that to what they were talking about just didn’t click.

“The richest of your milk. Like all Miltanks you produce milk. But when Miltanks are in the presence of babies and young children their body produces much more nutritious milk and a whole lot of it. The weight you gained is certainly because of that.” The girl’s mom explained and that definitely made sense she was heavier because of an extra supply of milk in her body; the inconvenience of having Miltank genes.

“Gosh, who would have thought this would a result of trying to get some extra money...” She murmured as she looked down at her gut it looked bloated despite letting out some milk.

“It’s really good milk it too bad we couldn’t sell it.” Mom just suddenly stated as put a top on the bottle and set it on the table. Her statement peak her daughter’s interest once more.

“Why not?” Milly asked curiously.

“Well other than the fact I think you’re too young to get in the Milk Business, the nutrition of the milk is much too high to give to anyone. It’s perfect for young kids and babies that need it to help their growth but for older people it’ll be too much nourishment which will cause their body to store the excess amount.” She clarified her statement in detail.

“So what you’re saying is that this milk will make non-children gain weight?” Milly asked just make sure she understood exactly what her mother was saying.

“Yes, that’s exactly it.” She mused at her daughter for putting together what she had told her. Her small smile turned back into a concerned look for the girl. “Oh Milly, I suggest you give your milk to the kids at the daycare; it'll be good for them and it will also help with your current gain. So don’t push yourself too hard with the dieting, okay?”

“Alright Mom, thanks for the info. I will make good use of it.” Mom walked over to the cabinet and began to get out ingredients. As her mother did that a plan appeared in her head. If this milk would make people gain weight she could even the score of her competition by getting them to drink a lot of it and gain a whole lot of weight. Other than Lady who religiously works out hard, Tina and Oceana had terrible eating and exercising habits making them a perfect target. All she needed was an excuse to give it to them often and watch the pounds pile on. But it another thought came to mind was just how effective would be? As she finished the last bite of her apple she began to ponder on her next course of action.

1553211.content:
Their destination was Celadon City. To call it a big city would be an understatement; Anita’s hometown was practically dwarfed by this giant, and that was just another reason why she wanted to go there. The town had everything: fancy restaurants, beach resorts, fighting tournaments, casinos, motels, theater, you name it. And at least one of these appealed to the girls.

However, things weren't going quite as planned.

"I still can't believe we had to pay a toll!" Anita stomped her foot and pouted. Her face that was posted on numerous billboards in her earlier career, was red from fatigue and stress. Being an ex-idol from Saffron City, Anita wasn't exactly "cut" for physical labor; that's why she had Kaya around to be her muscle.

"Alright, you two, we're taking a break." And before her friends could even respond, the jigglypuff moemon plopped uselessly to the ground, her pink hair bopping slightly as she did so. Anita noticed her small paunch slightly pressing against her black top. Anita had to admit, at least this was good exercise.


Kaya shook her head at Anita. The busty, blonde combusken moemon, wearing her usual red training outfit, was more than used to long walks and was a little more than annoyed by Anita’s constant complaints.

“Alright you lightweight, but make it quick. Things aren’t going to be easy since you got the bright idea to rip our map apart. It’s been a couple of hours now and I’m pretty sure we’re lost.”

Kaya sat down next to Anita and looked into her empty gourd. Not even a single drop. She shouldn't have drank it all before they left.

“I agree with Kaya, Anita, you’re too soft. Not only do you have a short temper but you have such low stamina!” The mismagius moemon, who was looming over the two, was definitely an odd sort. With her purple dress flowing wherever she floated about, and her absurdly large witch’s hat, she got the most looks from passerby.

Anita looked up at Magena. If Kaya didn’t know any better, she could’ve sworn she saw steam shooting out of Anita’s ears.

“Sh-shut up! I was frustrated with having to pay over half of our money and being with two dimwits doesn't help matters any!”

Anita looked at Kaya and glared at her. Kaya could only roll her eyes, it was moments like this that made her want to have a giant swig of whatever spirit she fancied.

"Kaya! You could've easily kicked their asses, but you just stood there!"

"Anita, as much as I would've liked to fight them I don't want us being chased as criminals. Besides, I dislike fighting sober. And speaking of being sober, you're really giving me a headache."

Anita ignored Kaya, and directed her attention towards Magena. Magena stared back, her golden, drowsy eyes trying to stay open.

"And Maggie! You just had to be so willing to give our money to them. That's the last time I trust my money with you."

"But they asked so nicely! I even decided to even give them a tip. Good fortune will smile upon us for having such generous hearts. We'll get our reward soon, Anita, don't you worry."

Defeated, Anita looked to the ground. They had to pay almost half of the money they had with them, they had no idea where they were going, and they were probably going to starve to death.

Kaya got up and dusted herself off. "Hey, drama queen, just sitting there moping around isn't going to get us anywhere. We should at least find some nearby settlement, to get some food and rest."

Magena suddenly perked up to that idea. "Oh! Oh! Let me lead the way! I have a very good sense of direction. We'll be at Celadon before you know it!"

Kaya crossed her arms and chuckled. She had to admit, at least Maggie kept things interesting.

"Alright Maggie, we'll be wandering around aimlessly until we find a town anyway."

"Oh, man, it's so hot!"

"You can say that again, fatty."

It was a hot summer day, the kind of day where you just want to stay inside with the AC on. Unfortunately for our 3 heroes, they didn't have that option.

Team Destiny was on a quest: a quest for treasure. Their quest, however, was being slowed down considerably as both Katy and Truman were sweating like dogs and moving at a snail's pace. Ling, on the other hand, was far ahead of both of them.

"Ling, please slow down!" Katy yelled at her physical polar opposite. "Yes, ma'am!" Ling shouted back, as she ran back towards her teammates.

"Ling, you're not the only one here. Are you familiar with the saying, 'All for one, one for all'?"

"Y-yes, m-ma'am," Ling replied, embarrassed.

"And you know what it means, right?"

"Y-y-yes..."

"What does it mean?"

"Uh... uh... um..." Ling was too embarrassed to answer.

"It means you should never leave a man behind. And when you--"

"CAVE!!" Truman suddenly shouted, causing both girls to jump. He then began to run towards the aforementioned cave. "Hey, what did I just say?" Katy shouted as she ran after Truman, Ling following.

The entrance of the cave was absolutely dazzling. Its icy walls sparkled like diamond. "Cave!" Truman boasted, proud of his discovery. Katy and Ling cocked their heads.

"There's a good chance of us finding treasure in this cave; plus, if we get in here, we'll be out of this heat!" Truman explained, in a rare moment of cleverness. "Hmm... can't argue with that logic," Katy pointed out. "Yes! As usual, I'm right!" Truman claimed, back to his usual self. Katy gave him her trademark glare as they all entered the cave.

About 200 feet in, the cave split into two branches. "What now, Katy?" Ling inquired of her heavyset superior. Katy rubbed her chin thoughtfully.

Katy was unconscious when she felt a bucket of ice water drench her face and upper body. She shot up and yelled, "TRUMAN, WHAT DID I TELL YOU ABOUT--"

She stopped herself when she saw that it wasn't the jerky Raichu that had given her a rude awakening, but instead, a plump young Dewgong woman that was now cowering in fear at the Makuhita's sudden outburst.

"P-please don't h-hurt m-me..."

Katy stood up and put her hand on the Dewgong's shoulder. "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to yell at you. I thought you were someone else." She outstretched her hand (causing the Dewgong to jump slightly) and continued, "Hi, I'm Katy!"

"Hmm?... Oh!" The Dewgong firmly grasped Katy's hand and shook it wildly, causing her entire body to jiggle. "Glad to meet you!"

Katy pulled her hand back. "Glad to be met," she said in a raspy voice as she tried to nurse her crushed hand back to health.

The Dewgong erupted into uproarious laughter. "My name's Valerie!" she said.

Now that she wasn't cowering, Katy could get a good look at her. She was about the same height as Katy, but if she had to guess, she was about 75 pounds heavier - this girl was huge! 155332111111.content:
Valerie lumbered up to the front doors of the restaurant and held them open for her new friends. "After you!" she beamed.

The restaurant wasn't very busy, this being just before the lunch rush. At one table sat a middle-aged Vaporeon man reading a newspaper while polishing off a box of donuts. At another was an Emboar father struggling to keep his two rowdy Tepig children under control, while a third child, a teenage Pignite boy, was quietly tending to his video game. At yet another table, there sat a literal butterball of a Vulpix girl who was as wide as she was tall. Katy chuckled at the sight. She was willing to bet the Vulpix was bubbly and had a sweet tooth.

Valerie led the team to the counter, where they all took a seat. "Oh, honey~" she sang. A tubby Glaceon poked his head out of the kitchen. "Is that my favorite customer I hear?" he sang back. He waddled up to the counter and gave Valerie a hug.

Valerie's apparent love interest was actually about half a foot taller than her (maybe she was into that?) but was just as heavyset. In fact, he was fatter than Valerie! He was wearing his work clothes, a blue Polo and khaki shorts.

"Friends," Valerie said as she pulled away from the warm (cold?) embrace of her boyfriend, "this is Toby. Toby, this is Katy..."

"Hi!"

"...Truman..."

"Eh."

"...and Ling."

"Eep!" Ling retreated into her hoodie.

"Looks like a lively bunch," Toby laughed. He turned to Katy. "And so beautiful, too." Katy blushed and giggled.

"Hey, man, that's gay," Truman remarked, assuming that Toby was referring to him.

Valerie cleared her throat.

"Oh, yes, I'm sure you're all absolutely famished," Toby said. "So, what'll it be?"

Katy was about to speak, but Valerie chimed in, "We'll take four specials, please."

Katy, Truman, and Ling all had a worried look. "What's the special?" they said simultaneously.

Toby just grinned. "Trust me, you will not be disappointed!" he laughed as he headed back into the kitchen. Ten minutes later, he returned with four of the biggest bowls of chili any of our three heroes had ever seen! The bowl was six inches tall and a foot in diameter. The chili was composed of chili beans, ground beef, diced tomatoes, and various hot peppers. The whole thing was smothered with cheese and topped with a crust of crushed taco shells. He placed the bowls in front of them and said, "Bon appetit!"

"What is that, Spanish?" Truman grumbled. Toby just laughed as he wobbled back into the kitchen.

Katy was the first to take a bite of her chili. The instant she did, her mouth was filled with a wonderful combination of flavors. She loved it! She turned to her shy Eevee teammate and noticed she hadn't touched her chili. "Ling, why haven't you eaten your chili?" Katy asked.

"I... I don't think I would like it..." Ling responded.

"Nonsense!" Katy picked up a spoonful of chili and shoved it in Ling's mouth. Unfortunately, Ling's experience of the first bite wasn't quite like Katy's.

"WATER!!" she yelped as she jumped out of her seat and started running around the restaurant frantically searching for something to drink, attracting the attention of everyone in the restaurant. Katy chuckled nervously. She had forgotten that Ling's nature was Timid, giving her a strong repulsion to spicy food.

Suddenly, Toby burst out of the kitchen door, moving surprisingly fast for someone his size. He was carrying a large pitcher of milk. He managed to figure out the circuit that Ling was running, and he planted his large, blubbery body in the middle of it to stop her. Sure enough...

SMACK!

Ling was laying on the floor after literally running into Toby. "Need... water..." she groaned. She got up, snatched up the pitcher of milk that Toby had managed to hold on to this whole time, and started to chug it. Everyone in the restaurant watched in awe as Ling drank the entire pitcher in not even 30 seconds, stopping halfway through to breathe.

"Thanks... Toby..." she said between breaths, placing the glass container back in Toby's meaty hands.

"Uh, you're welcome," Toby replied. "If you want, I can bring you something less spicy."

"I'd... like that..."

Two hours later, they had all finished their chili (and Ling had finished her 2 pound bacon cheeseburger) and they were absolutely stuffed. Well, except for Valerie, she was used to eating this much in one sitting, but she was pretty full. Toby came out of the kitchen and beamed, "How did you like your meals?" All he got was a trio of groans. Valerie giggled and responded, "We liked our meals very much."

Valerie helped her new friends up and out of the restaurant. When they were outside, Valerie asked, "Well, where do you want to go now?"

1553321111111.content:
"I wanna go home," Katy moaned without thinking.

"Oh, you want to go back to my house?" Valerie asked.

Katy looked to her teammates and they nodded. "Sure, why not?"

"Yay!" Valerie rejoiced. "Oh, but I'm not sure you'll be able to walk there; your poor tummies must be fit to burst!"

When they were at Valerie's house, everyone got off, Valerie paid the driver, and he sped off. "Well, we're here!" she beamed.

The inside of Valerie's house was just as sweet as the lady who owned it. The walls of the living room were painted a lovely shade of pink and covered with beautiful landscape paintings. The couch was a deep red with notably wide seats and the coffee table was made of wood covered with ornate designs. Across from the couch, there was an old TV that looked to have been previously discarded.

"Nice house!" Katy noted.

"It's very pretty," murmured Ling.

"Eh, could be better," Truman admitted. All three of them took a seat on the couch.

"So, do you need anything?" Valerie asked.

"Well, we could use a change of clothes," Katy replied, and she was right. Katy wore a skintight orange tank top that showed off her curves very nicely and a pair of perfectly fitting blue jeans. Truman just wore a pair of green sweatpants, leaving his ripped upper half exposed. Ling wore a grey hoodie and blue jeans, both of which were three sizes too big (she held her pants up with a belt, but even the belt was a bit too big). A minute or so later, she returned with three sets of clothes, one for each of them. For Katy, a baby blue T-shirt and denim shorts. For Truman, a heather grey T-shirt and matching sweatpants. For Ling, a white tank top with a symbol on the front (which translated to "sugar," meaning "sweet") and a black mini-skirt. All good outfits, but there was one problem...

Truman got up. "Well, this has been great and all, but we gotta go," he said, heading for the door.

"What's that?" Katy asked.

"WHAT?!" all 3 of them shrieked.

"Yes, it's very upsetting, I know. Our people have tried many times, but no one has made it alive." Her usual mood returned as quickly as it had left. "Look at it this way, though - we can hang out all the time now!"

Somehow, that last sentence didn't cheer them up.

Her dining room, on the other hand, was quite ordinary. The walls were painted forest green and the floors were made of hardwood. "Um, Valerie?" Katy asked. "Why do you have two plates?"

"Oh, this isn't for me," Valerie responded, pointing to the plate next to her. She then placed her hand next to her mouth as if to amplify her voice and hollered, "Kenta, suppertime!"

A few seconds later, a chubby, but adorable, Zangoose boy came into the room. He was about 5'5" and was wearing baby blue pajamas that clung to his somewhat hefty frame. "Who are these guys?" he asked. His voice was notably prepubescent.

"Friends," Valerie began, "this is Kenta."

"Hey," the addressed Zangoose yawned.

"Kenta," she continued, "this is Katy, Truman, and Ling."

Truman perked up. "Wait, how old are you?"

"14," Kenta replied.

"And how old is Valerie?"

"26."

Truman gasped in horror. "S-so that means--"

"I'm adopted, idiot," Kenta replied, rather annoyed at what Truman was implying.

Truman slumped in his seat as he breathed a sigh of relief.

"I found Kenta at the bottom of the slide when he was just a little baby, and I took him in and took care of him," Valerie chimed in.

"You took care of him, alright," Truman chuckled, earning him a punch in the arm from Kenta. "Ow! Little bugger's strong, too..."

"Wait a minute," Katy said. "You said you lived here all by yourself!"

Valerie sighed. "I know, but Kenta here spends so much time in his room, I might as well be living here alone."

Kenta crossed his arms. "I only spend so much time in my room because you never let me do anything," he whined.

"Sit down, Kenta," Valerie said.

Kenta sat down and everyone began eating. That is, everyone except Truman, who was poking his steak listlessly. Valerie stopped for a moment when she noticed that Truman wasn't eating and asked, "Truman, honey, why aren't you eating your food?"

"Oh, I dunno," the Raichu replied without looking up. "I guess I'm just trying to watch my weight."

Valerie gave him a puzzled look. "You're already the image of fitness. Why are you watching your weight? A few extra pounds won't kill you."

Truman shrugged. "It's weird... I feel like there's some sort of rule that prevents me from gaining weight..." He pushed his plate away.

Kenta looked at Truman's plate. "Hey, uh, Truman?" he said awkwardly. "Are you gonna, you know, um--"

"Go ahead and take it," Truman replied. Kenta grinned as he used his fork to scrape the contents of Truman's plate onto his own.

Half an hour later, dinner was over and everyone was full (except Truman, of course, but then again, he was still digesting that chili from earlier).

"So, where are we gonna sleep tonight?" Katy asked.

"Huh? Oh!" Valerie said. "The rooms are upstairs!" She then led Katy, Truman, Ling, and Kenta up the stairs and to a hallway with 4 doors. She waddled up to the door on the far right. "This is the guest bedroom. Ling and Truman will sleep here." Ling and Truman seemed fairly satisfied with that. Valerie then moved on to the second door from the right. "This is Kenta's room. Katy, you will be sleeping with Kenta." Katy and Kenta were happy with that, but Kenta seemed to be a little more than happy. Valerie moved along to the next door down. "This is the bathroom. No one will be sleeping here." She giggled. "That is, if no one breaks into the wine cellar." They all laughed at Valerie's joke.

"What about that room?" Katy asked, pointing at the door at the end of the hallway. "Oh, that's my room," Valerie answered. "Be sure to knock first!"

"That's a lesson I learned the hard way," Kenta shuddered.

Valerie opened the door to her room and stood in the doorway. "Okay, off to bed with you! I'll see you in the morning!" she said as she closed the door.

Ling and Truman went into their room, and Kenta started to head toward his own room, but Katy stopped next to the bathroom. Kenta turned around. "You okay, Katy?"

"Yeah, I, uh, have to use it," she replied.

"Oh, I'll just wait for you out here then," he said, leaning on the wall.

"Uh, okay." Katy headed into the bathroom. When she was inside, she started to search for a bathroom scale. She found one under the toilet, pulled it out, and stepped on it. The dial spun around and stopped on...

"273," Katy sighed. The last time she weighed herself, she was 268 pounds. Had she really gained 5 pounds in one day? No, the last time she weighed herself was about three months ago, before she had started on her and her team's quest for treasure. She had probably just gained the weight over the 3 month period. But then again, on her quest, she rarely ate and did a lot of walking. Maybe she had lost weight during her quest. Maybe it was more than 5 pounds! Katy decided to drop the subject as she stepped down from the scale and pushed it back under the toilet.

When she left the bathroom, Kenta was still outside the bathroom, occupying himself by picking at a loose thread on his pajamas. "Oh, you're done!" he said, looking up. "I didn't hear a flush though..."

"Well, you know what they say," Katy chuckled nervously. "If it's yellow, let it mellow." Kenta stuck his tongue out in disgust.

Kenta's room looked to be quite big, but that was because it was mostly empty. There was a walk-in closet on the far side of the room. The bed was a queen-size bed and was right in the middle of the room, and in one corner, there was a computer on a desk. Katy caught a glimpse of the computer screen - it had been left on a website full of pictures of Pokemon women of about Katy's size and shape. She couldn't get a good enough look at it before Kenta hastily closed out of it.

"So, what do you think?" Kenta asked.

"It's nice," Katy replied. She then began to slip out of her clothes, starting with her shoes and socks, then her blue jeans, and finally taking off her shirt, ending up in her underwear. She then turned to Kenta, who was turning a shade of scarlet. "Oh, man, I forgot, this isn't my room." She giggled, causing Kenta to blush even brighter.

"D-do you always s-sleep like th-this?" Kenta stuttered.

"Not since I left home," Katy replied. "I just feel more comfortable undressed." Kenta was as red as a tomato at this point.

After the awkward moment subsided, Katy and Kenta crawled into bed and turned out the light. Katy was about to drift off to sleep when...

15533211111111111.content:
The next morning, Katy woke up to see Kenta still sleeping on her stomach. She giggled. "Come on, Kenta, wake up..."

"Oh... what time is it..." Kenta moaned as he got off of Katy's belly.

"7:40," Katy answered, looking at the alarm clock next to the bed.

Kenta jumped up. "What?! Oh, man, we're gonna be late for school!" He ran over to his closet, threw off his pajamas, and began frantically searching for something to wear.

Katy cocked her head. "School? We?"

"How old are you?"

"17."

"Then, yes, we!"

"Oh, my gosh!" She jumped up and quickly slipped on her clothes. By this time, Kenta had found something to wear and put it on. He had chosen a snug red T-shirt with a white paw print on it and a pair of black jeans (like blue jeans but black, they exist) that was tight around his butt, showing off his plump rear end.

Katy caught herself staring at Kenta's ass as he was walking out the door. The way it bounced in his form-fitting pants was hypnotic. Knowing Katy was checking him out, he turned around and giggled. "Are we gonna go to school, or are you just gonna stare at my butt all day?"

Katy snapped out of it. "Oh, y-yeah, let's go." Kenta grabbed his backpack and left out of his room, Katy following.

When they passed by Truman and Ling's room, Truman was sitting in the hall just outside the room, looking like he didn't get a second of sleep.

"Whoa, what happened?" Kenta asked.

"Trust me, you don't want to know," Truman answered. "But whatever you do, don't grab Ling's butt. Please, for the love of Mew, don't grab her butt!"

It didn't take long for Katy and Kenta to put 2 and 2 together. "You grabbed her butt, didn't you?" Katy smirked. Truman just burst into tears.

Kenta opened up Ling's door. "Ling, wake up!" He walked in. Ling was nowhere to be found.
"Ling? Are you--"

"YAHH!!" Suddenly, Kenta found himself pinned to the ground by a girl half his size. It was a little humiliating, actually.

"Get off me!" Kenta barked, pushing Ling off of him.

"Oh, I-I'm sorry," Ling mumbled. "I thought y-you were someone else. You see--"

"Yeah, I know what happened." He got up, dusted himself off, and helped Ling up. "It's good to see you're already dressed. We gotta get to school!"

"S-s-school?" Ling quavered.

"Yeah, school. Come on, let's go." Kenta pulled on Ling's arm, but she wouldn't budge. She was just staring into space.

"Uh, Ling, are you okay?"

"I... I'm n-not a sh-shrimp..."

"What? What are--"

"S-stop... STOP! STOP! LEAVE ME ALONE!!" She was crying at this point.

He turned to the door. "Katy, Ling's being weird!"

"I'M NOT WEIRD!!"

Katy rushed in and hugged Ling. "Don't worry, Ling," she cooed. "They're just trying to make you mad. Don't listen to them." Ling pulled away and wiped a tear away from her cheek. Katy smiled. "Do you feel better now?"

Ling sniffled. "Yeah..." She returned the smile.

Katy and Ling walked out of the room, Kenta following. Kenta had been watching the whole thing with a very puzzled look. "What... just happened?" he said to himself

Katy heard him and sighed. "It's a loooong story..."


On the way to school, Katy asked Kenta, "So, how long do you have to go to school?"

"You start when you're 5, and you graduate when you're 20," Kenta replied.

"Yikes! So you go to school for 15 years?"

Kenta chuckled and put his hands behind his head. "Yeah, but it's real lax. You only have to go 6 hours a day, 4 days a week - Tuesday to Friday."

"Oh. What's today?"

"Tuesday."

Just then, they arrived at school. It was 7:55. "Alright!" Kenta said. "We have just enough time to get you all registered!" They hustled to the office, where a busty Wartortle lady was at the counter.

"Can I help you?" she said. She looked up to see Kenta. "Oh, yes, Mr. Paxton. The principal's office is down that hall."

"Very funny, Ms. Wadsworth. I'm here to register my friends," Kenta replied. Katy and Ling smiled and waved.

"Very well," Ms. Wadsworth said. She walked into a room in the back of the office, motioning for Katy and Ling to follow.

Inside the room was a desk with a computer, one office chair for the desk, and two normal chairs (normal being a comparative term, the chairs were actually rather wide). The room itself was a bit small. Katy and Ling sat in the chairs while Ms. Wadsworth sat at the computer. "Names?" she asked.

"Katy Rhodes."

"Ling Greene."

"Ages?"

"17."

"16."

"Legal guardians?"

"Um..."

Katy and Ling huddled. After a few minutes, they turned back to Ms. Wadsworth. "Valerie Paxton," Katy answered.

"Oh, I see." It was going to take a lot to convince Ms. Wadsworth that Katy and Ling weren't troublemakers like Kenta. "Address?"

"240 Freshwater Avenue," Ling responded. She had a keen eye and had noticed Valerie's address.

"Okay, you're all set," Ms. Wadsworth said. She handed them each a sheet of paper. "Here are your schedules." Just then, the bell rang. "Well, off you go!" Katy and Ling got up and were just about to get out the door. "Oh, and one more thing," she added. Katy and Ling turned around.

"Stay out of trouble, okay?"

Katy and Ling met Kenta outside the room. "Oh, my gosh!" he gushed. "Are you okay? She didn't hurt you, did she?"

Katy giggled. "Yes, we're okay. Sheesh, why are you acting so weird?"

"Ms. Wadsworth is brutal," he replied. "I heard she once suspended a kid because he looked at her boobs."

"That IS brutal," Ling remarked.

Kenta changed the subject. "So, what classes do you have for today?"

Katy read her schedule. "Gym, art, math, history."

Ling followed suit. "Science, reading, math, free period." She held her schedule to her average-sized chest. "Wow, I've never had a free period!"

"Wow, my schedule is gym, science, math, art!" Kenta beamed. "That means me and Katy have first block together, and we all have third block together! This is gonna be great!"

Katy and Ling smiled. You just couldn't help but smile when Kenta was happy like that.

Katy and Kenta talked a bit on their way to the gym. "So, Kenta," Katy asked, "how are students divided up?"

"Hmm?" Kenta replied.

"You know, like grades?"

"Oh yeah! There's early elementary, ages 5 to 6; late elementary, 7 to 10; intermediate, 11 to 13; junior, 14 to 17; and senior, 18 to 20. Fun fact: elementary used to be 5 to 10, but then they split it up when they realized how drastically different 5-year-olds are from 10-year-olds."

Katy giggled. She now had the thought in her mind of a 10-year-old playing with alphabet blocks.

"Well, we're here!" Kenta outstretched his arms as if to present the gym to Katy. "Let's go in, shall we?"

The gym was your ordinary run-of-the-mill high school gym. It was filled with teenagers of all body types. There were two circuits of children running around the gym. The ones on the inner circuit were jogging at a leisurely pace as a slender but healthy Quilava lady looked on. As Katy watched the kids led by the Quilava coach, a tubby Leafeon boy that had been running waddled up to the coach. He was panting heavily and sweat was dripping from his face.

"Hey... coach..." he said between pants. "Can I... take... a breather...?"

He's always smuggling some sort of snack food into the school.

He had a whistle dangling around his neck and the most sour look on his face you could imagine. A familiar Pignite was running the outer circuit, the circuit Coach Harris was in charge of. A few kids on the outer circuit whimpered. Coach Harris just waddled over to the Pignite boy, kicked him, and yelled, "Quit lazing around, maggot! You've still got another 4 minutes to go!"

Katy whistled. "Wow, I'd hate to have to be Coach Harris' student! That must suck!"

"Oh, you poor thing!" Katy gave Kenta a pity hug.

Kenta pulled away. "You should check your schedule to see who you have."

"Good idea," Katy said. She looked at her schedule and, under the word "Gym," she saw, in italicized letters...

Katy drifted off to sleep without event... and found herself in a black void. There was a bright flash.

There was a face that presented itself to Katy. It wasn't like any face Katy had ever seen before - this was a human face!

The human seemed to be in his mid-teens. He had curly dark brown hair that was thick, but not necessarily long - his bangs were long though. The overgrown bangs led to two big blue-green eyes with sacks under them. Obviously, this human didn't get enough sleep. His nose was a normal human nose with a cute little mole on the right side. His lips were curled into a gentle smile, but even the slightest smirk accentuated his chubby, rosy cheeks. There was a white glow surrounding him.

Suddenly, he spoke in a soft whisper.

"Hello, Katy."

Katy was absolutely awestruck. "Who are you?"

"I am your creator, Katy. Your author, if you will." He was starting to speak up now.

"Are you... God?"

He chuckled. "I suppose you could call me that."

There was a long period of silence. Katy tried to talk, but nothing came out of her mouth. Suddenly, there was a low rumbling that slowly got louder.

"I'm coming, Katy," the human said as the rumbling was starting to get very loud. "Now wake up."

The rumbling got so loud it was almost deafening. "Wake up, Katy! Wake up!" the human urged, his voice somehow louder than the rumbling.

"WAKE UP!"

Katy shot up. She was breathing heavily and sweating profusely. She looked at the alarm clock next to the bed. It was 1:00 pm. Had she really slept for 16 hours?

Her mind was racing, and her heart was tagging along. What was she to do?
